title: Software Developer
description:
Professional Galaxy söker nu driven och kompetent mjukvaruutvecklare med intresse och erfarenhet av inbyggda system för att förstärka vårt mjukvaruteam inom Fighter Core Capabilities.
   

  

 Som mjukvaruutvecklare hos kund kommer du att jobba med att utveckla mjukvara för fällare som används som självskydd på stridsflygplan. Arbetet sker i agila team enligt SCRUM-metodik där vi delar med oss av vår kunskap och tillåter frihet under ansvar.
   

  

**Vi söker någon som har:**
* Universitetsexamen i relevant disciplin eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet.
* Goda kunskaper i C++ programmering (C++ 03)
* Erfarenhet av inbyggda system
* Erfarenhet av att jobba med krav skrivning
* Erfarenhet av att jobba med design
* Behärskar svenska och engelska flytande


 Nivå 3: från 3-8 års erfarenhet
   

  

 Nivå 4: från 8-12 års erfarenhet
   

  

**Det är också meriterande om man har följande:**
* Erfarenhet av att jobba med mjukvaruarkitektur
* Erfarenhet av att designa, utveckla och implementera automatiska tester
* Vana av att jobba i regulatorisk miljö


**Startdatum:** 
 2026-02-02
   

  

**Slutdatum:** 
 Open
   

  

**Ansökan:**
 I motiveringen beskriv varför just du är lämplig för detta uppdrag - hänvisa till tidigare konsultuppdrag, anställningar, utbildningar och personliga egenskaper.
   

  

 Sista ansökningsdatum är 2025-12-31. Vi offererar dock ofta löpande. Är du intresserad av ett uppdrag rekommenderar vi dig att ansöka omgående.

title: Fullstack Developer .NET
description:
Odevo is a group of exciting brands with a shared vision of challenging status quo in the property management industry. We are committed to revolutionizing the industry with innovative software solutions that make managing properties easier, more efficient, and more effective. Our rapidly growing product and engineering organization now includes around 200 highly skilled professionals.
   

  

 Our cloud-based platform is unique, and in a brief time, we have proven ourselves as a leading and innovative player on the market. Our product development department acts as a SaaS supplier to all the companies in the Odevo group and several other players in the industry. Together, we will continue to challenge and change this industry. To continue our ambitious growth journey, we seek more great people to join us to build market-leading property management software products. Are you one of them?
   

  

**About The Role**
 We’re looking for a skilled and experienced Fullstack Developer to join our team. In this role, you’ll be involved in the design, development, and maintenance of sophisticated software applications. You’ll play a key role in advancing our Financial Crime application services for clients in the UK market.
   

  

**Your Main Responsibilities Will Include**
* Design, develop, and maintain web applications using modern front-end and back-end technologies.
* Collaborate with designers, product owners, and other developers to ensure that the application meets business requirements and is user-friendly.
* Write clean, modular, and well-documented code that is easy to maintain and scale.
* Conduct code reviews to ensure code quality and consistency.
* Work in a multicultural team to troubleshoot and resolve software defects and issues.
* Debug and fix issues as they arise and continuously improve the performance and reliability of the application.
* Stay up to date with new technologies, frameworks, and industry trends to ensure that our applications are built with the latest best practices.


**Who You Are**
 You have excellent communication and collaboration skills, allowing you to work effectively within a team and contribute to the success of projects. You thrive in an environment where you can embrace new challenges, collaborate closely with team members, and deliver high-quality software solutions. You believe open-mindedness and a willingness to learn from others are essential for personal and team growth. You are a Swedish citizen with fluency in English.
   

  

**Experience**
* 2+ years of software development experience, focusing on full-stack development.
* Strong experience with programming in C#, .Net Core and Azure functions
* Experience in MySQL and Azure storage accounts
* Experience in modern front-end frameworks, preferably in Blazor with Mudblazor.
* Experience in agile development methodologies.


**What We Offer**
* Professional growth - to work with the most talented developers in the industry.
* Modern technology - we invest in the latest technologies and tools and encourage our team members to share their ideas and take ownership of their work.
* Innovation - to work on exciting projects that push the boundaries of our industry and make a real impact.
* Commitment to quality - a dynamic and forward-thinking company that values profitable and long-term product development.


****Location****

 Stockholm
   

  

**Excited?**
 If you are excited about being part of a successful team, apply for this position!
   

  

 👉🏽 Why we formed Odevo
   

  

 🔍 About Odevo
   

  

 🌐 Our Software
   

  

 #a

title: Full Stack Developer
description:
As a Full Stack Developer in our Procurement Team, you’ll play a key role in improving one of the most business critical parts of Proceedo. the flow where thousands of users create, manage, and confirm their purchases every day. If you want to work end-to-end, learn fast, and build meaningful features in a large-scale SaaS product, this is the place.
 



  





 This role uniquely combines test automation and full stack development, giving you a rare opportunity to understand the system deeply while growing your technical skills with the support of an experienced team.
 



  





**What you’ll do** 




 To continue developing and improving our service, we are now looking for a full stack developer to join our Procurement Team. A typical week mixes front-end and back-end development, along with smart test automation.
 



  





 Key responsibilities
 


* Build and maintain features in both Java and Angular
* Write automated tests using the Java RestAssured
* Contribute to key flows in Proceedo such as requisitions, orders, confirmations, and supplier interactions
* Collaborate closely with your teammates to deliver stable, scalable solutions
* Continuously improve our processes, code base, and technical foundations



  





 You’ll start by focusing on automated tests and smaller development tasks—supported by the team—before taking on broader and more complex areas.
 



  





**What we’re looking for** 




 We’re looking for a developer with a few years of hands-on development experience who wants to grow into a full-fledged full stack developer.
 



  





 You have:
 


* Experience working with Java and angular
* Experience working in agile teams and with modern development tools (Git, REST, OOP)
* A relevant education, such as a bachelor’s degree in computer science (or equivalent)
* A proven interest in AI and curiosity about new tools and technologies
* Familiarity with writing automated tests (RestAssured is a plus)



  





 You don't need to know everything from day one, we are looking for a colleague with a curiosity, the ability to learn quickly, and a drive to build high-quality software.
 



 Who you are
 



  





 You’re structured in your work and good at organizing your tasks. Switching between writing automated tests and building new features requires planning and follow-through, and you enjoy working in a way that keeps things moving.
 



  





 We will carry out background checks on applicants to verify information that appears on CVs and other documentation. This background check is carried out by an external party and is not carried out without the consent of the applicant.
 



  





**Why Proceedo?** 




 This is an exceptional place to grow as a developer. Because you’ll work with both automation and development, you’ll learn faster than in many traditional roles.
 



  





 At Proceedo, we’re kind to each other. We work hard, but we also respect your personal time. You get the stability and benefits of a large company like Visma, combined with a small-team feeling where your ideas matter and your work has a clear impact.
 



  





 Our leadership is supportive, we collaborate openly, and we continuously explore new technologies to build a smarter, more scalable product.
 



  





 If you want to join a team that values craft, clarity, and curiosity and you’re ready to grow your skills in a real SaaS environment we’d love to meet you.
 



 We will carry out background checks on applicants to verify information that appears on CVs and other documentation. The check is performed by an external partner and only with the applicant’s consent.

title: Software Engineer
description:
Sinch is a global customer engagement platform that provides communication services for businesses across messaging, voice, and email. Sinch's services are used by more than 150,000 businesses, including many of the world's largest tech companies.
 



**ABOUT SINCH** 




 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses - including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others - rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
 



 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
 



 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
 



**DESCRIPTION** 




 We are looking for a versatile Software Engineer to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will work closely with engineers, product managers, and stakeholders to design, develop, maintain, and support high-quality, scalable software solutions to meet customer needs.
 



 You will be an integral part of a collaborative team that embraces agile methodologies and values clean coding practices. Creativity and innovation are key, and we believe that every team member's input is vital for delivering exceptional communication solutions.
 



 This hybrid role based in Stockholm and reports to the Senior Engineering Manager.
 



**As our Software Engineer, you will:** 



* Design, develop, test, and maintain software applications and systems.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features.
* Troubleshoot and debug applications to optimize performance and enhance user experience.
* Contribute to all phases of the development lifecycle, from concept to implementation.
* Ensure performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications.
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
* Proven experience as a Software Engineer.
* Good understanding of software development methodologies (Agile, Scrum, etc.).
* Strong proficiency in Java programming languages.
* Experience of REST APIs.
* Knowledge of Kubernetes, cloud technologies, CI/CD, automation, and pipelines.
* Experience in Apache Kafka.
* Familiarity with version control systems, such as Git.



**REQUIREMENTS** 




 You are a problem-solver with keen attention to detail, strong communication skills, and a proven ability to collaborate effectively in team environments. We believe you are strong in Java but also willing to accept not to program in Java if that is the current need. You learn new domains quickly and are willing to take on and complete assignments in new areas as needed. You are creative and think outside the box but also understand when there is a need to stay within the box when reality so demands.
 


* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
* Proven experience as a Software Engineer.
* Good understanding of software development methodologies (Agile, Scrum, etc.).
* Strong proficiency in Java programming languages.
* Experience of REST APIs.
* Knowledge of Kubernetes, cloud technologies, CI/CD, automation, and pipelines.
* Experience in Apache Kafka.
* Familiarity with version control systems, such as Git.



 Our corporate language is English, please submit your application in
 **English.** 




 At Sinch, we value learning, embrace change, and offer opportunities for personal and professional growth. Unfortunately, we are not supporting relocation at this time.
 



 Applicants must:
 


* Hold Swedish or EU/EEA citizenship.
* Have a valid Swedish work permit.



**OUR HIRING PROCESS** 




 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
 



 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!
   




**Desired Skills and Experience**
 Java
   

 Software Engineer
   

 Software Development
   

 REST APIs
   

 Kubernetes
   

 Cloud Platforms
   

 CI/CD
   

 Apache Kafka
   

 Git
   

 Agile

title: Unity Developer Intern [Remote]
description:
**About XR Solutions** 




 XR Solutions is a technology-driven company pioneering
 **machine learning-powered augmented reality solutions** 
 for industrial clients.
 



 Our mission is to revolutionize how machines are operated, maintained, and optimized — enabling workflows and innovations that were once impossible. We combine research-based optimizations with cutting-edge AR technology to create
 **practical, reliable, and high-performance solutions** 
 that reshape industries.
 



 This internship offers a rare opportunity to
 **build backend systems that directly power advanced AR applications** 
 used in real-world industrial environments.
 



  





**Role Overview** 




 We’re looking for a
 **passionate, detail-oriented Unity Developer Intern** 
 with a strong interest in XR interaction and immersive technologies.
 



 While the internship is
 **initially unpaid** 
 , outstanding performance could lead to a
 **future paid opportunity** 
 .
 



  





**What You’ll Do** 



* Collaborate with developers on
 **XR features** 
 and infrastructure
* Design, develop, and test interactive UI/UX for AR applications
* Integrate and support backend systems and services
* Conduct research into AR technologies, including hardware like
 **HMDs**
* Contribute to product design and optimization ahead of our first pilot launch
* Help solve complex, real-world challenges using cutting-edge tools



  





**What You’ll Gain** 



* Hands-on experience building XR applications used in industry
* Deep exposure to
 **Unity** 
 ,
 **ARKit** 
 , and backend systems integration
* Real-world application of UI/UX principles in immersive environments
* Insight into the full development lifecycle of AR products
* A chance to work on a product preparing for its first commercial deployment
* Experience in a collaborative, startup-style tech environment



  





**What We’re Looking For** 



* Proficiency in
 **Unity** 
 and
 **ARKit**
* Proficiency in
 **C#**
* Experience with
 **3D modeling** 
 tools (e.g., Blender, Maya)
* Knowledge of
 **Figma** 
 for UI/UX design
* Passion for XR, AR, and immersive technologies
* Familiarity with
 **Xcode** 
 and
 **HMDs** 
 (head-mounted displays) is a plus



  





  





 If you’re excited about this opportunity and eager to learn, please send your resume outlining your interest in the position. We look forward to helping you grow your skills and advance your career in backend development.

title: Software Engineer - Language Systems
description:
**Why join us?**
 We’re on a mission to empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. As the world-leader in assistive communication solutions, we empower our customers to express themselves, connect with the world, and live richer lives.
   

  

 At Tobii Dynavox, you can grow your career within a dynamic, global company that has a clear, impactful purpose - with the flexibility to also do what truly matters to you outside of work. What’s more, you’ll be part of a work culture where collaboration is the norm and individuality is welcomed.
   

  

 As a member of our team, you’ll have the power to innovate for good. You’ll see your ideas in use in new applications, work with the latest technology on leading platforms, and deliver meaningful solutions for our customers.
   

  

**About the Role:**
 As a
 **Software Engineer for Language Systems** 
 , you will join a team that develops innovative mobile and desktop applications in a complex, cross-platform environment. Our work is centered on improving assistive communication tools, ensuring that individuals with disabilities can effectively express themselves. You will contribute to the evolution of our language models, improve our software architecture, and work with experts in linguistics, speech-language pathology, and machine learning to refine and advance our solutions.
   

  

**In this role, you will:**
* Design, develop, and deploy products across multiple operating systems.
* Contribute to the development and improvement of application language models.
* Explore, evaluate, recommend, and process language data sources.
* Assist in implementing and optimizing natural language data processing tools.
* Work closely with linguists and speech-language pathologists to enhance communication technologies.
* Modularize architectural components to maximize scalability and minimize code duplication.
* Contribute to architectural and API improvements.
* Debug and analyze code issues using static analysis and platform-specific debugging tools.
* Implement clear and well-documented APIs for use in higher-level code.
* Follow and advocate for best coding practices within the team.


**What We're Looking For:**
* A B.S. in Computer Science/Engineering or equivalent experience (1-3 years in software engineering).
* A strong background in linguistics, natural language processing (NLP), or a related field.
* Preferably 1+ years of experience working with C#, Python, and SQL.
* Proficiency in object-oriented languages such as C#, C++, Java, or Objective-C.
* Familiarity with NLP and machine learning libraries (NLTK, NumPy, TensorFlow, PyTorch, spaCy, etc.).
* Experience working in Linux environments, particularly with a command-line interface (CLI) and shell scripting.
* Working knowledge of regular expressions.
* Prior experience with localization processes.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Excel for data management.


 If you are passionate about language, technology, and empowering individuals through communication, we’d love to hear from you!
   

  

 Apply today!
   

  

 We believe in empowering individuals - including our own employees - to reach their full potential. So, if you want to change lives while growing your own career, we’d love to hear from you.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
**Role Overview** 




 We are looking for a highly experienced
 **Senior Operations Engineer (VMware)** 
 to support and manage a large-scale private cloud platform. This role requires deep expertise in VMware technologies, automation, Windows administration, and high-security environment operations. The engineer will handle end-to-end platform operations, troubleshooting, and continuous improvement of VMware-based infrastructure.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 




**VMware & Infrastructure Operations** 



* Operate and maintain VMware environments including
 **ESX, NSX-T, vSAN, and vRealize** 
 .
* Support VMware tools and integrated applications.
* Configure and maintain
 **firewall rules** 
 and exceptions.
* Manage daily operations of a private cloud platform.



**Automation & Scripting** 



* Develop automation scripts to streamline operational tasks.
* Automate workflows, monitoring routines, and routine system processes.
* Maintain internal dashboards, portals, and configuration databases.



**Incident & Problem Management** 



* Provide
 **2nd and 3rd level incident support** 
 , including root cause analysis.
* Troubleshoot and resolve complex system and platform issues.
* Create knowledge base articles and technical documentation.



**System Development & Quality Improvement** 



* Support the implementation and setup of new systems.
* Improve documentation standards and configuration management processes.
* Ensure adherence to
 **security, compliance, and legal requirements** 
 .



**Collaboration & Communication** 



* Work closely with architects, security experts, and cross-functional teams.
* Communicate effectively with stakeholders and internal teams.
* Support and guide junior engineers when needed.



  





**Mandatory Skills & Experience** 




**Core Technical Skills** 



* Expert-level knowledge of:
* **VMware ESX**
* **NSX-T**
* **vSAN**
* **vRealize**
* Strong
 **Windows Server administration** 
 skills.
* Hands-on experience with automation tools:
* **Ansible**
* **SaltStack**
* **VBScript**
* **PowerShell**
* **.NET**
* Experience configuring and managing
 **firewall rules** 
 .
* Background working in
 **high-security environments** 
 .



**Operational Experience** 



* **10+ years** 
 in IT infrastructure / operations roles.
* Proven experience working with
 **private cloud platforms** 
 .

title: Backend Developer
description:
**About TOTEME**
 TOTEME is a fashion house rooted in Swedish sensibilities, modern aspirations and the notion of style. With an appreciation for women’s many roles and how pieces are worn in practice, we create emblematic designs with an emphasis on materiality and shape. Representing a direct and decisive way of dressing, the collections are contextualized in curated edits, visuals and spaces. The company is rooted in values that promote the wellbeing of people, animals, and the planet.
   

  

 TOTEME was founded in 2014 by Elin Kling and Karl Lindman. From the atelier in Stockholm, we create collections spanning ready-to-wear, shoes, bags, accessories and jewelry.
   

  

**The Role**
 TOTEME is looking for a Backend Developer to join our Tech team in Stockholm full-time. In this role you will work across systems and teams to design and maintain integrations that power everything from retail operations to ecommerce and customer experiences. You will play a key role in developing and managing the backend processes that connect our third-party SaaS platforms, ensuring data and workflows flow smoothly across the business. You will report to the Head of Technology and work closely with colleagues from across the organization on both ongoing improvements and new initiatives.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Develop and maintain integrations in Microsoft Azure, ensuring functionality, reliability, and performance.
* Deliver scalable, readable, and maintainable code in C#, .NET, PowerShell, ARM, and Bicep.
* Maintain and develop CI/CD pipelines.
* Maintain high-quality standards for all developed integrations and features, ensuring they perform efficiently and are bug-free.
* Drive discussions on technical architecture, proposing solutions that enhance scalability, performance, and security.
* Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to align technical initiatives with business objectives.
* Release integrations and patches seamlessly without any downtime.
* Contribute to TOTEME’s social and environmental sustainability strategy.


**Your Profile**
* Solid experience with C#, .NET, and Microsoft Azure, including cloud-based development and version control (preferably Git).
* Proven ability to develop and maintain integrations between SaaS systems, with skills in API development and database management.
* Background in e-commerce or retail systems (ERP, PIM, CRM, or similar) is a strong advantage.
* Comfortable working in an agile environment, with flexibility and a solution-oriented mindset.
* Fluent in written and spoken English.


**About You**
* A TOTEME ambassador who identifies with our culture and values.
* A collaborative communicator who enjoys working cross-functionally.
* Analytical and curious, with a problem-solving mindset.
* Excited about building reliable and scalable technical solutions that make real business impact.


 This is a full-time position based at TOTEME's headquarters in Stockholm with a start date as soon as possible.
   

  

 TOTEME has teams in Stockholm, London, and New York, as well as retail spaces across Europe, North America, and Asia. As a member of our dynamic, creative, and highly collaborative team, you will take part in exciting projects and milestones, evolving within your role as you contribute to the company’s growth.
   

  

 TOTEME stands for inclusivity and a sense of belonging in the workplace. We welcome all applicants and recruit on the basis of skills and experience.
   

  

*By applying to this position I agree with TOTEME’s privacy policy and to be contacted about future job opportunities for up to 2 years from the submission date. Find out more about our privacy policy here.*

title: Software Engineer
description:
**Description & Requirements**
 Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.
   

  

 Frostbite is EA’s proprietary game engine that comes equipped with tons of tools designed to build incredible games. Our in-house engine offers the unique ability to adapt to each game while working hand-in-hand to prioritize what to build. Our goal is to empower creators all over the world to bring their best ideas to life by creating an engine that amplifies innovation across every discipline.
   

  

 Reporting to the Development Director, you will be a part of an accomplished diverse team developing the tools and game engine behind the amazing worlds you see in Frostbite games. Your work will include the workflows and systems for building levels and objects in Frostbite. In the team we collaborate to make sure game teams around the world have great workflows and a flexible engine for building their games. This is an in-office/hybrid remote role.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Write high-quality code and review technical designs and code written by other Software Engineers
* Design and implement systems and APIs used by thousands of game developers across EA
* Improve workflows, data builds and game systems for handling huge amount of game objects
* Improve usability, performance and stability to power our users to create stunning games
* Participate in team discussions, knowledge sharing and share your insights with team members
* Collaborate with other Frostbite teams and game teams to ensure world class workflows and in-game performance


**Qualifications**
* You have at least 5+ years experience with C++/C# and software architecture skills
* You are curious and succeed in a learning culture
* You have experience with test automation
* You have experience with software design patterns including data-oriented design and entity-component-systems
* You have experience with game engines such as Unreal, Unity or other engines


 Aside from great benefits, EA offers perks you won’t find elsewhere. As a company that inspires the world to play, we start by empowering our people to do the same.
   

  

**About Electronic Arts**
 We’re proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.
   

  

 We adopt a holistic approach to our benefits programs, emphasizing physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life. Our packages are tailored to meet local needs and may include healthcare coverage, mental well-being support, retirement savings, paid time off, family leaves, complimentary games, and more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.
   

  

 Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.

title: C++ Developer - Mission Execution (Adaptive AUTOSAR)
description:
TRATON is a group of strong brands with a shared mission: transforming transportation together to create the future of sustainable transport solutions. Our portfolio includes MAN, Scania, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International. As part of a global team of industry experts, you will think bigger, experience more, and reach further — together we have the power to transform transportation.
   

  

 Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – guide everything we do.
   

  

**Role Summary**
 Join the Mission Execution team within Transport Efficiency at TRATON Group R&D. We operate with a startup mentality inside a global organization: delivery-focused, curious, and fast-moving. Our team develops intelligent embedded services for driving efficiency, ADAS-related decision logic, and mission planning, enabling vehicles to execute energy-efficient and predictable transport missions.
   

  

 We work with a customer-first and UX-research-driven approach, using early prototypes, rapid feedback loops, and customer pilots to shape the solutions that go into vehicles across the TRATON brands.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
* Develop vehicle on board services in modern C++
* Implement and extend Adaptive AUTOSAR applications within mission execution
* Interface between real-time embedded systems, cloud applications, and cross-platform Adaptive AUTOSAR components
* Work in a highly cross-functional environment spanning driving efficiency, ADAS, routing, energy optimization, vehicle testing, and cloud engineering
* Contribute across the full development cycle: concept, architecture, implementation, testing, performance validation, and deployment
* Use early pilots and customer feedback to validate ideas quickly and guide development
* Explore and evaluate new technologies that advance sustainable and intelligent transport solutions


**Who You Are**
 You thrive at the intersection of embedded engineering, customer value, and rapid iteration. You enjoy exploratory, delivery-oriented work and want to build intelligent software that influences real transport missions and contributes to all Traton brands extensive sustainability goals.
   

  

**Required:**
* Skilled in modern C++
* Solid experience with Python
* Hands-on experience with Adaptive AUTOSAR
* Comfortable working with cloud-connected applications
* Motivated by fast learning cycles, UX insights, and customer feedback
* Master’s degree (or equivalent) in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or similar


**Bonus experience:**
* Linux containers and container tools (Podman, Docker, etc.)
* Enterprise Linux (e.g., Red Hat)
* CI/CD pipelines and modern C++ tooling
* MATLAB/Simulink
* Driving efficiency, ADAS systems, or energy-aware vehicle control


**This Is Us**
 We are the Mission Execution & Range Prediction unit within Transport Efficiency – an entrepreneurial team within TRATON Group R&D. Our focus is on driving efficiency, ADAS-related mission logic, range prediction, real-time decision and supporting planning services used in daily transport operations.
   

  

 We collaborate closely with teams across route planning, driver support, vehicle energy optimization, UX, cloud engineering, and vehicle testing. Our culture emphasizes continuous learning, experimentation, and early validation with customers.
   

  

**TRATON Offers**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, TRATON Group R&D supports your career growth locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include wellness allowance, bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. We also host events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and strive for diversity throughout our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible; screening takes place continuously. Logical and personality tests may be part of the process, and a background check may be required.
   

  

 For questions, please contact:
   

  

 Marcus Engman, Unit Manager – marcus.engman@se.traton.com

title: Lead React Native Developer
description:
**Do you enjoy taking the complexity of cross-platform development and turning it into something clear, elegant, and reliable? The kind of person who can see the big picture, untangle tricky technical decisions, and still get joy from polishing the details that make an app feel truly great? At Framna, we are looking for a Lead React Native Developer who can guide teams through those decisions, balancing user experience, performance, and platform quirks, while still loving hands-on coding. You will help set the technical direction, unlock teammates, and shape products used by millions.** 




  





**Become part of the team** 




  





 Framna partners with some of the world’s most ambitious brands, like Swish, SJ, Essity, and SEB, to create digital products that define markets and deliver real-world impact. We are now more than 600 people across ten studios, building apps used by millions every day.
 



 As our next Lead React Native Developer, you will be part of a cross-functional product team of designers, developers, QA engineers, analysts, and product leads who take ideas from first concept to real-world product. You will also take on a broader role, guiding technical decisions, coaching teammates, and ensuring the team builds with both quality and long-term thinking in mind.
 



  





 On top of that you will contribute to our Cross Platform competence area, a company-wide group where app developers meet regularly to exchange knowledge, deepen their skills, and grow professionally together.
 



  





**What you’ll do** 




  





 This role blends hands-on engineering, technical direction, and supporting your teammates to deliver high-quality product experiences.
 



  





 More specifically, you will:
 


* Build and maintain React Native applications used by millions of users.
* Write high-quality TypeScript and ensure your features work beautifully across both Android and iOS. To do this, we embrace and utilize both your expertise as well as AI-powered tooling.
* Drive architectural and technical decisions, ensuring solutions are robust, scalable, and maintainable.
* Collaborate closely with designers and product teams to bring concepts to life with smooth UI, thoughtful interactions, and polished app behavior.
* Navigate platform-specific challenges, and help the team understand when (and how) to leverage native modules.
* Lead technical discussions, guide trade-offs, and bring clarity when decisions get complex.
* Support teammates through code reviews, coaching, pairing, and sharing knowledge across the Cross Platform competence area.
* Work directly with partners and stakeholders to clarify needs, shape solutions, and communicate progress clearly.



  





**Who you are** 




  





 We think you will thrive here if you enjoy variety, care about quality, and love the craft of mobile development, both in your own work and in helping others grow. You might recognise yourself if you:
 


* Have several years of professional mobile development experience across Android, iOS, and/or React Native.
* Feel confident building React Native features end-to-end and guiding others when needed.
* Work comfortably in TypeScript and enjoy exploring how the platforms behave under the hood.
* Can lead technical decisions, simplify complexity, and frame trade-offs clearly.
* Enjoy collaborating with designers, product leads, and partners, and you communicate with clarity.
* Like mentoring, coaching, or uplifting teammates, formally or informally.
* Feel comfortable taking ownership, shaping direction, and ensuring that what the team builds is both high-quality and long-lived.
* Care about shipping great products and making users’ everyday lives easier.



  





**About Framna** 




  





 Framna means ‘to bring forward’ in Old Norse. And that is exactly what we do. We partner with industry leaders (and those about to be) to create excellent digital products that define markets, reshape industries, and deliver meaningful impact.
 



  





 Born from the union of digital agencies Bontouch, Move, and Shape, Framna emerged from a strong, product-led culture. Today, over 600 of us collaborate across ten studios in Denmark, the Netherlands, Poland, Sweden, Switzerland, and the US.
 



  





 Every day, millions of users around the world rely on the products we help shape. From seamless payments to daily commutes, from better health management to smarter shopping. Our work consistently earns an average App Store rating of 4.5.
 



  





 Together with some of the world’s most ambitious brands, including Essity, SJ, Swish, and SEB, we craft products that lead markets and push boundaries. Because when products win, businesses win. We call it Win by product.
 



  





**What you get** 




  




* **The office is our default base of work.** 
 This is about building culture, optimizing for stronger collaboration, better products, greater value for our partners and challenging ourselves while having fun doing it. Our Stockholm office is right in the middle of the city - a super cozy space where there’s always something happening, whether it is a demo, a fika, or someone testing out a new idea. We mix that with the freedom to work from home when it makes sense, and hours that flex around real life.
* **A culture of curiosity.** 
 On Fridays we have weekly demos, Wednesdays mean lunch-and-learns, and sometimes we throw ourselves into conceptathons just to see what happens. We gather for company conferences just to share ideas, and we take time to learn something new when needed.
* **The freedom to follow your “what if.”** 
 We believe the best roles are shaped by the people in them. If you are curious about something, you will have the trust and space to chase it, and probably a few teammates who want to jump in with you.
* **Teammates who bring their whole selves.** 
 Designers who doodle during standups, engineers who can’t resist showing off a clever hack, product leads who keep the energy up when things get tricky. Around here, people genuinely like sharing what they know and celebrating when someone tries something new.
* **And of course, the benefits you’d expect.** 
 A generous wellness grant, top-up on your parental leave, occupational pension, and plenty more to make life outside of work easier.



  





**Our hiring process** 




  




1. First interview with our recruiter, Josephine
2. Case assignment
3. Technical interview with two developers
4. Final meeting with our Head of Cross Platform



  





**Please note:** 
 For this role, you need to be based in Sweden. Unfortunately, we are not able to offer relocation.

title: Development Lead within D365
description:
**Job Description**
 Är du en passionerad utvecklare med djup kunskap om Dynamics 365 och redo att ta nästa steg i din karriär? Vi söker dig som vill kliva in i rollen som Development Lead, där du leder utvecklingsprojekt och säkerställer att våra tekniska lösningar inom Dynamics 365 möter kundernas affärsbehov. Har du redan erfarenhet som Dev Lead eller arbetar idag som senior utvecklare och vill utvecklas mot denna roll? Då är det dig vi letar efter!
   

  

 Du kommer att arbeta i ett dynamiskt team, där alla våra medarbetare är specialister inom sitt område. Vi arbetar nära våra kunder med uppdrag att implementera eller uppgradera Dynamics 365s olika applikationer men med huvudfokus på Finance & Supply Chain. Som person behöver du vara engagerad, lyhörd och besitta förmågan att förstå och översätta kundens affärsprocesser och behov till tekniska lösningar.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
* Designa och utveckla kundlösningar baserade på Dynamics 365 Finance & Supply Chain och tilläggslösningar
* Förbättra funktionalitet så att de passar vår kunders behov och krav
* Lösa tekniska problem
* Delta i pre-sales-arbete
* Delta i förstudier samt ansvara för dokumentation
* Miljö- och integrationsstrategier
* Tech Lead - leda andra tekniska resurser


**För Att Lyckas i Rollen**
* Besitter du erfaren av att arbeta som utvecklare eller arkitekt inom Dynamics 365
* Du är redo att ta steg mot att bli Development Lead eller redan har erfarenhet av att leda utvecklingsteam
* Du är en senior utvecklare med några års erfarenhet av utveckling inom Dynamics 365 eller Dynamics AX
* Du besitter goda kunskaper inom X++
* Systemintegrationer, Azure och Power Platform är andra områden som du arbetat med de senaste åren.
* Relevant utbildning och certifieringar inom området
* Du besitter flytande kunskaper inom engelska


**Placering:** 
 Enligt överenskommelse
   

  

**Start:** 
 Enligt överenskommelse
   

  

**Vilka är Fujitsu?**
 Fujitsu är ett världsledande japanskt företag inom IT och kommunikation. Vår marknad bygger på närhet till våra lokala kunder samtidigt som vi har det globala Fujitsu i ryggen. Det ger oss möjlighet att erbjuda alla våra kunder en bred palett av kreativa lösningar samtidigt som det ger oss de rätta verktygen att vara en föregångare inom innovation. Fujitsu erbjuder en komplett portfölj av tjänster, lösningar och produkter – vi är en global partner i den digitala transformationen.
   

  

**Vad kan vi erbjuda?**
 Som medarbetare hos Fujitsu möter du ny och spännande teknik. Artificiell intelligens, IoT, Big Data, Hybrid IT och mycket mer. Vi erbjuder en hybrid arbetsmiljö med flexibla arbetstider, där du får frihet under ansvar att själv lägga upp ditt arbete. Utöver det får du vara en del av en inkluderande kultur med stark sammanhållning samtidigt som du får se bortom tekniken och fokusera på den konkreta nyttan för våra kunder, för samhället och för miljön.

title: Technical Process Developer
description:
Join us in shaping the future of IT service excellence at Dustin—where your expertise in ITIL processes and smart automation will drive efficiency and innovation across the organization. If you’re passionate about continuous improvement and collaboration, this is your opportunity to make a real impact
   

  

**This is what makes the position as Technical Process Developer unique**
* Drive organizational agility by coaching leaders and teams to embrace iterative delivery and transparency
* Facilitate impactful workshops like retrospectives and value stream mapping to align priorities and optimize flow
* Champion a culture of continuous improvement that accelerates collaboration and business outcomes


 My name is Fredrik Åsberg, and I’m the hiring manager for this role. As a leader, I believe in building trust and giving people ownership of their work. At Dustin, we rely on technology that delivers on its promises—and I hold the same standard for our team: we commit, we deliver, and we grow together.
   

  

**Your role & influence as Technical Process Developer**
*Responsibility* 
 : You will be given responsibility for designing and continuously improving ITIL-based processes and ITSM workflows, ensuring they align with best practices and Dustin’s strategic goals while driving automation and efficiency across the platform.
   

  

*Collaboration* 
 : Together with your team, you take care of delivering robust ITIL processes and ITSM workflows that enable seamless service operations. You’ll work closely not only with your immediate team members but also with Product Owners, Engineering, Service Delivery, Business Operations, and leadership to ensure clear communication, governance, and continuous improvement
   

  

**Core Activities**
* Design, implement, and continuously improve ITIL-based processes and related workflows, ensuring alignment with ITIL v4 best practices and Dustin’s strategic objectives
* Collaborate with Atlassian Jira/ITSM platform specialists to configure, test, and optimize workflows, automations, and integrations that reduce manual work and enhance efficiency
* Establish and monitor KPIs, dashboards, and performance metrics to track process maturity, support governance forums, and drive service improvement initiatives


**Benefits Of Joining Dustin**
 We believe there's more to Dustin than just the benefits listed here. You'll fully understand this once you're with us. Curious? Our Life at Dustin - Dustin Sweden page has you covered.
   

  

**You can find more of our benefits below in the vacancy.**
**This Is What We Imagine You Bring**
 We envision you as a curious and driven individual who thrives on improving processes, enabling collaboration, and turning complex requirements into scalable, efficient solution
   

  

**Additionally, It's Important That**
* You have a bachelor's degree level of working and thinking
* You have 10-15 years of consultancy experience
* You are fluent in English, proficiency in Swedish is a plus
* Experience with ITIL v4 processes and frameworks, including Incident, Problem, Change, Request Fulfillment, Knowledge Management, and CMDB
* Technical skills in ITSM platforms (preferably Atlassian Jira), workflow design, automation, and integration, along with the ability to establish KPIs and dashboards for performance tracking


**What can you expect next?**
 To Ensure a Fair Recruitment Process Free From Unconscious Bias, We Handle Your Application Anonymously And Do Not Accept Cover Letters. Please Refrain From Sending One, So That The Selection Is Based Solely On Professional Competencies. We Expect The Following Steps In The Recruitment Process
   

  

* Telephone screening with TA partner Filippa Olivecrona
* 1st interview with Fredrik Åsberg
* Assessment (Personality- and cognitive thinking test)
* 2nd interview with colleagues
* Final in-person interview with the Hiring Manager, Fredrik and Director Application Management, Sara Wennerström


 For questions about the position, please contact the TA Partner Filippa Olivecrona via e-mail: Filippa.olivecrona@dustin.com

title: Senior Developer - AI Enabler
description:
*Vi tror på ett samhälle format av framgångsrika företag där entreprenörskap och samhällsnytta går hand i hand. Att vara en del av Fortnox är att vara en del av en ständig förändring - en förändring där du själv bestämmer hur långt du vill nå. Vårt största fokus är att ge dig rätt förutsättningar att få leva din passion tillsammans med oss. Var du kommer ifrån är inte relevant - det är vart du är på väg som är intressant för oss. Precis som vi igår inte kunde drömma om det Fortnox som finns idag, så kan du vara med och forma vilka vi är imorgon.*
**Om tjänsten**
 På Fortnox bygger vi inte bara lösningar för fler än 600 000 företag - vi bygger branschens mest moderna produkter och för att åstadkomma det bygger vi även branschens bästa utvecklingsplattform.
   

  

 Nu erbjuder vi dig en unik möjlighet att forma hur mjukvara byggs på Sveriges ledande SaaS-bolag. Du får mandatet att experimentera, misslyckas, lära och skala. Du blir en nyckelspelare i vår resa mot 2030 när vi tillsammans bygger en "best-in-class" teknikorganisation.
   

  

**Rollen**
 För att frigöra superkrafter hos hundratals utvecklare söker vi nu flera seniora utvecklare som kommer att arbeta med “AI Enablement”. Tillsammans är vi katalysatorn i den pågående transformation som mjukvarubranschen är i. Du kommer att ligga utanför våra utvecklingsteam, dina kunder är våra utvecklare och din framgång mäts i hur du lyckas att ge våra team verktyg och kunskap att bygga mjukvara i en värld som är under konstant förändring. Du arbetar i gränslandet mellan R&D, teknik, pedagogik och kultur.
   

  

**Vad du kommer att få göra**
* Coacha & Utbilda: Du arbetar "hands-on" med våra produktteam (mob-programmering, workshops) för att införa AI-drivna arbetssätt. Du lär dem att gå från att skriva syntax till att orkestrera lösningar med hjälp av verktyg som t.ex. Copilot, Cursor, ChatGPT och Claude.
* Bygga framtidens verktygslåda: Du är med och utvecklar vår interna plattform. Det kan handla om att sätta upp egna MCP-servrar (Model Context Protocol) som låter AI:n förstå Fortnox arkitektur, databaser och API:er.
* Driva experiment: Du identifierar flaskhalsar i våra flöden och designar experiment för hur AI kan lösa dem. Kan vi automatisera PR-reviews? Kan AI skriva våra migrationstester? Du tar fram hypoteser och mäter effekten.
* Kulturförflyttning: Du är en evangelist för "AI-first". Du hjälper oss att definiera vad "Engineering Excellence" betyder i en värld där AI skriver koden.


**Om dig**
* Du är en erfaren utvecklare med en djup teknisk förståelse för modern mjukvaruutveckling och vet hur "bra kod" ser ut.
* Du är en AI-pionjär som har gått bortom "hello world" med LLM:er. Du förstår RAG, agenter, prompt engineering och begränsningarna i dagens modeller.
* Du är en "Enabler" som brinner för Developer Experience (DX) och att din framgång mäts i andras framgång.
* Du är strategisk och förstår att verktyg utan en plan bara är kostnader. Du arbetar effektdrivet och kan koppla dina initiativ till kund- och affärsvärde.
* Du är ödmjuk och kan framföra dina tankar och idéer på ett pedagogiskt sätt. En klok kollega sa en gång att man ska “hold your strong opinions weakly”. För att lyckas i den här rollen behöver du både ha starka åsikter samtidigt som du är ödmjuk för att vi befinner oss i en värld av snabb förändring.


**Fortnox - mitt i företagslivet**
*Fortnox hjälper företag att starta, växa och utvecklas. Med smarta tekniska lösningar för företag och redovisningsbyråer, smidig finansiering och ett ekosystem av starka partnerskap är Fortnox ett nav för företagande i Sverige. Vi drivs av visionen om ett välmående samhälle format av framgångsrika företag.*
*Fortnox grundades 2001 med huvudkontor i Växjö. Läs mer på www.fortnoxgroup.com.*
**Välkommen med din ansökan!**

title: Software Engineer iOS
description:
**At FDJ UNITED, we don't just follow the game, we reinvent it.** 




  





 FDJ UNITED is one of Europe’s leading betting and gaming operators, with a vast portfolio of iconic brands and a reputation for technological excellence. With more than 5,000 employees and a presence in around fifteen regulated markets, the Group offers a diversified, responsible range of games, both under exclusive rights and open to competition. We set new standards, proving that entertainment and safety can go hand in hand. Here, you’ll work alongside a team of passionate individuals dedicated to delivering the best and safest entertaining experiences for our customers every day.
 



  





 We’re looking for bold people who are eager to succeed and ready to level-up the game. If you thrive on innovation, embrace challenges, and want to make a real impact at all levels, FDJ UNITED is your playing field.
 



  





**Join us in shaping the future of gaming. Are you ready to LEVEL-UP THE GAME?** 




  





 At
 **FDJ United** 
 , collaboration, craftsmanship, and continuous learning are central to how we build products. As part of our growing iOS team, you'll contribute to high-impact features used across multiple brands while working in a supportive environment that values ownership, innovation, and teamwork.
 



 Our engineers take responsibility across the entire lifecycle — from architecture and implementation to testing, monitoring, and ongoing improvements.
 



 We're now looking for an
 **experienced iOS Developer** 
 who has a strong command of
 **Swift, SwiftUI, async/await** 
 , and modern testing practices to help us craft robust, scalable, beautifully engineered mobile experiences.
 



 As part of a regulated group committed to safe and sustainable entertainment, every engineer also plays a role in ensuring responsible development and operational excellence.
 



  





**What You'll Do** 




  





**Design & Implementation** 



* Develop high-quality, performant iOS applications using
 **Swift** 
 ,
 **SwiftUI** 
 ,
 **Combine** 
 ,
 **async/await** 
 , and other modern frameworks.
* Contribute to the evolution of our architecture, helping shape modular, maintainable codebases supporting multiple brands.
* Participate in technical design discussions, proposing solutions to complex engineering challenges.



**Testing & Quality** 



* Build reliable, maintainable
 **Unit Tests** 
 ,
 **UI tests** 
 , and integration tests using frameworks like
 **SwiftTesting** 
 ,
 **XCTest** 
 and
 **XCUITest** 
 .
* Ensure code quality through peer reviews, automated checks, and continuous refactoring.
* Work closely with QA automation engineers to evolve shared tooling, frameworks, and CI/CD quality gates.



**Collaboration & Delivery** 



* Work in a cross-functional Agile team alongside Product Owners, QA Engineers, Backend Developers, and Designers.
* Participate in sprint planning, refinement, and release preparation.
* Contribute to a strong engineering culture of shared learning, constructive feedback, and continuous improvement.



**Operations & CI/CD** 



* Support the full lifecycle: monitoring, debugging, handling incidents, and continuously tuning performance.
* Contribute to CI/CD pipelines for automated testing, builds, and deployment workflows.



  





**Skills & Experience We're Looking For** 




  




* Strong experience developing iOS applications with
 **Swift** 
 , including advanced language features.
* Solid hands-on experience with
 **SwiftUI** 
 ,
 **async/await** 
 ,
 **Combine** 
 , and modern concurrency patterns.
* Deep understanding of
 **iOS architectural patterns** 
 (MVC, MVVM, Clean, etc.).
* Proficiency writing and maintaining
 **Unit Tests** 
 and
 **UI Tests** 
 using SwiftTesting, XCTest and XCUITest.
* Familiarity with automated build and release processes (CI/CD), ideally with
 **Jenkins** 
 ,
 **Fastlane** 
 , or similar tools.
* Ability to write clean, testable, maintainable code and drive quality practices across the team.



  





**Professional Skills** 




  




* Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate in a cross-functional setting.
* Comfortable participating in design sessions, code reviews, and architecture discussions.
* Experience working with Agile methodologies.
* Mindset of ownership: you want to build it, measure it, improve it, and support it.



  





**Nice-to-Have Experience** 




  




* Experience with
 **modular architectures** 
 , multi-brand shared codebases, or feature modules.
* Familiarity with tools like SwiftLint and SwiftFormat.
* Experience integrating with backend services using
 **REST** 
 or WebSockets.



  





**Who You Are** 




  




* A curious engineer who loves learning and exploring new iOS frameworks & tools.
* Someone who cares deeply about code quality, maintainability, and thoughtful design.
* A strong collaborator and communicator who values teamwork as much as technical excellence.
* Driven, autonomous, and eager to influence the product and technical direction.
* Comfortable balancing innovation with regulatory, compliance, and operational constraints.

title: Senior Business Developer - Retail
description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 Vi söker dig som vill skapa framtidens digitala lösningar, göra skillnad, och utmana det som finns idag och som tror att teknik, data och kreativitet kan förbättra världen. Vi har verktygen, möjligheterna och ambitionen att skapa verklig effekt.
   

  

 Vi är CGI. Vårt mål är att göra vardagen enklare, smartare och mer hållbar genom innovativa digitala tjänster. Vi utvecklar lösningar som möjliggör hemleverans av matvaror, säkra betallösningar och system som hjälper lokala butiker att växa. Hos oss arbetar du med att skapa sömlösa kundupplevelser, effektiva leveranskedjor, stabil drift och hållbar transformation.
   

  

 Är du redo att bli en del av vår resa? Välkommen till CGI - tillsammans formar vi framtiden!
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 Som Senior Business Developer Retail hos CGI får du en nyckelroll i att utveckla våra retail-kunders affärer. Du driver nya marknadsmöjligheter, etablerar långsiktiga partnerskap och kombinerar kommersiell strategi med teknisk förståelse. Med data, AI och moderna plattformar skapar du verklig affärseffekt.
   

  

 Du ansvarar för hela utvecklingsresan - från marknadsanalys och strategisk rådgivning till kravställning, genomförande och resultatdriven uppföljning.
   

  

 Dina uppgifter inkluderar att:
   

  

* Leda kommersiella och strategiska initiativ för retail-kunder (unified commerce, e-commerce, butikseffektivitet, lojalitet, pricing).
* Identifiera marknadstrender och kundinsikter som omsätts till nya affärsmöjligheter och erbjudanden.
* Driva analys- och innovationsprojekt med fokus på AI, data, forecasting, personalisering och optimering av försäljning och kundupplevelse.
* Rådgiva kring kommersiell styrning och KPI-modeller (GM%, CLV, churn, konvertering, basket size) och stödja strategiska prioriteringar.
* Utforma go-to-market-strategier, koncept och roadmapar för retailens framtida behov.
* Bygga långsiktiga kundrelationer och agera som strategisk partner i transformationsresor.
* Samverka med tekniska team för att säkerställa skalbara, datadrivna och affärsnära lösningar.
* Bidra till kunskapsdelning och utveckla CGI:s retail-erbjudande genom case, metodik, workshops och thought leadership.


 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av affärsutveckling inom detaljhandel eller närliggande konsumentdrivna branscher.
* God förståelse för retail-ekosystemet - från supply chain och category management till försäljning, digital handel och kundlojalitet.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta datadrivet och omsätta insikter till kommersiella beslut och strategier.
* Förmåga att kombinera affärsförståelse med teknisk rådgivning, särskilt inom AI, data och digitalisering.
* Vana av att arbeta i kundnära roller med dialoger på ledningsnivå.
* Meriterande: erfarenhet av P&L-ansvar, GTM-strategier, förändringsledning eller arbete med större transformationsprogram.


**Vem är du?**
 Du är strategisk, affärsorienterad och initiativrik. Du trivs i en rådgivande roll, är kommunikativ, analytisk och skapar energi omkring dig. Framför allt drivs du av att skapa mätbara resultat och utveckla hållbara retail-affärer i en snabbt föränderlig marknad.
   

  

**Låter rollen som Senior Business Developer som nästa steg för dig?**
 Ansök redan idag, vi hanterar ansökningar löpande. För frågor, kontakta:
   

  

 Mette Pettersen, m.pettersen@cgi.com
   

  

**Varför CGI?**
 Hos CGI får du kombinera affärsutveckling, strategi och innovation i en miljö där du arbetar både operativt och strategiskt. Du får möjlighet att påverka framtidens retail genom arbete med marknadsledande kunder, data- och AI-initiativ samt strategiska transformationsprojekt.
   

  

**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.**
 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
   

  

 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
   

  

 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
   

  

 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.

title: Lead QA Engineer – Test Automation
description:
*Are you passionate about quality and automation? Do you want to help development teams build better software- faster?*
 Tacton is now looking for a Lead QA Engineer for Test Automation who loves structure, frameworks, and smart automation. This role focuses on preventing regressions and accelerating delivery, not through manual testing, but through better practices, smarter tooling, and a strong quality culture.
   

  

 You’ll combine a developer’s mindset with a quality-first approach, inspire teams by knowledge sharing, refining frameworks, implementing good examples and making sure everyone has the tools, data, and guidance they need to deliver with confidence.
   

  

 You’ll be part of our R&D team of passionate developers, Dev Leads, and architects who love building great software together. This is a new role and an exciting next step for us, as we take testing and quality to the next level. In this role, you will report to VP Engineering.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Own and evolve our test automation frameworks, updating the code base, improving structure, and ensuring it’s easy to understand what’s covered (and what’s not).
* Enable teams to build the right tests at the right level, unit, system, and integration, while ensuring each team remains responsible for their own quality.
* Define best practices for testing across the organization, including when and how to use specific test types.
* Champion modern testing practices including AI-assisted testing and data generation.
* Collaborate closely with Dev Leads to make adding and maintaining automated tests easier for their teams.
* Measure and communicate quality metrics such as coverage, reliability, and test effectiveness, and help define realistic targets.


**Who You Are**
* 7+ years of experience within development, QA and test automation.
* Technical background (development or technical QA) — strong scripting/coding skills
* Proven experience with test frameworks and automation tools, experience with AI testing tools, data generation, or performance testing.
* Skilled at influencing teams and introducing best practices.
* Curious to understand our business behind the software, not just the code.
* Excellent communicator who enjoys working with all colleagues within R&D.


**Nice To Have**
* Familiarity with cloud environments (AWS, Azure) and SaaS platforms.


 Furthermore, it’s important that you’re interested in our product, our CPQ solution, and that you’re eager to develop a deep understanding of the CPQ business domain over time, enabling you to design meaningful end-to-end test scenarios that reflect real customer use cases.
   

  

**Why You’ll Love Working Here**
 At Tacton, quality isn’t just a checkbox — it’s a mindset. You’ll join a highly technical product company where testing and automation have a direct impact on speed, reliability, and customer experience. In this position, you’ll have the opportunity to shape how we test and deliver across our global SaaS platform.
   

  

**We Offer**
* A solid and stable company with over 20 years of industry experience.
* A flexible hybrid work model (3 days in the Stockholm office).
* A collaborative and open culture where engineering and quality go hand-in-hand.
* 33 days of paid time off – 30 vacation days, plus 3 extra days
* Generous wellness allowance – to support your health and wellbeing.
* Private healthcare insurance – Get quick access to private medical care
* Weekly treats – Fika and breakfasts, because good food brings people together.


**Ready to shape how we build and test at Tacton?**
 Apply today and help us take quality automation to the next level. Please apply no later than 10:th of December.
   

  

**About Tacton:** 
 Tacton is a global SaaS leader in CPQ (Configure, Price, Quote), empowering manufacturers to streamline complex sales processes and drive growth. Headquartered in Stockholm with offices in Chicago, Karlsruhe, and Warsaw, we’re a 220-person team on an exciting growth journey. Recognized by Gartner as a market leader, our technology helps global manufacturers solve real-world configuration challenges and stay competitive in a rapidly changing world.
   

  

 Learn more at
 **tacton.com/about**
 Tacton is a leading SaaS company within CPQ and Design Automation making sales simple for complex products.

title: Golang System Software Engineer - Containers / Virtualisation
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1000+ colleagues in 70+ countries and very few office based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder led, profitable and growing.
   

  

 The mission of the LXD team is to build a next-generation private cloud infrastructure, combining KVM, Ceph, and SDN technologies to create a data center scale cloud that 'just works' and provides a mission-critical cloud for edge and core enterprise deployments. We are hiring a Golang software engineer to work on the low level Go codebase sitting between our REST API and the low level C libraries used to manage containers and virtual machines. We are looking for system-level developers with experience in design and data management/modeling.
   

  

 LXD components span the entire software stack from low-level kernel features to the upper level management API/CLI. Our most effective engineers are fluent in all these layers, and able to anticipate the consequences of design and engineering choices elsewhere in a complex distributed system.
   

  

 This is an opportunity for someone who wants to have a meaningful impact on modern cloud computing technologies. Canonical offers a fun, fast-paced team environment and a career full of learning and development.
   

  

***Location***
 : This is a remote position available in EMEA and the Americas.
   

  

 What you will focus on
   

  

* Design, implement and document system level Go code
* Model data, design database schema and implement data storage in a dqlite (SQL) database
* Maintain code quality through static analysis, unit and system tests
* Collaborate proactively with a distributed team
* Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions
* Work from home with global travel 2 to 4 weeks/year for internal and external events


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* You have experience programming in Go and C
* You are knowledgeable in networking and storage technologies
* You have experience with two or more of: cloud computing, virtualisation, containers, distributed systems, open source community
* You are curious, flexible, articulate and accountable
* You value soft skills and are enterprising, thoughtful and self-motivated
* You have a bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree


 What we offer you
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Senior Game Developer - Mob Control
description:
**About Voodoo**
 Founded in 2013, Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps with a mission to entertain the world. Gathering 800 employees, 7 billion downloads, and over 200 million active users, Voodoo is the #3 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google and Meta. Our portfolio includes chart-topping games like Mob Control and Block Jam, alongside popular apps such as BeReal and Wizz.
   

  

 This position is fully remote CET ±2h or Barcelona-based.
   

  

 Team
   

  

 Our Gaming team is made up of casual, and mid-core experts. Our 'Core' games team supports internal and external studios worldwide in creating, developing, and launching new hit games, whilst our 'Live' games team focuses on delivering higher engagement on our existing and successful games.
   

  

 Joining our Live games team means collaborating with gaming industry experts on globally renowned, enduring games while embracing exciting new entrepreneurial ventures. With over seven billion downloads worldwide and a portfolio of more than 10 resilient games generating more than $20m per year, we are the world's largest and most successful hybrid publisher.
   

  

 You will be joining one of our Live Studios, working on
 **Mob Control** 
 .
   

  

 With Mob Control, we’re building an iconic game that players will never forget!
   

  

 We're a small team who take care of everything from ideas to testing, and we intend to grow while maintaining our high standards.
   

  

 Role
   

  

 We are looking for a Senior Game Developer, passionate about delivering unforgettable player experiences.
   

  

 You will craft highly polished, satisfying, and responsive features that elevate how players
 *feel* 
 the game, from moment-to-moment gameplay to UI/UX and overall flow.
   

  

 You will work closely with Designers, Artists, and other Developers to bring ideas to life with precision and care. You will own features end-to-end, ensuring every interaction feels great to play.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Build and iterate on player-facing features across gameplay, metagame, and UI
* Write robust, maintainable and extensible code, used by millions of players worldwide
* Polish and refine systems with a strong focus on feel, clarity, and delight
* Work hand-in-hand with design and art teams to bring ideas from concept to final implementation
* Maintain smooth performance and high-quality experiences across a wide range of devices
* Contribute to the overall quality bar of the game, ensuring every player touchpoint feels great.


 With this role, you will have a strong impact on the company, contributing daily to key decisions alongside a senior, multidisciplinary team of passionate and talented people.
   

  

 You will refine every detail of gameplay and feedback loops, ensuring every moment feels great to play.
   

  

 If you live for the small details, the perfect animation timing, the satisfying click of a button, the spark of joy when everything just flows, this is your place.
   

  

 Thanks to your creativity, care, and teamwork, together we’ll entertain millions of players with truly unforgettable experiences.
   

  

 Profile
   

  

* 5+ years of experience in Unity (or equivalent engine)
* Strong sense of gameplay feel and great attention to detail
* Excellent programming skills, clean coding practices, and a strong ability to contribute to scalable architectures
* Proven track record of shipping high-quality mobile games with strong player experience focus
* Experience with shaders and VFX
* Fluent in English, with great collaboration and communication skills


 Nice-to-have
   

  

* Familiarity with mobile performance optimization
* Background in responsive controls and satisfying interactions


**Benefits**
* Best-in-class compensation
* Other benefits according to the country you reside

title: Junior Unity-utvecklare Sthlm
description:
**This is Everone**
 Vi är en agentur för duktiga och ambitiösa systemutvecklare. Våra utvecklare arbetar i
 **backend** 
 ,
 **fullstack** 
 ,
 **frontend** 
 och med
 **design** 
 . Med moderna plattformar och ny teknik bygger våra utvecklare digitala lösningar och innovationer för framtiden hos våra kunder.
   

  

**Nu söker vi en junior Unity-utvecklare till snabbväxande spelstudio i Stockholm**
 Vi söker en
 **junior men mycket ambitiös och driven Unity-utvecklare** 
 med erfarenhet av
 **Unity** 
 till en snabbväxande spelstudio inom mobilspel. Hos oss blir du en del av ett erfaret och seniort utvecklingsteam där du får möjlighet att växa, utmanas och vara med och skapa nästa generations mobilspel.
   

  

 Du trivs i en kreativ miljö, tar gärna egna initiativ och brinner för spelutveckling. Rollen är
 **på plats i Stockholm** 
 och erbjuder en unik chans att utvecklas tillsammans med några av branschens bästa.
   

  

 Låter det som du? Hör av dig – vi vill gärna träffa dig!
   

  

**Placering**
 Placering hos vår kund i Stockholm med möjlighet till hybrid viss remote.

title: AI-utvecklare
description:
*Till vårt huvudkontor i centrala Stockholm söker vi nu en AI-utvecklare.*
**Vill du vara med och skapa AI-lösningar som stärker kundupplevelsen, förenklar vardagen för våra medarbetare och gör det möjligt för oss att fatta snabbare och smartare beslut?** 
 Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av att utveckla och implementera AI/ML-lösningar och som vill använda din kompetens för att bidra till ett meningsfullt samhällsuppdrag - där service, omtanke om människa och miljö alltid står i fokus.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som AI-utvecklare blir du en del av avdelningen Digitalisering och enheten Digital Utveckling & Förvaltning, som ansvarar för en trygg, stabil och affärsmässig digitalisering av Systembolaget. Hos oss får du arbeta med moderna molnbaserade AI-tjänster och intelligenta modeller – samtidigt som du är med och formar nästa generations data- och AI-plattform när vår nuvarande lösning moderniseras de kommande åren.
   

  

 Du arbetar i en specialiserad grupp inom enheten och samarbetar nära både verksamhetspersoner och outsourcade resurser, och du rapporterar till gruppchefen för Digital Intelligens.
   

  

**I Din Roll Som AI-utvecklare Kommer Du Att**
* Designa, utveckla och implementera stabila AI/ML-lösningar i Systembolagets IT-miljö.
* Automatisera träning, deployment och övervakning av modeller.
* Stötta verksamheten och IT-förvaltningar med tekniskt stöd för att förvalta och upprätthålla lösningar.
* Säkerställa att våra AI-lösningar följer regelverk och säkerhetskrav.
* Utveckla robusta och skalbara modeller med hög datakvalitet.
* Hantera tekniska incidenter och säkerställa stabil drift i produktionsmiljö.
* Samarbeta med Produktägare, Data Scientists och utvecklare i tvärfunktionella team.


**Om dig**
**Vi Söker Dig Som Har**
* Relevant akademisk utbildning eller motsvarande erfarenhet .
* Dokumenterad kunskap inom AI/ML-utveckling och data engineering.
* Erfarenhet av Azure eller annan molnplattform
* God förståelse inom CI/CD, testautomatisering och modellövervakning.
* Erfarenhet av datahantering, dataextraktion och säkerhets-/compliancekrav inom AI och data.


 Om du tidigare har jobbat med dataskyddsfrågor kopplade till AI, MLOps, distribuerade datamiljöer, generativ AI, prompt engineering eller dataplattformar ser vi det som ett plus.
   

  

 För att trivas i rollen tror vi att du är nyfiken, flexibel och har en genuin vilja att lära nytt. Du uppskattar tvärfunktionellt samarbete, bygger relationer och skapar förtroende i mötet med andra.
   

  

 I urvalet kommer vi att lägga stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
   

  

**Hos oss är det enkelt att vara engagerad**
 Genom vår ansvarsfulla försäljning vill vi bidra till bättre folkhälsa och en hållbar utveckling för både människor och miljö. Systembolaget bygger på människor – våra kunder, våra kollegor och vårt gemensamma uppdrag. Hos oss får du möjlighet att göra skillnad, utvecklas, påverka och lyckas tillsammans med andra.
   

  

 Systembolaget utvecklas ständigt och det kommer du också att göra. För oss är det viktigt att vi som jobbar här mår bra och att vi skapar balans mellan arbete, familj och fritid. Vi tror starkt på långsiktighet både ur ett socialt och hållbart perspektiv. Här kan du läsa mer om hur det är att arbeta hos oss Här kan du läsa mer om hur det är att arbeta hos oss.
   

  

**Känns rollen rätt för dig?**
 Kul! Varmt välkommen att skicka in din ansökan med CV så snart som möjligt. För att kunna göra en rättvis och likvärdig bedömning av dig som sökande använder vi oss av urvalsfrågor.
