* statlig myndighet,goda kunskaper och erfarenhet
* av projektledning,aktuell erfarenhet av att hantera budget och ko



  





 stnadsuppföljning,
   

 Stor vikt kommer att läggas vid de per
 



  





 sonliga förmågorna.
   

 Befattningen är en tillsvidareanställning med provanställning om sex månader. Tillträde så snart som möjligt enl
 



  





**igt ö** 




  





 verenskommelse.
   

 Om DO
   

 DO är en statlig myndighet och vårt uppdrag regleras i lagen (2008:568) om Diskrimineringsombudsmannen. I uppdraget ingår att utöva tillsyn över diskrimineringslagen (2008:567) och därutöver att verka för att diskriminering som har samband med kön, könsöverskridande identitet eller uttryck, etnisk tillhörighet, religion eller annan trosuppfattning, funktionsnedsättning, sexuell läggning eller ålder inte förekommer inom några områden av samhällslivet. Vi ska också genom råd och på annat sätt medverka till att den som utsatts för diskriminering kan ta till vara sina rättigheter. DO ska vidare på annat sätt verka för lika rättigheter och möjligheter oavsett kön, könsöverskridande identitet eller uttryck, etnisk tillhörighet, religion eller annan trosuppfattning, funktionsnedsättning, sexuell
 



  





 läggning eller ålder.
   

 Vi är omkring hundra anställda som arbetar i tillgängliga lokaler på Råsundavägen 18 i Solna, med närhet till goda kommunikationsmöjligheter. Vi ser inte ytterligare anpassningar som ett hi
 
 nder. Läs
 




  





 mer om DO på www.do.se.
   

 Vi erbjuder dig en arbetsplats med förmåner som bland annat flexibla arbetstider, friskvårdsersättning och friskvårdstimme. Vidare erbjuds möjlighet till visst distansarbete o
 



  





 m verksamheten tillåter.
   

 Vi värnar om en rekrytering fri från diskriminering som ger lika rättigheter
 



 och möjligheter för alla.Kontaktperson är rekryterande chef Lena Björk eller HR-specialist Emilie Duran. Fackliga företrädare är Matilda Davin Omar för Saco och Camilla Arnesen för ST. Du når dem via
 



  





 DO:s växel 08-120 20 700.
   

 Har du skyddade personuppgifter ber vi dig meddela detta till den HR-specialist som står angiven ovan så att vi kan hantera din
 



  





 a personuppgifter korrekt.
   

 Välkommen med din ansökan inklusive meritförteckning senast den 5 januari 2026 v
 
 ia ansökningsfunktionen på www.do.se/om-do/job
 
 ba-hos-oss/lediga-tjanster/alternativt till Diskrimineringsombudsmannen, Box 4057, 169 04 Solna med referensnummer DO 2025/9014. Observera att vi inte ser din profilsida på LinkedIn som en inskickad ansökan och meritförteckning. Om du blir kallad till intervju kommer vi att begära in vidimerade exa
 



  




 mensbevis/utbildningsintyg.

title: Head of Customer Success
description:
We’re looking for a technically minded Head of Customer Success to build and lead how Upsales drives value at scale, through systems, data, and smart automation. This is not a traditional CS role. It’s a chance to architect the frameworks, tools, and intelligence that define how our customers learn, grow, and succeed in the age of AI, with satisfied customers, high NPS, and a premium service experience as the ultimate outcome.
   

  

 At Upsales, we’re transforming B2B revenue acceleration with an AI-first platform that empowers thousands of European sales teams to grow faster and smarter. Now we’re scaling how we help customers realize that impact with precision, automation, and measurable success as the core, where NPS, customer sentiment, education quality, and advocacy are central metrics of success, not afterthoughts.
   

  

 AI first mindset
   

  

 We’re not looking for someone who simply uses AI. We want someone who weaponizes it. You treat tools like Claude, ChatGPT, and other AI copilots as force multipliers, allowing you to deliver at a level and speed others can’t match. For you, AI isn’t an add-on, it’s the default operating system for how you think, work, and lead. You’re relentlessly curious about new capabilities, and you push the limits of what’s possible, turning AI into a competitive advantage for yourself, Upsales, and our customers. This is a role for someone with real ambition: someone who wants to set a new standard for efficiency, precision, service quality, and impact in the age of AI.
   

  

 What You’ll Do
   

  

 You’ll take full ownership of the customer success ecosystem: designing technical systems and experiences that are both scalable and human.
   

  

* Build a world-class customer success infrastructure powered by data, automation, and AI, explicitly optimised to strengthen NPS, customer sentiment, and trust.
* Redefine self-service with intelligent documentation, contextual help, and proactive support, ensuring customers always feel informed, empowered, and supported — key drivers of high NPS.
* Design and deliver digital education programs, training, and scalable value-driven journeys that measurably increase customer confidence and satisfaction.
* Integrate customer insights, feedback, reviews, and NPS data directly into product and AI models to drive smarter decision-making and deeper customer alignment.
* Leverage analytics, telemetry, and feedback loops to continuously improve adoption, retention, and expansion, with NPS and qualitative satisfaction as primary indicators of success.
* Lead and mentor the CS team to operate with precision, ownership, and technical depth, while instilling a culture obsessed with customer happiness, follow-through, and excellence.


 This is a role where systems thinking meets customer obsession. You’ll be hands-on with tools, data, and workflows, shaping not just customer relationships, but the technology that powers them, always reinforcing a journey that increases satisfaction, produces positive reviews, and drives long-term loyalty. You’ll collaborate with product, marketing, and support leaders to make sure our customer journey is both seamless and memorable, consistently strengthening NPS and overall customer delight. Together, you’ll build one of the most effective and forward-thinking customer success organizations in the market.
   

  

 Because the people who are crazy enough to think they can reinvent how customer success is done… are the ones who actually do.
   

  

 Who We're Looking For
   

  

* We’re looking for someone who has already proven they can lead and scale customer success in a SaaS environment.
* Experience with AI-enabled tools or analytics platforms, using them to enhance efficiency, prediction, personalization, and to identify the drivers behind high NPS and customer delight.
* A systems builder: comfortable defining processes, mapping journeys, and translating complexity into clarity, always grounded in what creates happy, confident customers.
* Equally fluent in strategy and execution, from designing scalable CS frameworks to implementing automation yourself.
* You know how to connect customer voice with business strategy, turning insights into loyalty, advocacy, reviews, measurable improvements in NPS, and product innovation.
* Personality-wise? You’re a builder, a doer, and customer-obsessed. You combine sharp business sense with a love of operational excellence, and an instinct for service, attitude, and communication that makes customers genuinely love working with us. You don’t just raise the bar, you create new standards, and bring others with you.
* You have excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, in Swedish and English.


 Upsales is a bootstrapped company with big ambitions, known for our high-performing team, relentless curiosity, and a culture that challenges conventional thinking. From product to sales, we’re obsessed with creating real value for our customers and building software that actually moves the needle.

title: Executive assistant to Head of Group Communication & Sustainability
description:
*Saab serves the global market with world-leading products, services and solutions from military defence to civil security. With operations on every continent, Saab continuously develops, adapts and improves new technology to meet customers’ changing needs. Always with the purpose of keeping people and society safe.*
*As an Executive assistant you will play a central role in both challenging and supporting the executive, contributing directly to the development of the business.*
 Your role
   

  

 Saab is seeking an experienced Executive Assistant to support Head of Group Communication and sustainability. This position requires an ability to interact with staff at all levels in a fast-paced environment all while remaining flexible, proactive, communicative and with a high level of professionalism and confidentiality. The ideal candidate is a strong communicator, a natural problem-solver and a true extension of the executive they support.
   

  

 Your responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
   

  

* Providing support to the Head of Communication and Sustainability, including handling confidential assignments, coordinating day-to-day operations and anticipating the executive’s needs.
* Manage a busy, dynamic and ever-changing calendar, ensuring seamless scheduling across time zones and shifting priorities.
* Organize and facilitate meetings, overseeing all logistics including booking conference rooms, compiling agendas, documenting meeting minutes and decisions, organizing materials, catering and attendee coordination
* Support expense reporting, procurement, and budget tracking where applicable
* Coordinate deliverables such as briefings, overview documents and presentations
* Support producing presentations, briefing materials and background papers.
* Identify opportunities for continuous improvement and proactively implement solutions
* Arranging conferences and administrating various forums (sending invitations, preparing agendas, taking minutes, providing proactive suggestions) within the function.


**Your Skills And Experience**
 You thrive in a fast-paced environment, excel at multitasking and have strong organizational skills. We are open to candidates with solid experience in similar roles as well as recent graduates (in finance, communications/marketing, political science, or related fields) who demonstrate strong potential and a willingness to learn.
   

  

 You are a service-minded colleague with a high level of professionalism and integrity. Strong judgement and problem-solving skills, excellent communication abilities and the flexibility to thrive in a dynamic environment with shifting priorities are essential attributes. You have the ability to analyze and summarize information, preparing clear and professional briefings and materials. An interest in communication and marketing is important and fluency in both Swedish and English, spoken and written, is required.
   

  

 We expect the right person to develop and over time be ready for other roles within our communications or marketing teams.
   

  

 This position requires that you pass a security vetting based on the current regulations around/of security protection. For positions requiring security clearance additional obligations on citizenship may apply.
   

  

 What you will be part of
   

  

 Group Communication and Sustainability leads and develops the communication and sustainability work at Saab. Within the function there are more than 100 employees, most of them located in Sweden but a number of employees are also located around the world. They are working to drive and inspire exceptional communication, develop our sustainability efforts and contribute to Saab winning business, while empowering our people and our brand.
   

  

 It is an open, international and professional culture with many activities in play.
   

  

 Our function is an integrated part of all Saab activities and it supports our business goals.
   

  

 Explore a wealth of possibilities. Take on challenges, create smart inventions, and grow beyond. This is a place for curious minds, brave pioneers, and everyone in between. Together, we achieve the extraordinary, each bringing our unique perspectives. Your part matters.
   

  

 Saab is a leading defence and security company with an enduring mission, to help nations keep their people and society safe. Empowered by its 26,100 talented people, Saab constantly pushes the boundaries of technology to create a safer and more sustainable world.
   

  

 Saab designs, manufactures and maintains advanced systems in aeronautics, weapons, command and control, sensors and underwater systems. Saab is headquartered in Sweden. It has major operations all over the world and is part of the domestic defence capability of several nations. Read more about us here

title: Verksamhetsarkitekt inom CIO office i Sundsvall
description:
Placeringsort OspecificeratDiarienummer FK 2025/028091
   

  

 Logga in och sök jobbet Öppnas i nytt fönster
   

  

*Varje år fattar Försäkringskassan 21 miljoner beslut som påverkar människors liv och hela samhället. Vi betalar ut cirka 260 miljarder kronor varje år. Det är allas skattepengar vi har hand om. Det är ett stort ansvar. Därför tänker vi nytt och använder den senaste tekniken för att förenkla och förbättra, utveckla och leverera it-tjänsterna för den svenska socialförsäkringen. Välkommen till en av Sveriges största IT-avdelningar.*
 Beslut och utbetalningar sker digitalt och därför är IT-avdelningens uppdrag inom Försäkringskassan helt avgörande. IT-avdelningen består av ca 1400 medarbetare och flera hundra konsulter på åtta it-kontor i Sverige. För att leda IT-avdelningen finns ett CIO Office där verksamhets- och ekonomistyrning, juridisk IT-kompetens samt kansliet för samordnad säker statlig IT-drift samlas.
   

  

 Interna system, effektivt it för stödfunktioner
   

  

 It-landskapet för Försäkringskassans interna system är i stor förändring. Flera av de ingående IT-lösningarna behöver bytas ut eller uppdateras. Den förväntade potentialen till besparingar i verksamheten i stort är hög.
   

  

 För att fånga denna möjlighet behöver en kartläggning av nuläge och en plan för förändring arbetas fram tillsammans med de berörda avdelningarna – åtminstone HR, Kommunikation, Rättsavdelningen, Verksamhetsstöd, Ledningsstöd och IT. Denna roll ansvarar för att få alla intressenter att enas om den gemensamma kartan och planen framåt. Detta uppdrag är av stor vikt och hög komplexitet, varför du som söker har erfarenhet av liknande arbete sedan tidigare samt en god förmåga att driva på och att ena olika intressenter.
   

  

 Tjänsten innebär att du hanterar sekretessbelagda uppgifter vilket ställer höga krav på rätt hantering. Därför är det viktigt att du som ska arbeta hos oss har högt säkerhetsmedvetande.
   

  

 Det är ett jobb för dig som vill vara med och ta ansvar.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som
   

  

* har framgångsrik erfarenhet inom HR-, kommunikations- och IT-områdena
* är certifierad verksamhetsarkitekt
* har erfarenhet av motsvarande verksamhetsområde från annan myndighet
* identifierar problem snabbt och löser dessa på ett relevant sätt
* har god kommunikativ förmåga, i både tal och skrift
* agerar på eget initiativ och tar ansvar för att nå goda resultat
* är trygg och förtroendeingivande, även i belastade situationer.


 Det är meriterande om du har
   

  

* har arbetat med domänen interna system inom andra myndigheter
* har god insikt i strukturella samarbeten inom svensk förvaltning som berör HR, kommunikation och it.


 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
   

  

 Övrigt
   

  

 En tjänst, särskild visstidsanställning elva månader, 75%, med tillträde enligt överenskommelse. I enlighet med Försäkringskassans riktlinje för säkerhet genomförs bakgrundskontroller i denna rekrytering. För den här tjänsten krävs svenskt medborgarskap.
   

  

 Placeringsorter: Stockholm eller Sundsvall.
   

  

 Vill du veta mer om Försäkringskassan som arbetsgivare? Besök fk.se/jobbahososs
   

  

 Kontaktpersoner
   

  

 Chef: Julia Brundin 010-114 07 34 (för frågor om tjänsten). HR-specialist: Klas Lindblad, klas.lindblad@fk.se, 010-113 10 43 (för frågor om rekryteringsprocessen). Fackliga representanter är för ST Peter Lampinen, Saco-S Ann Wiström, Seko Eliza Grundström. Dessa nås via vår växel 08-786 90 00.
   

  

 Ansökan
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan senast den 18 december 2025. Ladda gärna upp dina examensbevis, betyg och intyg i samband med din ansökan.
   

  

 Har du skyddade personuppgifter eller ingen tillgång till bank-id ringer du den HR-specialist som finns namngiven i annonsen så får du hjälp med att skicka in din ansökan.
   

  

 Vi ska i allt vi gör, agera med utgångspunkt i principen om alla människors lika värde, rättssäkerhet och med god service.

title: Senior Lumera System Manager – 14719
description:
We are looking for a Senior Lumera System Manager to join our dynamic team.
 



  





**What you will work on:** 



* Oversee the stability, performance and security of a complex core system environment built on the Lumera platform
* Manage updates, releases and incident resolution to ensure rapid restoration of services
* Maintain reliable backup and recovery routines and ensure test environments are properly set up and maintained
* Monitor and optimize system performance and proactively address potential risks
* Safeguard system integrity and ensure seamless interaction with the surrounding IT infrastructure
* Maintain accurate and up-to-date documentation and ensure alignment with relevant standards and regulations



  





**What you bring:** 



* 2–5 years of experience as a System Manager, Database Administrator or similar role focused on application and database management
* Knowledge of container technologies such as Docker or Kubernetes and experience managing containerized applications
* Strong understanding of database management, monitoring processes, backup/restore routines, and patch and release management
* Experience working with compliance frameworks such as GDPR or ISO27001 and applying strong security practices
* Excellent troubleshooting and analytical skills with the ability to communicate clearly with both technical and non-technical stakeholders
* Experience with Lumera is a strong advantage
* Fluent in English and Swedish.

title: Founding Engineer at Vantir | Stockholm
description:
**Who We Are** 




 Vantir is a brand-new consulting and venture-building firm based in Stockholm. We’re a group of passionate engineers and entrepreneurs on a mission to help businesses thrive in the modern age of data.
 



  





 We specialize in creating cloud-based data platforms that help our clients unlock the full potential of their data. Whether it’s transforming how businesses manage their data, deploying machine learning models into production, or driving insights with advanced analytics, our goal is simple: turn data into real business value.
 



  





 We’re just getting started, so joining us now means being part of something exciting, helping to build a company from the ground up and shaping its culture, direction, and future.
 



  





**What We’re Looking For** 




 We’re looking for talented data/cloud professionals (engineers, analysts, scientist) and technical management consultants who love solving real-world problems using modern technologies. If you’re ready to work on cutting-edge projects with top-tier clients AND want the rare chance to become a founding member of a company, you’ve come to the right place.
 



  





 In this role, you’ll work closely with clients to design and implement data solutions that help them make smarter decisions. You’ll also help us define how we work and build a company culture that fosters learning, collaboration, and innovation.
 



  





**What’s in It for You?** 



* A rare opportunity to join a newly founded consulting firm and become a Founding Engineer.
* Work directly on high-impact projects with great clients.
* Be part of a collaborative team where your ideas matter and your work is valued.
* Help shape the technical direction and culture of a growing company.
* Competitive compensation and benefits.



  





**What We’d Love to See in You** 



* At least 2 years of experience as a Data Engineer, Cloud Engineer, Data Scientist, AI Engineer, Technical Management Consultant or similar.
* Experience working with AWS, GCP or Azure.
* Strong skills in modern software development.
* Experience with tools like Snowflake or dbt (or similar modern data stack tools).
* A knack for creative problem-solving and a passion for using data to drive business decisions.
* You live in or near Stockholm



  





**Why Join Us?** 




 This is more than a job. It’s your chance to be part of something exciting and meaningful - not just for our clients but for our company, too. As a Founding Engineer, you’ll help establish Vantir’s reputation as an innovative data consulting powerhouse, while growing with us every step of the way.
 



  





 Ready to make your mark? Apply today and let’s build something great together.
 



 Learn more about the journey at vantir.se/careers .

title: IT Security Expert for SECIM
description:
emagine is looking for a Senior IT Security Expert for SECIM for one of our great clients within the construction industry.
   

  

**Start: 2026-01-15**
**End: 2026-03-31 (extension could be possible)**
**Location: Stockholm, min 2 days onsite at the office required**
**About the role:**
 The role is responsible for ensuring that the activities of the SECIM project meet the requirements of the Public Access to Information and Secrecy Act (OSL), the Security Protection Act and the NIS 2 Directive, as well as internal security policies.
   

  

 The focus is on protecting security-sensitive information, managing risks, and ensuring compliance with laws and agreements.
   

  

 Main duties
   

  

* Produce documentation of where we are in IT security in current IT infrastructure, as well as selected systems and applications.
* Develop a GAP analysis together with the Solution Architect, which describes what we need to do to achieve the right level of information security and IT security between the current situation and the future situation.
* Coordinate activities with ISO27001 initiative.
* Implement and follow up the application of set legal requirements, including risk and vulnerability analyses.
* Ensure security requirements are embedded into project requirements.


**Your profile**
* Experience in security clearance, register controls and handling of classified information.
* Deep knowledge of the design of IT infrastructure and systems to maintain the right level of security as above.
* Understanding of IT security and relevant standards (ex. ISO 27001).


 Personal qualities
   

  

* High integrity and reliability.
* Ability to work in a structured and proactive manner.
* Good communication and collaboration skills.
* Proficiency in Swedish and English language.


 Education Requirements
   

  

 Relevant academic education in information security or IT security and completed courses in security protection.

title: Customer Success Manager, Europe
description:
**About The Role**
**Grade Level (for internal use):**
 09
   

  

**Customer Success Manager, Europe**
**The Team**
 It’s a dynamic global team, where the work changes daily.  You are responsible for a successful customer journey and touch points that create long term client engagement, driving adoption, retention, user/usage growth and supporting strategic objectives on the account level.  This team will develop and execute data driven processes to deliver world class customer experience.  Your role may focus on migration, onboarding or global strategic accounts.
   

  

**The Impact:** 
  

  

 Your interactions with the client will reaffirm and strengthen the organization’s relationship with existing accounts and their decision to work with S&P Market Intelligence.  Through delivering a positive overall client experience, supporting strategic objectives on the account level, and driving increased client adoption, this role will educate and spread awareness within our client base about S&P Global Market Intelligence’s capabilities.  These efforts are a key factor in revenue retention and growth.
   

  

**What’s In It For You**
 We are looking for someone to grow with the company by not only evolving your client relationship skills, but also your industry knowledge and product knowledge to help clients get the most value from market leading analytical solutions and data services. You may evolve your career within the Customer Success Team by growing within your role or shifting your focus within the team towards a more product-focused role.  You will also develop skills which will prepare you for relationship management, sales or product specialist roles.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Develop and execute proactive, creative, and ongoing contact initiatives in partnership with Marketing, Product, and account team(s)
* Drive continuous service improvement with ultimate goal/focus of product adoption and usage growth
* Evolve the profiles on accounts including all affiliations, geographic presence, and business interests through Sales Force
* Educate and spread awareness within the client-base about our capabilities to increase usage, leveraging the knowledge of product specialists Increase adoption/usage by focusing on distinct users to increase usage and overall increase in number of users
* Provide platform, product functionality and new release training (on-site or virtually) specific to a user job function, liaise with product management team to master new product enhancements and relay client feedback on an ongoing basis
* In partnership with our usage analytics team, monitor product usage and develop account profiles including geographic/departmental presence, relationship history and business interests to support in the develop of renewal proposals and potentially identify upsell opportunities
* Ongoing learning, and deepening that knowledge, of the suite of products and services offered and ongoing enhancements and new offerings and how they relate to customers
* Understand customer business and market trends and suggest ways to help clients address them through education on the product and/or connecting them with the right people internally to address those needs
* Ensure enhancement requests from clients are routed to product stakeholders
* Leverage internal sales tools to optimize client engagement, eg. CRM and Cadence systems


**What We’re Looking For:**
* Positive, proactive attitude and ability to work well in teams
* Exceptional skills in listening to clients, articulating ideas and complex information in a clear and concise manner
* Proven record of maintaining strong relationships with senior members of client organizations, addressing their needs, and maintaining a high level of client satisfaction
* Goal and action orientated, with ability to organize, multi-task and prioritize in a fast-paced environment
* Experience in a consultative sales or a client facing role (inside sales, prospecting, sales support, customer support) and in dealing with challenging situations


**Basic Qualifications**
* Bachelor's degree required (Finance, Economics or related field preferred)
* Strong MS office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) skills are required
* 1-3 years work experience (2 years of experience in financial services industry and/or in a sales/account management role preferred
* Any knowledge of CRM systems (such as Salesforce.com, SalesLoft) or research platforms would be advantageous


**About S&P Global Market Intelligence**
 At S&P Global Market Intelligence, a division of S&P Global we understand the importance of accurate, deep and insightful information. Our team of experts delivers unrivaled insights and leading data and technology solutions, partnering with customers to expand their perspective, operate with confidence, and make decisions with conviction.
   

  

 For more information, visit www.spglobal.com/marketintelligence.
   

  

**What’s In It For** 
**You?**
**Our Mission**
 Advancing Essential Intelligence.
   

  

**Our People**
 We're more than 35,000 strong worldwide—so we're able to understand nuances while having a broad perspective. Our team is driven by curiosity and a shared belief that Essential Intelligence can help build a more prosperous future for us all.From finding new ways to measure sustainability to analyzing energy transition across the supply chain to building workflow solutions that make it easy to tap into insight and apply it. We are changing the way people see things and empowering them to make an impact on the world we live in. We’re committed to a more equitable future and to helping our customers find new, sustainable ways of doing business. Join us and help create the critical insights that truly make a difference.
   

  

**Our Values**
**Integrity, Discovery, Partnership**
 Throughout our history, the world's leading organizations have relied on us for the Essential Intelligence they need to make confident decisions about the road ahead. We start with a foundation of integrity in all we do, bring a spirit of discovery to our work, and collaborate in close partnership with each other and our customers to achieve shared goals.
   

  

**Benefits**
 We take care of you, so you can take care of business. We care about our people. That’s why we provide everything you—and your career—need to thrive at S&P Global.
   

  

**Our Benefits Include**
* Health & Wellness: Health care coverage designed for the mind and body.
* Flexible Downtime: Generous time off helps keep you energized for your time on.
* Continuous Learning: Access a wealth of resources to grow your career and learn valuable new skills.
* Invest in Your Future: Secure your financial future through competitive pay, retirement planning, a continuing education program with a company-matched student loan contribution, and financial wellness programs.
* Family Friendly Perks: It’s not just about you. S&P Global has perks for your partners and little ones, too, with some best-in class benefits for families.
* Beyond the Basics: From retail discounts to referral incentive awards—small perks can make a big difference.


 For more information on benefits by country visit: https://spgbenefits.com/benefit-summaries
   

  

**Global Hiring And Opportunity At S&P Global**
 At S&P Global, we are committed to fostering a connected and engaged workplace where all individuals have access to opportunities based on their skills, experience, and contributions. Our hiring practices emphasize fairness, transparency, and merit, ensuring that we attract and retain top talent. By valuing different perspectives and promoting a culture of respect and collaboration, we drive innovation and power global markets.
   

  

**Recruitment Fraud Alert**
 If you receive an email from a spglobalind.com domain or any other regionally based domains, it is a scam and should be reported to reportfraud@spglobal.com. S&P Global never requires any candidate to pay money for job applications, interviews, offer letters, “pre-employment training” or for equipment/delivery of equipment. Stay informed and protect yourself from recruitment fraud by reviewing our guidelines, fraudulent domains, and how to report suspicious activity here.
   

  

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment.
   

  

 If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to: EEO.Compliance@spglobal.com and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person.
   

  

**US Candidates Only:** 
 The EEO is the Law Poster http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf describes discrimination protections under federal law. Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision - https://www.dol.gov/sites/dolgov/files/ofccp/pdf/pay-transp\_%20English\_formattedESQA508c.pdf
   

  

 20 - Professional (EEO-2 Job Categories-United States of America), SLSGRP202.1 - Middle Professional Tier I (EEO Job Group)
