Som person är du självgående och organiserad samt har erfarenheten att utarbeta strategier och arbeta på eget initiativ. Du är en skicklig problemlösare och tänker kreativt.
   

  

 LÅTER DET INTRESSANT?
   

  

 Rollen är en tillsvidareanställning med 6 månaders inledande provanställning vid vårt trevliga kontor i Alvik Strand, Stockholm. HÄR hittar du information om våra anställningsvillkor. Vid frågor om rollen kontakta gärna rekryterande chef Hanna Höök, på hanna.hook@rb.se. Vi ser fram emot att ta del av din ansökan senast 31 december 2025.
   

  

 Då vi har en anonymiserad rekryteringsprocess ber vi dig att inte ange personliga uppgifter när du svarar på eventuella urvalsfrågor. Vi använder endast CV och inte personligt brev i ansökan. Tänk även på att inte döpa bifogade filer med personuppgifter. Som en del i vår rekryteringsprocess kan vi komma att använda tester i urvalsarbetet för att säkerställa en mer objektiv och inkluderande rekryteringsprocess.
   

  

 Fackliga kontakter:
   

  

 Unionen: Edvin Arnby Machata, edvin.arnby-machata@rb.se
   

  

 Akademikerföreningen: Anna Vikgren, anna.vikgren@rb.se
   

  

*Rädda Barnen ska spegla den jämlikhet vi arbetar för i samhället och eftersträvar mångfald och olikheter. Därför välkomnar vi en bredd av kompetenser, perspektiv och erfarenheter i den här rekryteringen. Rädda Barnen är noga med att vara en säker arbetsplats för barn och vuxna och ber om utdrag ur belastningsregistret i samband med anställning. Slutkandidater kommer även att screenas mot EU:s sanktionslista. Alla medarbetare förväntas följa våra viktiga riktlinjer som handlar om trygghet och säkerhet för alla, samt våra värderingar och etiska riktlinjer. Läs mer om dessa viktiga riktlinjer,* 
*HÄR.*

title: Carhartt WIP Store Stockholm - Sales Assistant (m/f/x) flexible hours
description:
Carhartt WIP is part of the WIP Trading AG. Our family-owned business group started as a licensee and European distributor of the US workwear manufacturer Carhartt in the early 1990s. Since then, it develops its own collections based on workwear originals.
   

  

 Carhartt Work In Progress aims to continuously progress and evolve, without ever losing sight of its origins. Over the course of the past two decades, our business has developed organically, along with its customers, the culture that surrounds the brand, and its employees who have helped shape what Carhartt WIP is today.
   

  

 For our store in Stockholm we are looking for you as
 **Sales Assistant (m/f/x)** 
 part time with flexible hours.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities**
* Provide excellent customer service and adapt brand stories to the retail setting
* Drive sales ensuring that targets are achieved
* Process sales transactions
* Replenish stock and maintain the day-to-day standards in visual displays
* Ensure that all operational store policies and procedures are followed
* Develop your product knowledge


**Your Profile**
* Experience in retail / customer service
* Confident and outgoing
* Effective selling skills
* Fluent in Swedish, English is advantageous


**Please send your documents in English.**

title: Research Specialist in Advanced Molecular Methods
description:
**Do you want to contribute to top quality medical research?**
 Jens-Hjerling Leffler is searching for a committed research specialist to join his research group to establish models for investigations of how schizophrenia-associated risk genes affect neuronal gene expression during adolescence. The work is carried out at the Division of Molecular Neurobiology at the Department of Medical Biochemistry and Biophysics. The overarching goal of the research is to better understand the molecular underpinnings of the neuropsychiatric disorder schizophrenia.
   

  

**Description Of The Subject Area**
 Studies of regulatory mechanisms and gene expression during adolescent brain development by advanced molecular methods.
   

  

**Your mission**
 The responsibilities of the role consist of establishing advanced molecular methods such as CRISPR-based screening, design of viral vectors and single cell RNA-sequencing for applications in mouse models as well as experimental validation applying immunohistochemistry, techniques for in situ detection of RNA and epifluorescence- and confocal imaging. Supervision of junior group members and students as well as writing and publishing of scientific papers are also included in the role.
   

  

**Eligibility Requirements**
 For employment as Research Specialist at Karolinska Institutet, the eligibility requirements stated in the Guidelines for non-teaching positions at Karolinska Institutet are applied in relation to the established profile of employment.
   

  

 To be eligible for employment as a Research Specialist, in addition to holding a Degree of Doctor, PhD, or having a foreign degree deemed equivalent to a Swedish doctoral degree, the applicant must have demonstrated research expertise as well as have documented postdoctoral research experience.
   

  

**Assessment criteria**
**It Is Particularly Meritorious That The Applicant Has Shown**
* Published peer-reviewed articles within spatial transcriptomics and development of molecular methods.
* Documented practical experience of different platforms for single cell transcriptomics.
* Good knowledge in molecular psychiatry and schizophrenia.
* Several years of postdoctoral work within advanced molecular methods.


**It Is Meritorious That The Applicant Has Shown**
* Documented experience of computational analysis of single cell transcriptomic data.
* Fluent in both written and spoken English.
* Excellent skills in experimental documentation.
* Excellent communication skills.
* Experience in data mining using the programming languages Python and R.
* Good supervision skills.
* Proven record of being awarded competitive grants.


 The position involves close collaboration with both other group members and external collaborators. Therefore, emphasis is placed on personal skills such as:
   

  

* Excellent collaborative skills.
* Excellent communication and analytical skills.


 After an overall assessment of the expertise and merits of the applicants in relation to the subject area, Karolinska Institutet will determine which of them has the best potential to contribute to a positive development of the activities at KI.
   

  

**What do we offer?**
 A creative and inspiring environment with wide-ranging expertise and interests. Karolinska Institutet is one of the world's leading medical universities. Here, we conduct successful medical research and hold the largest range of medical education in Sweden. At KI, you get to meet researchers working with a wide range of specialisms and methods, giving you ample opportunity to exchange knowledge and experience with the various scientific fields within medicine and health. It is the crossover collaborations, which have pushed KI to where it is today, at the forefront of global research. Several of the people you meet in healthcare are educated at KI. A close relationship with the health care providers is important for creating groundbreaking top quality education and research. Karolinska Institutet is also a state university, which entitles you to several benefits through our collective agreement.
   

  

**Location:** 
 Solna
   

  

**Application**
 We prefer that Your application is written in English, but You can also apply in Swedish. An application must contain the following documents: PhD certificate, resumé, qualifications and description of planned research, presented in accordance with Karolinska Institutet's qualifications portfolio.
   

  

 Welcome to apply at the latest
 **2025-12-28**
 The application must be submitted through the Varbi recruitment system.
   

  

 Permanent position is initiated by a six months trial period.
   

  

**Want to make a difference? Join us and contribute to better health for all!**
 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100 % | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: STÖD 2-5106/2025 | Kontakt: Professor Jens Hjerling Leffler jens.hjerling-leffler@ki.se, | Facklig företrädare: Anurupa Nagchowdhury (OFR) anurupa.nagchowdhury@ki.se, | Publicerat: 2025-12-11 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-12-28

title: Test Automation QA Engineer (iOS)
description:
**About the Company** 




  





 At FDJ UNITED, we don't just follow the game, we reinvent it. FDJ UNITED is one of Europe’s leading betting and gaming operators, with a vast portfolio of iconic brands and a reputation for technological excellence. With more than 5,000 employees and a presence in around fifteen regulated markets, the Group offers a diversified, responsible range of games, both under exclusive rights and open to competition. We set new standards, proving that entertainment and safety can go hand in hand. Here, you’ll work alongside a team of passionate individuals dedicated to delivering the best and safest entertaining experiences for our customers every day. We’re looking for bold people who are eager to succeed and ready to level-up the game. If you thrive on innovation, embrace challenges, and want to make a real impact at all levels, FDJ UNITED is your playing field. Join us in shaping the future of gaming. Are you ready to LEVEL-UP THE GAME?
 



  





**About the Role** 




  





 At FDJ United, collaboration, innovation, and continuous learning drive everything we do. As part of the iOS team, you'll join a supportive environment where engineers learn from each other, challenge assumptions, and shape the future of our products. We're looking for a Test Automation QA Engineer with strong experience in mobile automation and CI/CD, based in Stockholm, to strengthen our native development capability. You'll contribute directly to high-quality, stable releases across brands while helping evolve our automation strategy and tooling. As part of a regulated group committed to safe and sustainable entertainment, we take reliability, compliance, and responsible development seriously. Every team member helps ensure we maintain a safe, high-quality environment for our players.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 




  




* Develop, maintain, and evolve test automation frameworks for our native apps across multiple brands.
* Design, implement, and execute automated functional, UI, and performance tests to support a high-quality release pipeline.
* Use manual testing as a last resort for edge cases or new features not yet automated.
* Collaborate closely with native developers, Product Owners, architects, and backend/frontend peers in a highly cross-functional setup.
* Participate in design discussions, influencing testing strategy, technical decisions, and best practices.
* Take part in the full software lifecycle, ensuring reliability, monitoring, and continuous improvement through CI/CD.
* Troubleshoot issues, identify root causes, and help drive solutions across teams.
* Support releases and maintain appropriate versioning and documentation.
* Ensure adherence to Governance, Risk & Compliance (GRC) obligations: raising non-compliance concerns, completing mandatory training, and challenging processes that could introduce risk.
* Drive quality culture by suggesting improvements to tools, processes, and overall product experience.



  





**Qualifications** 




  





 Excellent skills with Appium, Cypress, Cucumber, Selenium, and experience with CI/CD pipelines (e.g., Jenkins). Solid test automation development skills in Python. Ability to plan and execute tests across functional, UX, performance, and integration dimensions. Experience working in Agile teams with modern development processes. Understanding of secure development principles and awareness of OWASP practices. Strong communication skills and the ability to both give and receive constructive feedback. Experience acting as Incident Manager or handling production-related quality issues. Comfortable participating in releases and ensuring production reliability. Ability to troubleshoot complex problems and think critically about product quality.
 



  





**Required Skills** 




  




* Excellent skills with Appium, Cypress, Cucumber, Selenium, and experience with CI/CD pipelines (e.g., Jenkins).
* Solid test automation development skills in Python.
* Ability to plan and execute tests across functional, UX, performance, and integration dimensions.
* Experience working in Agile teams with modern development processes.
* Understanding of secure development principles and awareness of OWASP practices.
* Strong communication skills and the ability to both give and receive constructive feedback.
* Experience acting as Incident Manager or handling production-related quality issues.
* Comfortable participating in releases and ensuring production reliability.
* Ability to troubleshoot complex problems and think critically about product quality.



  





**Preferred Skills** 




  




* Experience using Groovy, Bash, Ruby for automation development.
* Familiarity with visual testing, API testing, or cloud device testing (e.g., TestObject, BrowserStack).
* Experience designing high-performance, scalable test applications.

title: Sales Executive - Public
description:
Join GlobalConnect’s Public Sales Team
   

  

 Can you sell network solutions, IT security, outsourcing, and data communication to the public sector?
   

  

 GlobalConnect is strengthening its focus on the public market and is now looking for a Sales Executive to join our Public Sales team. In this role, you will both handle existing public portfolio customers and drive proactive outreach in order to build strong relationships with municipalities and other public institutions across Sweden.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities**
* Proactively identify, engage and develop new prospects within the public sector
* Plan and execute outreach sales activities
* Actively participate in bid and tender processes, incl. EU tenders
* Secure high customer satisfaction throughout the sales process
* Collaborate closely with colleagues across the organization
* Work in a strong commercial team with skilled and supportive peers
* Stay updated on market and technology developments — and share your knowledge


**Your professional profile**
 There are several paths into this role. You may already have industry experience and be ready to operate independently from day one.
   

  

 Alternatively, you have a solid background in solution sales of complex products or services, preferably to the public sector or in environments where you sell bundled solutions.
   

  

 You understand how modern technology and digital infrastructure create value for public customers — and you can communicate that value clearly, convincingly and with impact.
   

  

**Your personal qualities**
* Proactive with a high level of energy
* Strong commercial mindset and a clear “can-do” attitude
* Curious about customer needs and market opportunities
* Skilled in building and maintaining long-term relationships
* Results-oriented and motivated by winning new business
* A true team player
* Enjoys a Nordic work culture with social events and an informal tone


**Why join us?**
 At GlobalConnect, you become part of a Nordic challenger shaping the future of digital infrastructure. You will join a team that values collaboration, professionalism and empowerment — and where your efforts have direct business impact.
   

  

 If this sounds like the right match, we would love to hear from you.
   

  

**Apply now**
 We are looking for a Sales Executive who thrives in customer-facing roles and loves bringing in new business.
   

  

 If you are eager to make a difference in the public market, don’t hesitate to apply — we look forward to meeting you.
   

  

**No need for a personal letter** 
 – just send us your CV or LinkedIn profile.
   

  

**About Us**
 GlobalConnect is one of the leading connectivity providers in Northern Europe. We’re 2000 passionate and talented individuals who want to make a difference, turning our customers’ visions into reality through connectivity. Our goal is to create the best possible conditions for engaged employees, a place where you can develop and grow, and create unforgettable memories and enjoyable experiences.
   

  

 We have helped develop and digitize societies across the Nordics for more than two decades. Our purpose is what drives us to continue - turning visions into reality by empowering society with connectivity.

title: HR medarbetare till Helpdesk HR - Stockholm
description:
Skanska utvecklar och bygger ett bättre samhälle med fokus på hållbarhet. Våra medarbetare är vår största tillgång, och inom HR arbetar vi för att attrahera, utveckla och behålla de bästa medarbetarna i alla roller. Genom ett värdeskapande och hållbart HR-arbete stöttar vi organisationens framtida behov och bidrar till Skanskas löfte om att bygga ett bättre samhälle.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Inom HR finns People Hub, som består av tre geografiska HR-stödgrupper. Deras viktiga uppdrag är att, tillsammans med Helpdesk HR och HR-administration, leverera ett verksamhetsnära, tillgängligt och värdeskapande operativt HR-stöd.
   

  

 Helpdesk HR är den första kontakten för chefer och medarbetare i HR-relaterade frågor. Vår ambition är att erbjuda snabb, korrekt och professionell service genom att ge direkta svar och vägledning i HR-frågor. När specialistkunskap krävs eller en fråga behöver en djupare utredning, eskalerar vi ärenden till rätt funktion inom HR via vårt ärendehanteringssystem.
   

  

 Som en del av Helpdesk HR får du en central roll i att ge stöd inom HR och lön-området och bidra till en smidig och effektiv service för hela organisationen.
   

  

 Inom teamet arbetar vi aktivt med kompetensutveckling, processförbättring och samverkan för att ständigt höja vår servicegrad.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som:**
* Har erfarenhet av HR arbete och/eller löneadministration (2–3 år)
* Har arbetat i en support eller servicefunktion, gärna inom HR eller lön.
* Kommunicerar flytande på svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.
* Har goda kunskaper i HR-relaterade IT-verktyg.
* Det är meriterande om du har en utbildning inom HR eller lön.
* Det är även meriterande om du har erfarenhet av ServiceNow, Oracle Fusion och/eller lönesystemet HRM.


**Vem är du?**
 För att trivas och lyckas i rollen är du serviceinriktad, kommunikativ och trivs med att bemöta chefer och medarbetare via telefon. Du har en förmåga att se verksamhetens perspektiv och skapar förtroende genom ditt sätt att bemöta frågor och lösa problem. Vidare är du självständig, initiativrik och har en stark vilja att utvecklas.
   

  

 Vi på Helpdesk HR arbetar tätt tillsammans och värdesätter en stark laganda. Därför söker vi dig som är en teamspelare och som motiveras av att arbeta mot gemensamma mål.
   

  

**Vill du bli en del av vårt team?**
 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan och att välkomna dig till vårt Helpdesk HR-team, där vi tillsammans arbetar för att skapa ett professionellt och tillgängligt HR-stöd för hela organisationen!
   

  

 Ansök redan i dag eller senast 12 december!
   

  

 Vänta inte med att söka – vi arbetar löpande med ansökningarna! Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Angela D’Antonio, Gruppchef Helpdesk HR, 0708-59 86 87.
   

  

 Tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum.
   

  

 Välkommen till Skanska!

title: Nordic B2C Sales Manager
description:
**Position Summary**
 Help Us Create What Can’t Be Done
   

  

 Everything we do at Samsung is driven by an unyielding passion for excellence—and an unfaltering commitment to develop the best products and services on the market. In today’s fast-paced global economy, change is constant and innovation is critical to a company’s survival. As we have done for over 80 years, we set our sights on the future, anticipating market needs and demands so we can steer our company toward long-term success.
   

  

 As the Nordic B2C Sales Manager within the CE IT division, you will lead a team of Retail Account Managers in building, maintaining, and developing sales of IT products through local and Nordic consumer channels. You will have the full responsibility for the IT business to the consumer market in Nordics, and play the key role in developing and implementing business plans on both the strategic and operational levels.
   

  

**Role And Responsibilities**
 As the Nordic B2C Sales Manager within the CE IT Division, you will be responsible for achieving:
   

  

* Revenue growth across Nordic consumer channels
* Increased market share within the IT consumer segment
* Profitable business performance aligned with strategic objectives
* Consistent delivery on key performance indicators (KPIs) relevant to the category


**What will be the jobs scope?**
 The Nordic B2C Sales Manager will:
   

  

* Lead a team of Retail Account Managers focused on IT product sales through local and Nordic consumer channels
* Own the full responsibility for the IT business to the consumer market in the Nordics
* Develop and implement strategic and operational business plans
* Define and execute a Pan-Nordic Go-to-Market strategy based on:
+ Market sizing and analysis
+ Consumer and tech trends
+ Competitor landscape
+ Channel and customer insights

* Drive proactive sales planning and execution:
+ Annual, quarterly, and monthly sell-in/sell-out plans
+ Product-specific sales and campaign plans per account
+ Weekly updates in internal systems and reporting to stakeholders
+ Weekly review of sales progress and channel stock with corrective actions

* Capture and report Voice of Customer insights regularly
* Collaborate with Product Management and internal teams to share market feedback
* Co-create and evaluate channel marketing plans with the CE IT Marketing organization


**Skills And Qualifications**
**Need to have:**
* Proven experience as a people manager
* Strong track record in sales leadership
* Retail experience, ideally as a Key Account Manager (KAM)
* Business acumen and experience in CXO-level selling
* Fluent English (written and spoken)
* Willingness to travel a minimum of 50 days annually
* Academic degree in a relevant field such as Economics, Business Administration, Marketing, or Management


**Nice to have:**
* Experience in Nordic consumer electronics or IT markets
* Familiarity with internal sales systems and campaign planning tools
* Multilingual capabilities (Nordic languages)


**Attributes:**
* Strategic thinker with operational execution skills
* Strong leadership and coaching abilities
* Excellent negotiation and communication skills
* Analytical mindset with a proactive approach
* Collaborative and customer-focused


 Samsung is a dynamic company in a fast moving industry, there are many opportunities to grow and develop! In order to enjoy working with us you must be a person who appreciates tempo, change and to take own initiatives.
   

  

**Help Us Create What Can’t Be Done**
* Please visit Samsung membership to see Privacy Policy, which defaults according to your location, at: https://account.samsung.com/membership/policy/privacy. You can change Country/Language at the bottom of the page. If you are European Economic Resident, please click here: https://europe-samsung.com/ghrp/PrivacyNoticeforEU.html

title: Support Agent (Finnish & Swedish speaking) Stockholm
description:
****J** 
 oin Telavox as a Support Agent 🔎 📞**
 At Telavox, we’re looking for a Support Agent to be our customers' first point of contact, helping them with technical and financial inquiries while ensuring every issue is handled efficiently and professionally. Our customers range from small companies with 10 employees to our largest Enterprise clients, which means that the cases and questions from customers vary a lot. If you enjoy troubleshooting, owning customer dialogues, and working in a dynamic environment, this role is for you!
   

  

 This position is based in our office in Stockholm, where you’ll join a team of dedicated Support Agents ( who work from Malmö). We work closely together, share knowledge, and continually develop our skills to deliver top-notch service.
   

  

**About The Job**
 We’re looking for someone who enjoys helping customers, has a problem-solving mindset, and is comfortable taking responsibility for issues. You like working in a dynamic environment, collaborating with others, and have an interest in IT solutions.
   

  

**A Typical Day In This Role Involves**
* Handling incoming customer requests via phone and email, resolving non-complex issues on the first contact
* Responding to tickets within 8 working hours and ensuring professional case documentation
* Driving escalations together with SOC (Service Operations Center) to secure the best solutions
* Collaborating with our Customer Success Managers and Key Account Managers
* Actively demonstrating product value, helping customers optimize their usage of Telavox’s services


**About You**
 We’re looking for someone who enjoys helping customers, has a problem-solving mindset, and is comfortable taking responsibility for issues. You like working in a dynamic environment, collaborating with others, and have an interest in IT solutions.
   

  

**Competencies**
* Experience in customer service, technical support, or a similar role
* Fluent in Finnish, Swedish, and English, both written and spoken
* Enjoys problem-solving with a hands-on and solution-focused approach
* Good communication skills and comfortable handling customer interactions
* Basic technical understanding and an interest in troubleshooting IT issues
* Able to work both independently and as part of a team
* Eager to learn and share knowledge to improve processes and customer experience
* You enjoy interacting with people and feel motivated when the job involves challenges and problem-solving


****Join us at Telavox 💚****
 Since Telavox's journey started in 2002, we have strengthened our position as the leading forward-thinking communication platform for businesses. As a digital mobile operator, we develop and own our all-in-one communication platform, which integrates telephony, PBX, messaging, meetings, and contact centers, giving businesses a smarter way to connect.
   

  

 Today, we’re a thriving company with 1.9 billion SEK in revenue and 500+ Telavoxers across nine countries. We embrace AI and automation to push the boundaries of business communication.
   

  

 We offer flexible work options and adaptable hours, giving you the freedom to balance life and career while staying connected to our vibrant Telavox culture.
   

  

 Read more about our offices and new HQ in Malmö 🏠!
   

  

**How to apply!**
 At Telavox, we don't focus on fitting in; we focus on making room for everyone.
   

  

 We’re always on the lookout for great talent, so applications are reviewed continuously. If you're ready to be part of an innovative, AI-driven telecom company, apply today with your CV and cover letter in English.
   

  

 For any questions, feel free to reach out to Talent Acquisition Partner Ami Faraguna at ann-marie.faraguna@telavox.com
   

  

 🎄
 **Holiday coming up 💫**
 Thank you for your interest in joining Telavox! Please note that due to the holiday season, our recruitment team will have limited availability. We will review applications and respond to inquiries
 **after January 12th.**
 We appreciate your patience and wish you a joyful holiday season! 🌟
   

  

**Learn more about what we do! ⬇️**
 Telavox develops world-leading communications platforms with solutions for smart and efficient telephony, PBX, chat and much more. Regardless of whether it involves an entrepreneur-driven startup or a giant among giants, Telavox contributes to making companies more transparent, efficient and accessible.

title: Sales Executive (Service Line Sales) - IOA (BPO)
description:
**Sales Executive – IOA (BPO)**
**Role** 
 - The candidate will be hired as “
 ****Service Line Specialist”****
 at Associate Director level reporting to VP, Market Lead IOA EMEA.
   

  

**Title -** 
****Service Line Specialist (Sales executive)****
**Location:** 
 Sweden
   

  

**Travel** 
 – Weekly travel will vary depending on customer and prospect requirements.
   

  

**Summary Of Department Focus**
 Intuitive Operations & Automation (IOA) business unit is one of Cognizant’s highest growth businesses and a critical part of Cognizant’s Digital imperatives in the market. Nordics is a high-growth region and IOA is looking at expanding its presence further. One of IOA’s strategic growth objectives is Nordics region markets and IOA is looking for a highly accomplished, results-driven sales executive to
 ****originate, advance, and close large sales opportunities****
 in BPO. This individual will be working with industry community (Client Partners, SLM (Service line managers) IOA leadership and the Nordics MCU (Market Commercial Unit) leadership to drive
 ****sales and business development****
 in a high growth and highly autonomous environment.
   

  

**Summary Job Description**
* Define and improve the go-to-market plans, offerings, and value propositions.
* Drive sales and pipeline
* Build strong internal relationships with Cognizant’s Nordics MCU & MDU (Market Commercial & Delivery Unit) leadership, IOA Commercial/Offshore Delivery Heads and other core leaders.


**Key Accountabilities**
* Closing Sales - The main responsibility and focus of the role will be the growth of our IOA business within Europe. Specifically, win new deals in customer account per pre agreed targets.
* Sales Plan Creation – A critical early task will be developing and executing a growth plan for Enterprise Services
* Pipeline Management – Among the critical tasks likely be featured in the sales plans, are developing the opportunity pipeline, qualifying high priority deals and winning new business in line with agreed targets.
* Demand Generation – To work with IOA and Nordics MCU teams to identify prospects, create marketing plans and take responsibility to engage new clients in conversation.
* Proposal Development - Understand customer needs and translate them into winning proposals for Cognizant and its customer in partnership with the presales and solution teams.
* IOA Solution Development Oversight – As a pursuit leader, partner with IOA solution architects, delivery teams and other horizontal practices (e.g., AIA, EAS) to create effective deal solutions.
* Deal Shaping / Pricing Development – Develop creative deal shapes, commercial structures, and pricing proposals as part of a winning sales pursuit. Work closely with the business unit and regional FP&A teams
* C-Level Client Relationship Building - Build relationships across CXO levels in client organizations and developing executive level relationships.
* Renewal deals in the industry - Build relationships with the potential customers by working with Vertical and Country teams. Build disruptive propositions to hunt and win these businesses in the industry.


**Key Competencies**
* BPO - Deep understanding of Business process outsourcing/Digitization and able to engage Customers in BPO deal, solution, transition, and transformation shaping discussions.
* IOA Solution Development - Experience in developing BPO solutions ground up, in partnership with different stakeholders within an organisation.
* Hands on participation in solution and content development
* Industry Experience - Demonstrated ability to understand business process challenges in one or more of our key industries and translating the needs in developing compelling business process solutions with a strong focus on technology-enabled process delivery.
* Global Experience – Significant international experience required including being conversant in global service delivery models – both shared services and IOA.
* Verbal Communication Skills – Excellent public speaking and presentation skills including the ability to convey a set of complex and detailed deal elements in a compelling, engaging, and easy to understand manner suitable for C-level buyers.
* Written Communication Skills – Ability to create compelling sales story lines and PowerPoint decks for presentation to C-level executives.
* Approach to Work - Possess the innate ability to thrive in a fast-paced, client-focused, changing environment and work independently in a self-directed manner.


**Knowledge**
* Global Business Services - Client-facing GBS project experience is preferred.
* Technology - Understanding of technology solutions is required, especially how it affect business and operations.
* Professional Contacts - Existing strong relationships with third party advisors, industry analyst, and potential C-level buyers is preferred.
* Hybrid Work Environment - Experience working in a hybrid work environment is preferred.


**Experience**
* Demonstrable seasoned experience in selling Enterprise Services (Finance & Accounting, Procurement, HR/Payroll, Contract Centre/Service desk or Sales Operations) or Domain specific solutions within P&R (MLEU and RCGTH) in BPO/Consulting services working for a blue-chip company.
* Executive-level interpersonal, verbal, written and presentation skills, good listener, ability to provide a trusted voice at the decision-making table and be an advocate of Cognizant’s vision and value proposition.
* Experience in proactively growing customer relationships within an account while expanding their understanding of the customer’s business.
* You should be able to meet/deliver annual sales target of 25M TCV.


**Qualifications**
* Degrees – CPA, MBA, or advanced degree in related field is preferred.


**About Cognizant**
 Cognizant (NASDAQ: CTSH) is a leading provider of information technology, consulting, and business process outsourcing services, dedicated to helping the world's leading companies build stronger businesses. Headquartered in Teaneck, New Jersey (U.S.), Cognizant combines a passion for client satisfaction, technology innovation, deep industry and business process expertise, and a global, collaborative workforce that embodies the future of work. With over 75 delivery centres worldwide and approximately 220,000 employees as of October 31, 2015, Cognizant is a member of the NASDAQ-100, the S&P 500, the Forbes Global 2000, and the Fortune 500 and ranked among the top performing and fastest growing companies in the world. Visit us online at
 ****www.cognizant.com****
 or follow us on Twitter: @Cognizant.

title: Seniora experter sökes till Sveriges säkraste system
description:
Vill du vara med och bidra till ett säkrare samhälle?
 



  





 För över femton år sedan startade Basalt med en enkel men avgörande idé att stärka Sveriges motståndskraft. Idag är vi ett av landets ledande produkt- och konsultbolag inom verksamhets och säkerhetsskydd och vi fortsätter växa. Samtidigt är vi ett stabilt och välmående bolag som värnar om vår familjära kultur och om medarbetarnas välbefinnande. Hos oss får du anställningstrygghet, respekt, konkurrenskraftig pension och förmåner samt en balans mellan arbete och fritid. Vi prioriterar lärande och utveckling och du får möjlighet att göra verklig skillnad och samtidigt må bra.
 



  





 "
 *Vi startade Basalt för att vi ville bidra till ett säkrare samhälle och den drivkraften är lika stark idag. Vi har aldrig kompromissat med vår mission, oavsett trender eller omvärld. Det är jag stolt över.* 
 " - Nicklas Haglund, vd Basalt
 



  





 På Basalt utvecklar vi marknadens säkraste it-plattform Craton och stöttar samhällsviktiga aktörer i att skydda sina mest värdefulla tillgångar mot både yttre och inre hot. Genom våra lösningar bidrar vi till att hålla igång de verksamheter som får samhället att fungera även vid stora störningar eller kriser. Här får du arbeta med teknik som gör konkret skillnad och ingå i ett team som drivs av innovation, kvalitet och ett tydligt syfte.
 



  





**Nu söker vi seniora experter som vill göra verklig skillnad** 




 Basalt fortsätter växa och går in i en fas där vi behöver förstärka vårt expertteam. Vi söker dig som vill ta Basalt till nästa nivå och trivs i roller där du verkar som senior teknisk expert.
 



  





 Hos oss får du utveckla teknik som påverkar Sveriges säkerhet på riktigt och du gör det tillsammans med kollegor som kombinerar hög teknisk nivå med ett genuint engagemang för samhällsviktig innovation.
 



  





 Du kan mest inom ditt område. Du är den go-to person andra vänder sig till när det behövs riktning, beslut eller teknisk tyngd. Du tar dig an komplexa utmaningar och du driver teknisk förändring med ett lugn. Du trivs med att vara mentor och vägleda dina kollegor.
 



  





**Vill du vara med och ta oss till nästa nivå** 




 Visa ditt intresse eller hör av dig till mig Kajsa Stina Åkerblom på kajsa stina.akerblom@basalt.se om du vill veta mer. Jag berättar gärna hur din erfarenhet kan stärka vårt expertteam.
 



  





**Placering och säkerhet** 




 Vi har kontor i centrala Stockholm och i Enköping och du utgår från det kontor som passar dig bäst.
 



  





 Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetande. Eftersom våra kunders verksamhet kräver det och flera av våra anställda är placerade i säkerhetsklass, är svenskt medborgarskap ett villkor för att arbeta på Basalt.
 



  





**Vad vi erbjuder** 




 För att ge dig trygghet och stabilitet erbjuder vi ett förmånspaket som inkluderar en av marknadens bästa pensionslösningar, omfattande försäkringar, förstärkt föräldralön och ett generöst friskvårdsbidrag på 5 000 kr/år. Du får även tillgång till Benifex, där du kan hitta extra förmåner och vi erbjuder kontinuerliga möjligheter till kompetensutveckling. Vi erbjuder också tjänstledighet med löneutfyllnad för medarbetare som tjänstgör inom Försvarsmakten, inklusive GSS/T, reservofficerare och hemvärnssoldater.
 



  





 Vi värnar om balansen mellan arbete och fritid. Med flexibla arbetstider, 5-timmars arbetsdag innan helgdagar och ledigt på klämdagar ser vi till att du har tid för både ditt jobb och ditt privatliv. Dessutom anordnar vi gemensamma aktiviteter, såsom skidresor, träningspass samt sociala luncher och frukostar, för att stärka sammanhållningen och göra arbetsplatsen ännu trevligare.
 



  





 Vi strävar efter att du ska känna stolthet och trivsel hos oss på Basalt. Du kan läsa mer om våra förmåner och om hur det är att arbeta på Basalt här!
 



  





**Om Craton** 




 Basalt Craton är en modern it-plattform framtagen specifikt för säkerhetskänslig verksamhet med syftet att uppfylla både Säkerhetspolisens föreskrifter om säkerhetsskydd samt Försvarsmaktens krav på it-säkerhetsfunktioner för att hantera information i säkerhetsskyddsklass upp till och med HEMLIG. Plattformen är även anpassad till en internationell kontext för Nato- och EU-Secret.
 



  





 Ett Cratonsystem är ett komplett fysiskt it-system som dimensioneras, byggs och installeras på standardiserad hård- och mjukvara för driftsättning med luftgap, dvs utan koppling till andra nätverk (inklusive internet). Basalt ansvarar för utveckling, produktion och förvaltning av Cratonsystemet enligt en metod helt baserad på IaC (Infrastructure as Code). Våra kunder ansvarar endast för driften av systemet på plats.
 



  





 Standardmässigt innehåller ett Cratonsystem ett antal inbyggda tjänster för att täcka grundläggande behov inom säkerhetskänslig verksamhet, men detta kompletteras ofta med kundspecifika verksamhetsapplikationer.
 



  





**Basalt i korthet:** 



* Grundat 2009, idag ca 130 medarbetare
* Kontor i Stockholm och Enköping
* En del av Omegapoint Group
* Ledande inom säkra it-lösningar och systematiskt säkerhetsarbete
* Vision: att vara det självklara valet för ett robust och säkert samhälle

title: Verksamhetsutvecklare inom Betalning i Östersund
description:
Placeringsort Flera orterDiarienummer FK 2025/027956
   

  

 Logga in och sök jobbet Öppnas i nytt fönster
   

  

*Varje år fattar Försäkringskassan 21 miljoner beslut som påverkar människors liv och hela samhället. Vi betalar ut cirka 260 miljarder kronor varje år. Det är allas skattepengar vi har hand om. Det är ett stort ansvar. Därför sätter vi oss in i varje ärende, följer lagar och regler, informerar och vägleder, bryr oss och visar omtanke. Det är ett jobb för dig som vill vara med och ta ansvar. Välkommen till Försäkringskassan.*
 Vill du ha ett samhällsviktigt uppdrag och är beredd att ta ansvar? Bli en nyckelspelare i ett team som utvecklar och förvaltar processer och system bakom Försäkringskassans betalfunktioner. Vårt uppdrag är att säkerställa säkerheten och effektiviteten för de utbetalningar av ersättningar och bidrag som görs för Försäkringskassan och Pensionsmyndigheten. Varje år gör vi över 50 miljoner utbetalningar motsvarande ca 600 miljarder kronor.
   

  

 Område Betalning ansvarar för att utveckla och förvalta Försäkringskassans betalningssystem och verksamhetsprodukter inom området. Vi tecknar också Försäkringskassans avtal för betaltjänster och är som product owners kravställare mot IT och externa parter för tjänster som rör utbetalningar. Vår enhet består av ca 10 medarbetare med placering i Stockholm och Östersund.
   

  

 Utveckling, kravhantering och tvärfunktionellt teamarbete
   

  

 Vi söker nu en verksamhetsutvecklare som kan arbeta med att genomföra aktiviteter i större och mindre utvecklingsprojekt, likväl som förvaltningsaktiviteter. Arbetet innebär ett nära samarbete med övriga kollegor inom området, handläggande verksamhet och IT-team. Du arbetar över organisatoriska gränser inom myndigheten och kan komma att representera området i externa kontakter. Exempel på arbetsuppgifter är genomförande av mindre utvecklingsaktiviteter, kravställning, incidenthantering, löpande uppdatering av betalprocesser och styrande dokument, m.m. Många av arbetsuppgifterna är av operativ karaktär och vi söker därför dig som har ett intresse av en karriär inom verksamhetsutveckling och vill växa in i rollen.
   

  

 Tjänsten innebär att du hanterar sekretessbelagda uppgifter vilket ställer höga krav på rätt hantering. Därför är det viktigt att du som ska arbeta hos oss har högt säkerhetsmedvetande.
   

  

 Det är ett jobb för dig som vill vara med och ta ansvar.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som
   

  

* har examen från högskola/universitet eller erfarenheter som bedöms likvärdiga
* har flerårig erfarenhet från arbete inom verksamhetsområdet betalning och ekonomi
* kan förstå och snabbt sätta dig in i sakfrågor
* agerar på eget initiativ och tar ansvar för att nå goda resultat
* har kunskaper i projektledning och olika samverkansformer
* har god kommunikativ förmåga, i både tal och skrift
* samarbetar effektivt med andra för att nå gemensamma mål
* har förmåga att skapa ett användbart nätverk
* har ett lösningsorienterat förhållningssätt.


 Det är meriterande om du
   

  

* har arbetat flera år inom statlig myndighet eller större organisation
* har erfarenhet av kravställning av större verksamhetskritiska system eller betalflöden
* har erfarenhet av agila arbetsmetoder
* har erfarenhet av att ha medverkat i större utvecklingsinitiativ och förflyttningar.


 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
   

  

 Övrigt
   

  

 1 tjänst, tillsvidare, heltid, med tillträde enligt överenskommelse. Provanställning kan bli aktuellt. I enlighet med Försäkringskassans riktlinje för säkerhet genomförs bakgrundskontroller i denna rekrytering. Möjlighet till distansarbete finns om arbetet tillåter. I den här rekryteringen kan arbetspsykologiska test användas som en del i urvalsarbetet. Placeringsort är Stockholm eller Östersund.
   

  

 Vill du veta mer om Försäkringskassan som arbetsgivare? Besök fk.se/jobbahososs
   

  

 Kontaktpersoner
   

  

 Chef: Johanna Ruthström, 010-114 18 62 (för frågor om tjänsten), tillgänglig 8–19/12 samt 7–9/1. HR-specialist: Ulrika Mentzer Jemdahl, ulrika.mentzer.jemdahl@forsakringskassan.se, 010-113 97 41 (för frågor om rekryteringsprocessen), tillgänglig 8–19/12 samt 7–9/1. ST: Annika Borg, 010- 116 34 74, Saco-S: Disa Thorsvad, 010-112 52 46, Seko: Johanna Grundström, 010- 115 30 44.
   

  

 Ansökan
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan senast den 9 januari 2026. Ladda gärna upp dina examensbevis, betyg och intyg i samband med din ansökan.
   

  

 Har du skyddade personuppgifter eller ingen tillgång till bank-id ringer du den HR-specialist som finns namngiven i annonsen så får du hjälp med att skicka in din ansökan.
   

  

 Vi ska i allt vi gör, agera med utgångspunkt i principen om alla människors lika värde, rättssäkerhet och med god service.

title: Senior Product Marketing Manager
description:
At Hive Streaming, we enable the world’s largest enterprises to use live video as a strategic tool for communication, alignment, and impact. Trusted by more than 130 global customers, Hive combines market-leading video distribution technology with unique communication analytics, helping organizations ensure flawless video experiences and measure how effectively messages reach, engage, and align employees.
   

  

 Our users are IT and Network professionals who rely on Hive every day to ensure flawless video delivery, Event Producers who ensure optimal video experience during internal company events, Leaders and Communications professionals who plan and execute powerful video-enabled strategies to deliver measurable impact.
   

  

 What do we do - really? No better way to explain what Hive actually does than with a video 🎥 Watch the video below to find out more 👇🏼
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a
 **Senior Product Marketing Manager** 
 , you will play a critical role in shaping how Hive’s products are positioned in the market and understood by our customers. You will own go-to-market success, ensuring that our innovations resonate with enterprise buyers and users alike. This is a highly cross-functional role where you’ll collaborate with Product Development, Sales and Solution Engineering, to tell a compelling story of Hive’s value and impact. You will be part of the Global Marketing function and directly report to the Head of Global Marketing, with a dotted line reporting relationship with Chief Product Officer.
   

  

**Working As a Senior Product Marketing Manager, You Will**
* Lead go-to-market (GTM) planning and execution for new product launches, feature rollouts, and strategic initiatives.
* Act as the voice of the customer and market throughout the product lifecycle; bringing insights from research, competitive analysis, and industry trends to inform product positioning and differentiation opportunities
* Craft differentiated messaging and positioning frameworks that articulate Hive’s unique value across channels, in line with Hive’s growth plays.
* Partner with Product Management, Sales, and Solution Engineering to create impactful enablement tools (such as sales decks, battlecards, or customer-facing teams training).
* Develop and showcase customer stories and advocacy, amplifying customer impact internally and externally.
* Ensure Hive’s website, campaigns, and collateral reflect our value proposition in a clear, consistent, and engaging way
* Continuously align Product Marketing priorities and deliveries to the Global Marketing roadmap.


 Although Product Marketing is the core responsibility, the Global Marketing Team works with a T-shaped mindset, combining specialist expertise with broad marketing knowledge to adapt and provide support across the wider marketing function as priorities shift.
   

  

**More Details**
**Role type** 
 : Full-time with a standard probation period
   

  

**Start date** 
 : March 2026 (flexible)
   

  

**Working hours** 
 : Align with CET (Central European Time)
   

  

**Location** 
 : Stockholm, Sweden (Hybrid: 2-3 days/week in the office)
   

  

 🐶
 *Just a heads up, we're a dog-friendly office!*
 Who we are looking for
   

  

 We're looking for someone with a strong marketing foundation, but just as importantly, the right attitude. At Hive, how you work is just as valuable as what you know. We also don’t expect you to tick every box. If you’re excited about this role and ready to learn, we’d love to hear from you!
   

  

**We Are Looking For Someone With**
* Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, or other relevant area, or equivalent experience.
* Significant professional experience within product marketing in B2B technology or enterprise software (approximately 5+ years).
* Proven ability to own go-to-market strategy and deliver measurable business impact.
* Strong communicator who can simplify complexity and tell compelling product stories.
* Deep understanding of enterprise customer needs, buyer journeys, and industry trends.
* Skilled in market research, competitive analysis, and turning insights into actionable plans.
* Comfortable communicating for impact and collaborating across functions and influencing at all levels.
* A foundational understanding of customer centric and outcome-driven product development practices.


**And Just As Importantly, We Believe You Are**
* A self-starter who thrives in a collaborative and diverse environment.
* A team player who shares information, builds on others’ ideas, and promotes collective success.
* Someone who genuinely cares about the customer experience and wants to make an impact.
* Embraces a growth mindset - welcoming feedback with resilience and offering it constructively, while continuously improving products, processes, and yourself.
* A good communicator, seeking first to understand and then to be understood.
* Motivated to work in a company where innovation, empowerment, and customer focus are part of the everyday culture.


 Why join Hive?
   

  

* Global Impact: Partner with some of the world’s largest enterprises, helping them achieve alignment and measurable success through live video.
* Dynamic, Product-Driven Culture: Join a collaborative, inclusive, and diverse environment that values curiosity, continuous learning, and new perspectives.
* Empowered Leadership: Play a pivotal role in shaping Hive’s future while connecting directly with the customers who rely on our solutions.
* Pioneering Innovation: Be at the forefront of building strategic communication tools that empower enterprises to thrive amidst massive change.
* Great Benefits: Wellness stipend, pension, health insurance, extra vacation days, benefit bikes, and more!
* Flexibility: We value flexibility and trust. Whether you’re balancing personal commitments or exploring new ideas, you’ll find support and autonomy here with flexible working hours and a hybrid work model.


 Recruitment process: what to expect
   

  

 To apply, please submit your CV and answer a few short questions in lieu of a cover letter directly in the application form. Please submit all documents in English by January 6th.
   

  

**PLEASE NOTE:** 
 Due to the holidays, we will review all applications January 7th - 9th and plan to start with first interviews during week 3 of 2026.
   

  

 Our hiring process is designed to be transparent and collaborative:
   

  

* Intro call: Meet our People & Talent Partner and share more about your motivation.
* Hiring Manager interview: Meet our Head of Global Marketing to discuss your Product Marketing journey.
* Product Marketing case interview: Collaborate on a relevant challenge together with your functional lead and marketing team peers.
* Culture interview: Meet our CCO & CEO to align on values and vision.
* Reference checks: We take security seriously and conduct two reference checks as part of our compliance with internal and regulatory requirements.
* Decision: Timely feedback and next steps - our goal is to complete the process by week 6, depending on your availability.

title: Account Manager - Instruments/Systems
description:
**Overview**
 As a Systems Account Manager you will be responsible for a territory of varied accounts which will be managed through a consultancy and partnering approach to design and deliver solutions that will benefit our customers. Accounts can require bespoke, cutting edge solutions others require off the shelf solutions. Our Account Managers are responsible for balancing and managing a territory of well-established accounts with a good installation base with the expectation that they can grow accounts and sales base.
   

  

 Within a typical week our Account Managers will develop a pipeline, manage opportunities and provide forecasts to the management team. Regularly meeting with customers in person or virtually to explore avenues of partnering with them as well as introducing new technology. Our Account Managers work closely with the marketing teams and our demo lab chemists.
   

  

 This activity requires strong account management, customer service and rapport building skills as well as an ability to talk through a customer’s system requirements.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 Responsibilities:
   

  

* Ensuring the health of your current territory - approaching new and existing customers, customer visits, delivering workshops on customer sites, providing technical advise to customers reviewing their systems needs.
* Reviewing and developing your pipeline on a weekly to monthly basis.
* Assessing future pipeline- evaluating customers who are interested in working with Waters solutions and instrumentation; providing applications support to our demo chemists and facility in Manchester


 Being a Systems Account Manager involves travel throughout the territory of responsibility and brings you a great degree of flexibility in how you manage your accounts and how you work in the field!
   

  

 This is a great opportunity to build a successful sales record with the leading measurement company and a great opportunity to learn loads along the way. There are multiple avenues to grow further in Waters both within the role and beyond depending on what you would like to do - this could be within systems sales, marketing or in one of our more technical positions.
   

  

**Qualifications**
 Requirements:
   

  

* You may have worked in a lab previously or had a sales position. Both are great for us in this role!
* Knowledge or a qualification in a Scientific discipline and experience with Liquid Chromatography and Mass Spectrometry would be useful
* A proactive individual committed to customer service and passionate about making processes more efficient and reliable.
* Great problem-solving skills to support our customers address some of their systems challenges


 In return you will receive:
   

  

* Competitive salary
* Company Car
* Sales Incentive Plan
* 25 days annual leave
* Private health and dental insurance
* Contributory based pension scheme


 We are proud to be a “Best Place to Work” for equality as awarded by the European Human Rights Campaign Foundation and at Wilmslow we work with a number of partners including Stonewall, STEM Women and STEM Returners in ensuring we are an open and inclusive workplace where people can bring their whole selves to work – this is really important to us! When you join Waters you can contribute to this mission by joining our European Diversity Hub!
   

  

 Diversity and inclusion are fundamental to our core values at Waters Corporation. It is our responsibility to actively implement programs and practices to drive inclusive behavior and increase diversity across the organization. We are united by diversity and thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products, our customers and our community.
   

  

**Company Description**
 Waters Corporation (NYSE:WAT) is a global leader in analytical instruments, separations technologies, and software, serving the life, materials, food, and environmental sciences for over 65 years. Our Company helps ensure the efficacy of medicines, the safety of food and the purity of water, and the quality and sustainability of products used every day. In over 100 countries, our 7,600+ passionate employees collaborate with customers in laboratories, manufacturing sites, and hospitals to accelerate the benefits of pioneering science .
   

  

 Diversity and inclusion are fundamental to our core values at Waters Corporation. It benefits our employees, our products, our customers and our community. Waters complies with all applicable federal, state, and local laws. Qualified applicants are considered without regard to sex, race, color, ancestry, national origin, citizenship status, religion, age, marital status (including civil unions), military service, veteran status, pregnancy (including childbirth and related medical conditions), genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, legally recognized disability, domestic violence victim status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Waters is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. All hiring decisions are based solely on qualifications, merit, and business needs at the time.

title: Strategic Initiatives & Market Intelligence Specialist at DeLaval
description:
*Do you have a strong strategic mindset, a passion for driving business growth, and extensive experience in corporate strategy and market analysis? Then you might be the Strategic Initiatives & Market Intelligence Specialist we are looking for to help DeLaval shape its long-term growth and strategic direction.* 




  





**The role** 




 DeLaval is a global leader in dairy farming solutions, with over 140 years of experience, 4,500 employees, and operations in more than 100 markets. We aim to continue leading the market while supporting farmers in producing high-quality milk and preserving cow health.
 



 As Strategic Initiatives & Market Intelligence Specialist, you will contribute to shaping and executing DeLaval’s strategic agenda. This hands-on, strategic role involves long-term initiatives such as partnerships and M&A, as well as operational projects with immediate impact. You will work closely with senior management to provide actionable insights, develop strategic frameworks, and support executive decision-making.
 



  





**Key responsibilities** 



* Lead and coordinate the development and implementation of selected strategic initiatives in cooperation with the relevant line organization’s strategic objectives. Support execution of Strategic Initiatives, including M&A and Partnership activities
* Supporting the development and maintenance of the Strategic Market Intelligence Services. Lead and coordinate strategic projects, managing internal teams to analyze selected initiatives, facilitate workshops, and ensure timely project execution
* Develop strategic frameworks and conduct economic and business analyses independently to support executive decision-making
* Build comprehensive business cases in close collaboration with business leads, ensuring alignment with strategic objectives
* Support implementation of selected internal strategic initiatives, ensuring milestones and deliverables are met. Contribute to the company’s overall strategy process by providing structured market and competitive analyses that inform senior management decisions
* Deliver actionable market insights through ad hoc studies leveraging internal and external data sources. Contribute to regular management and board-level reporting, synthesizing strategic insights and business recommendations



  





**Your profile** 




 We are looking for someone with strong analytical capabilities who thrives in a strategic, data-driven environment and wants to contribute to shaping DeLaval’s future direction. To succeed in this role, we believe you bring the following experience and competencies:
 



  




* Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Engineering, Agriculture, or related field; MBA or Master’s preferred, and at least 8 years of relevant experience, ideally in B2B, corporate strategy, or corporate development
* Strong expertise in market research, competitive analysis, strategic planning, and financial analysis
* Proven project management skills and experience in leading cross-functional teams, and ability to translate complex analyses into clear strategic recommendations
* Experience with M&A, investments, or strategic partnerships is a plus
* Proficiency in Excel, PowerPoint and financial databases
* Excellent business English, written and verbal



  





**Why DeLaval?** 




 Our core values Passion, People, Professionals and Partnerships connect individuals across entities and geographies. Success is far more than knowledge – it is strongly related to behaviors. At DeLaval we are all guided by our three preferred behaviors: Set Direction, Make Things Happen and One DeLaval.
 



 Joining DeLaval means being part of a global organization with a long tradition of innovation and impact. In this role you will collaborate closely with senior leaders, contribute to strategic initiatives that shape the company’s future, and have the opportunity to make a tangible impact on the dairy farming industry.
 



 DeLaval is headquartered in Tumba, and the role offers the possibility to work in a hybrid setup. For more information, please visit www.delaval.com
 



  





**How to apply** 




 In this recruitment process, DeLaval is collaborating with Jurek Executive Search. You are warmly welcome to submit your application via the link. For questions, please contact: Malin Sjöström: malin.sjostrom@jurek.se

title: Lead React Native Developer
description:
**Do you enjoy taking the complexity of cross-platform development and turning it into something clear, elegant, and reliable? The kind of person who can see the big picture, untangle tricky technical decisions, and still get joy from polishing the details that make an app feel truly great? At Framna, we are looking for a Lead React Native Developer who can guide teams through those decisions, balancing user experience, performance, and platform quirks, while still loving hands-on coding. You will help set the technical direction, unlock teammates, and shape products used by millions.** 




  





**Become part of the team** 




  





 Framna partners with some of the world’s most ambitious brands, like Swish, SJ, Essity, and SEB, to create digital products that define markets and deliver real-world impact. We are now more than 600 people across ten studios, building apps used by millions every day.
 



 As our next Lead React Native Developer, you will be part of a cross-functional product team of designers, developers, QA engineers, analysts, and product leads who take ideas from first concept to real-world product. You will also take on a broader role, guiding technical decisions, coaching teammates, and ensuring the team builds with both quality and long-term thinking in mind.
 



  





 On top of that you will contribute to our Cross Platform competence area, a company-wide group where app developers meet regularly to exchange knowledge, deepen their skills, and grow professionally together.
 



  





**What you’ll do** 




  





 This role blends hands-on engineering, technical direction, and supporting your teammates to deliver high-quality product experiences.
 



  





 More specifically, you will:
 


* Build and maintain React Native applications used by millions of users.
* Write high-quality TypeScript and ensure your features work beautifully across both Android and iOS. To do this, we embrace and utilize both your expertise as well as AI-powered tooling.
* Drive architectural and technical decisions, ensuring solutions are robust, scalable, and maintainable.
* Collaborate closely with designers and product teams to bring concepts to life with smooth UI, thoughtful interactions, and polished app behavior.
* Navigate platform-specific challenges, and help the team understand when (and how) to leverage native modules.
* Lead technical discussions, guide trade-offs, and bring clarity when decisions get complex.
* Support teammates through code reviews, coaching, pairing, and sharing knowledge across the Cross Platform competence area.
* Work directly with partners and stakeholders to clarify needs, shape solutions, and communicate progress clearly.



  





**Who you are** 




  





 We think you will thrive here if you enjoy variety, care about quality, and love the craft of mobile development, both in your own work and in helping others grow. You might recognise yourself if you:
 


* Have several years of professional mobile development experience across Android, iOS, and/or React Native.
* Feel confident building React Native features end-to-end and guiding others when needed.
* Work comfortably in TypeScript and enjoy exploring how the platforms behave under the hood.
* Can lead technical decisions, simplify complexity, and frame trade-offs clearly.
* Enjoy collaborating with designers, product leads, and partners, and you communicate with clarity.
* Like mentoring, coaching, or uplifting teammates, formally or informally.
* Feel comfortable taking ownership, shaping direction, and ensuring that what the team builds is both high-quality and long-lived.
* Care about shipping great products and making users’ everyday lives easier.



  





**About Framna** 




  





 Framna means ‘to bring forward’ in Old Norse. And that is exactly what we do. We partner with industry leaders (and those about to be) to create excellent digital products that define markets, reshape industries, and deliver meaningful impact.
 



  





 Born from the union of digital agencies Bontouch, Move, and Shape, Framna emerged from a strong, product-led culture. Today, over 600 of us collaborate across ten studios in Denmark, the Netherlands, Poland, Sweden, Switzerland, and the US.
 



  





 Every day, millions of users around the world rely on the products we help shape. From seamless payments to daily commutes, from better health management to smarter shopping. Our work consistently earns an average App Store rating of 4.5.
 



  





 Together with some of the world’s most ambitious brands, including Essity, SJ, Swish, and SEB, we craft products that lead markets and push boundaries. Because when products win, businesses win. We call it Win by product.
 



  





**What you get** 




  




* **The office is our default base of work.** 
 This is about building culture, optimizing for stronger collaboration, better products, greater value for our partners and challenging ourselves while having fun doing it. Our Stockholm office is right in the middle of the city - a super cozy space where there’s always something happening, whether it is a demo, a fika, or someone testing out a new idea. We mix that with the freedom to work from home when it makes sense, and hours that flex around real life.
* **A culture of curiosity.** 
 On Fridays we have weekly demos, Wednesdays mean lunch-and-learns, and sometimes we throw ourselves into conceptathons just to see what happens. We gather for company conferences just to share ideas, and we take time to learn something new when needed.
* **The freedom to follow your “what if.”** 
 We believe the best roles are shaped by the people in them. If you are curious about something, you will have the trust and space to chase it, and probably a few teammates who want to jump in with you.
* **Teammates who bring their whole selves.** 
 Designers who doodle during standups, engineers who can’t resist showing off a clever hack, product leads who keep the energy up when things get tricky. Around here, people genuinely like sharing what they know and celebrating when someone tries something new.
* **And of course, the benefits you’d expect.** 
 A generous wellness grant, top-up on your parental leave, occupational pension, and plenty more to make life outside of work easier.



  





**Our hiring process** 




  




1. First interview with our recruiter, Josephine
2. Case assignment
3. Technical interview with two developers
4. Final meeting with our Head of Cross Platform



  





**Please note:** 
 For this role, you need to be based in Sweden. Unfortunately, we are not able to offer relocation.

title: Housekeeping Operations Manager (m/w/d)
description:
**At Ruby, your personality really matters, your time really matters, and we strongly believe we groove way better** 
**together. At Ruby, we keep breaking new ground.**
 Hey Sunshine,
   

  

 You think travelling is more than just the next summer holiday, but the
 **feeling of being at home anywhere in the world** 
 ? That your workplace should be a place with
 **personality and soul** 
 , where new ideas come to life? Then you are the missing olive in our Martini, the missing melody in our music and the heartbeat of our
 **Ruby Frida.**
 Our Ruby Frida dances to the rhythm of Stockholm – a city that never stands still, reinventing itself while staying true to its roots. From ABBA’s timeless melodies to the bold grooves born at nearby Cheiron Studios, we’ve blended Sweden’s crisp modernism with playful retro touches and Stockholm’s swinging ’60s pop scene. It’s a place to unwind, tune into the local beat, and feel the city’s cultural pulse. With 187 rooms, Ruby Frida rises in Kungsholmen, just steps from Fridhemsplan station. From here, Stockholm’s Old Town, lively café culture, green parks and glittering waterways are all within easy reach.
   

  

 We are a fast-growing hospitality group with existing hotels and workspaces in some of
 **Europe's most exciting locations** 
 and many more projects under construction. We
 **break new ground** 
 with our
 **Lean Luxury philosophy** 
 , creating a contemporary and affordable form of luxury.
   

  

**Join us and make it your own story**
**Trust Us, You Won't Get Bored, As You**
* lead our housekeeping team, which includes both internal staff and external cleaning companies, with no distinction between them
* check all guest rooms and public areas daily for cleanliness and ensure compliance with Ruby’s housekeeping quality standards
* are responsible for orders, delivery bills and service checks, procurement of work and consumable materials, always keeping within the housekeeping budget
* maintain regular communication with our hotel maintenance team regarding upkeep and repair tasks
* collaborate closely with the Rooms Division office at our corporate headquarters in Munich
* take care of plants, floral arrangements, and seasonal decoration
* manage lost and found items and their return, because nothing slips through your fingers


**We've Been Waiting For You, Since You Have/are**
* at least 2 years of experience in a similar position, ideally in a lifestyle hotel, and know what it takes to work effectively with external companies
* a strong passion for cleanliness and order, with a keen eye for detail
* think and act in a cost- and eco-conscious way because it matters to you
* a strong communicator, know how to assert yourself, and stay flexible even in stressful situations
* presenting yourself confidently, bringing joy to the workplace, and humour is second nature to you
* enjoying working with international guests and know exactly how to respond smartly to their diverse needs
* speaking fluent Swedish and English


**What's in for you? That's how we groove:**
**Ruby, Ruby, Ruby**
* your style, your smile, your ideas – bring your personality to work. Maybe even with a new tattoo, piercing or hair colour on us?
* better together – at work, during team events or just because it’s Monday 😉


**'Cause I'm having a good time**
* sip, snack, repeat - with your Ruby F&B-Credit
* no more excuses – we support your sports program
* LEGEN...wait for it...DARY staff rates - for you and your travel buddy


**Money, Money, Money**
* no matter how you get to work – a mobility allowance comes on top
* take it to the next level – secure yourself some extra cash through talent scouting, positive reviews and an individual bonus agreement


**Ain't no mountain high enough**
* level up your game – trainings, coaching, and mentoring, you get the chance to grow, just like Ruby does
* innovation is part of our DNA – Lean Luxury, paperless, cashless, … you name it


**Where have you been so long?**
 Whether you’re a
 **social butterfly** 
 with a flair for cocktail-shaking, a creative soul with an eye for design, or a pro at planning and
 **behind-the-scenes magic** 
 - there’s a place for you at Ruby. We’re always looking for
 **friendly faces** 
 and
 **passionate team players** 
 .
   

  

 Not perfect CVs, but
 **great personalities** 
 , who’ll help us create hotels and workspaces with
 **character and soul** 
 . So, whatever makes you tick, join us and start your Ruby story.
   

  

**Diversity, Equity & Inclusion**
 We believe that...
   

  

* you can love whoever you want to
* you should decide for yourself whether and with which pronouns you would like to be addressed
* you can be proud of your heritage and culture
* you don't have to justify your religion or world view
* you are good, just as you are and make our team and Ruby's diversity unique


 We can't deal with: isms
   

  

 Racism, sexism, heterosexism, antisemitism, and such kind of isms are not tolerated here.
   

  

 If You Want To Know What To Expect, Listen To Andreea From Our Ruby Zoe In London. You Can Find Even More Ruby Stories Here
   

  

 www.ruby-hotels.com/stories
   

  

 Get to know our People & Culture Team
   

  

 Any questions about our pitch? Then contact us at jobs@ruby-hotels.com or +49 89 125 095 220.
   

  

 Your Ruby Recruitment Team

title: Cafévärd Matundret
location: Upplands Väsby och Sollentuna, Stockholm County, Sweden
description:
I Sollentuna församling finns Matundret som som startade som ett projekt. Matundret är till för att hjälpa människor utifrån både ett klimatsmart och ekonomiskt perspektiv. Volontärer hjälper till med att varje vecka hämta matsvinn från butiker i närområdet; grönsaker och andra matvaror som närmar sig bästa före-datum. Matvarorna blir sedan matkassar som behövande kan prenumerera på efter överenskommelse med diakon. Resterande mat förvandlas till läckra lunchrätter som serveras i vårt café, Fiket.
   

  

 Fiket är en trivsam mötesplats där vi möter varandra, både gäster och medarbetare, på ett respektfullt och omsorgsfullt sätt. Fiket bedrivs till stor del av volontärer, praktikanter och de som arbetstränar.
   

  

 Nu söker vi en cafévärd till Matundret. Har du erfarenhet från café/kök och ett hjärta för människor i förändring? Vill du arbeta i en meningsfull miljö där du får kombinera praktiskt arbete med stödjande och pedagogiskt ansvar och vara del av utvecklingen? Då kan du vara den vi söker.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
 Arbetet är både praktiskt och relationsbyggande och innebär oregelbundna tider, inklusive kvällar och helger. I arbetsuppgifterna ingår
   

  

* Att vara mottagare av och hantera matsvinn och att löpande ta till vara och planera mat och menyer utifrån matsvinnet
* Att ansvara för Fikets drift: planera, organisera och genomföra det dagliga arbetet
* Att handleda de olika medarbetarna med flera och visa dem in i verksamheten i café och kök – skapa en trygg och utvecklande arbetsmiljö
* Att säkerställa hygien enligt livsmedelslagstiftning


**Vi söker dig som:**
* Har god förmåga att möta människor i olika livssituationer med lyhördhet och respekt.
* Är trygg i mötet med personer i utsatta livssituationer. Ser människors potential och tror på förändring
* Har ett diakonalt förhållningssätt och kyrklig förankring
* Har erfarenhet av café- eller köksarbete
* Har relevant utbildning inom restaurang/livsmedelsprogrammet eller motsvarande utbildning med vana att bereda livsmedel och servera mat
* Trivs med att arbeta både praktiskt och pedagogiskt, självständigt och i team
* Har god kännedom om livsmedelshantering
* Har B-körkort
* Är strukturerad, ansvarstagande och serviceinriktad
* Är stresstålig, har lätt för relationsskapande och en god samarbetsförmåga.


 Vi värderar dina personliga egenskaper högt och förutsätter att du delar Svenska kyrkans värderingar. Du behöver ha B-körkort.
   

  

**Meriterande:**
* Har arbetat med handledning, arbetsträning eller annan pedagogisk verksamhet
* Erfarenhet av diakonalt eller socialt arbete
* Goda IT-kunskaper och kan hantera administrativa uppgifter
* Livsmedelshygien är också förekommande arbetsuppgift som är meriterande om du sedan tidigare har erfarenhet av.


**Övrigt om tjänsten**
 Tillträde enligt överenskommelse. Tjänsten är på 100%.
   

  

 Vi tillämpar provanställning. Utdrag ur belastningsregistret kommer att efterfrågas av den som erbjuds tjänsten.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder**
* En församling med framtidstro och vilja att utvecklas
* Ett stimulerande och omväxlande arbete
* Ett positivt arbetsklimat med god gemenskap i en verksamhet med höga värderingar kring gemenskap och inkludering


 Intervjuer kommer att ske under vecka 5 och i ett nästa steg sker arbetsprov där du är med och provjobbar för att få en bild av arbetet/uppdraget i dess sammanhang och miljö.
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan!**
**Sista ansökningsdag 2026-01-11**
 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Sollentuna | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/861 | Publicerat: 2025-12-08 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2026-01-11

title: Verksamhetskonsult - Financial Services
description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 Vill du vara med och forma framtidens betalningslösningar och skapa verkligt värde för Sveriges största banker? Nu söker vi en Verksamhetskonsult till vårt team inom Financial Services!
   

  

 Hos oss får du chansen att arbeta nära våra kunder i Stockholm och bidra till att utveckla processer, system och arbetssätt som gör skillnad. Du analyserar nuläget, identifierar förbättringsområden och föreslår lösningar – och du är med hela vägen från idé till genomförande.
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 Som verksamhetskonsult arbetar du med verksamhetsutveckling och kravledning i nära samarbete med våra kunder. Du tar fram processbeskrivningar, gör funktionsanalyser, modellerar i relevanta verktyg och säkerställer att lösningar följer gällande regelverk och standarder. Du ansvarar för insamling och dokumentation av krav, framtagning av kravspecifikationer samt beställningsunderlag till leverantörer och andra intressenter. Rollen innefattar även hantering av change requests och underhåll av dokumentation som stödjer projektets framdrift.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har djup kunskap om den svenska bankmarknaden och betalningsinfrastrukturen. Du förstår hur regelverk, system och aktörer samverkar för att skapa säkra och effektiva betalningar. Har du erfarenhet av transformationsprojekt inom banksektorn, exempelvis modernisering av betalningsflöden, är det ett stort plus.
   

  

 Du har även:
   

  

* 4–8 års erfarenhet av IT- och verksamhetsutveckling inom bank och finans.
* Kunskap om betalningsflöden och betalmarknadsinfrastruktur.
* Erfarenhet av SWIFT-flöden och ISO 20022.


 Verktyg du gärna behärskar:
   

  

* Jira / Azure DevOps / ServiceNow
* Confluence
* Microsoft Visio
* Power BI / Tableau / Qlik Sense
* Excel / Google Sheets


 Övriga krav:
   

  

* Svenskt medborgarskap (för säkerhetsklassning).
* Flytande svenska i tal och skrift.


 (Ansökningar som inte uppfyller dessa krav beaktas inte.)
