title: Data Scientist - QuantumBlack, AI by McKinsey
description:
**Who You'll Work With**
 Driving lasting impact and building long-term capabilities with our clients is not easy work. You are the kind of person who thrives in a high performance/high reward culture - doing hard things, picking yourself up when you stumble, and having the resilience to try another way forward.
   

  

 In return for your drive, determination, and curiosity, we'll provide the resources, mentorship, and opportunities you need to become a stronger leader faster than you ever thought possible. Your colleagues—at all levels—will invest deeply in your development, just as much as they invest in delivering exceptional results for clients. Every day, you'll receive apprenticeship, coaching, and exposure that will accelerate your growth in ways you won’t find anywhere else.
   

  

 When you join us, you will have:
   

  

* Continuous learning: Our learning and apprenticeship culture, backed by structured programs, is all about helping you grow while creating an environment where feedback is clear, actionable, and focused on your development. The real magic happens when you take the input from others to heart and embrace the fast-paced learning experience, owning your journey.
* A voice that matters: From day one, we value your ideas and contributions. You’ll make a tangible impact by offering innovative ideas and practical solutions, all while upholding our unwavering commitment to ethics and integrity. We not only encourage diverse perspectives, but they are critical in driving us toward the best possible outcomes.
* Global community: With colleagues across 65+ countries and over 100 different nationalities, our firm’s diversity fuels creativity and helps us come up with the best solutions for our clients. Plus, you’ll have the opportunity to learn from exceptional colleagues with diverse backgrounds and experiences.
* World-class benefits: On top of a competitive salary (based on your location, experience, and skills), we provide a comprehensive benefits package to enable holistic well-being for you and your family.


**Your Impact**
 As a Data Scientist, you will collaborate with clients and interdisciplinary teams to develop impactful analytics solutions, optimize code, and solve real-world business problems across diverse industries. You’ll grow as a technologist by contributing to cutting-edge projects, R&D, and global conferences while working alongside world-class talent in a dynamic, innovative environment.
   

  

 In this role, you will partner with clients to understand their needs and develop impactful analytics solutions. You will translate business problems into analytical challenges, build models to solve them, and ensure they are evaluated with relevant metrics. You’ll also contribute to internal tools, participate in R&D projects, and have opportunities to attend and present at conferences like NIPS and ICML.
   

  

 Your work will create real-world impact. By identifying patterns in data and delivering innovative solutions, you will help clients maintain their competitive advantage and transform their day-to-day operations. Your contributions will directly influence business outcomes and drive lasting improvements across industries.
   

  

 You will be in Stockholm, and collaborate closely with data scientists, data engineers, machine learning engineers, designers, and product managers around the world working on interdisciplinary projects that use math, statistics, and machine learning to derive insights from raw data. You will help global companies transform their businesses and enhance performance across industries such as healthcare, automotive, energy, and elite sports.
   

  

 At McKinsey, you’ll thrive in an unparalleled environment for growth. You’ll develop a sought-after perspective by connecting technology and business value, tackle real-life challenges across diverse industries, and collaborate with inspiring multidisciplinary teams, gaining a holistic understanding of AI and its potential to drive transformation.
   

  

**Our Tech Stack**
 While we advocate for using the right tech for the right task, we often leverage the following technologies: Python, PySpark, the PyData stack, SQL, Airflow, Databricks, our own open-source data pipelining framework called Kedro, Dask/RAPIDS, container technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes, cloud solutions such as AWS, GCP, and Azure, and more.
   

  

**Your Qualifications and Skills**
* Bachelors, Masters or PhD level in a discipline such as: computer science, machine learning, applied statistics, mathematics, engineering or artificial intelligence.
* 0-2+ years of professional experience in applying machine learning and data mining techniques to real problems with copious amounts of data
* Programming experience (focus on machine learning): R and/or Python (must), SPSS, SAS, Ruby, Hadoop (valued).
* Ability to prototype statistical analysis and modeling algorithms and apply these algorithms for data driven solutions to problems in new domains
* Ability to independently own and drive model development, balancing demands and deadlines.
* Demonstrated aptitude for analytics.
* While we advocate for using the right tech for the right task, we often leverage the following technologies: Python, PySpark, the PyData stack, SQL, Airflow, Databricks, our own open-source data pipelining framework called Kedro, Dask/RAPIDS, container technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes, cloud solutions such as AWS, GCP, and Azure, and more.
* Strong communication skills, both verbal and written, in English, with the ability to adjust your style to suit different perspectives and seniority levels.
* Exceptional time management to meet your responsibilities in a complex and largely autonomous work environment.
* Good presentation and communication skills, with the ability to explain complex analytical concepts to people from other fields.
* Willingness to travel.

title: Data Scientist
description:
We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Data Scientist to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data analysis, deep learning, and GenAI. This role involves extracting meaningful insights from complex datasets and translating them into actionable strategies that drive business growth. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and implement data-driven solutions to solve real-world problems.
 



**Job Experience Requirements:**




  





 Location: Solna, Sweden
 



  





 Hybrid
 







**Qualifications:**




 · Education: Master’s in data science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
 



 · Experience: 3+ years of experience in data science, analytics, or a related field.
 



 · Technical Skills:
 



 o Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R.
 



 o Good understanding of statistical principles for ML applications
 



 o Experience with data manipulation and analysis using libraries such as pandas, NumPy, and SciPy.
 



 o Exceptional knowledge of Deep Learning techniques, model architectures, and parameter fine-tuning
 



 o Very good knowledge of GenAI with good understanding of foundation models and transformer architecture
 



 o Familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Matplotlib, Seaborn).
 



 o Experience with SQL and relational databases.
 



 o Knowledge of big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) is a plus.
 



 · Soft Skills:
 



 Excellent problem-solving abilities, strong communication skills, and the ability to work effectively in a team environment.
 



**· Additional Skills (Preferred):**




 o Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Google Cloud, Azure).
 



 o Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git).
 



 o Experience in genomics
 



**Job Responsibilities:**








 · Data Analysis: Analyze large, complex datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights that inform business decisions.
 



 · Model Development: Develop, implement, and validate predictive models and machine learning algorithms to solve various business problems.
 



 · Data Cleaning: Preprocess and clean data to ensure its quality and integrity before analysis.
 



 · Visualization: Create data visualizations and dashboards to communicate findings to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.
 



 · Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including engineering, product management, and marketing, to understand their data needs and provide relevant insights.
 



 · Reporting: Generate comprehensive reports and presentations that summarize key findings and recommendations.

description:

 Det offentliga Sverige står inför ett flertal prövningar som skall kunna möta nya digitala krav, tackla demografiska utmaningar och nå mål och delmål inom Agenda 2030. Samtidigt blir enskilda medborgares förväntningar på tillgänglighet och omfång av samhällsservice allt större, vilket bidrar till behovet av individualiserade och ständigt tillgängliga samhällstjänster.
   

  

 Vi behöver bli fler som vi hjälpa offentliga Sverige i dessa omställningar.
   

  

**Vad vi gör**
 Centigos expertis sträcker sig över en mångfald av områden som är kritiska för att framgångsrikt driva förändring inom offentlig sektor. Idag har vi en mycket stark kompetens inom förändringsledning, projektledning med särskild fokus på digitalisering, strategiarbete och verksamhetsutveckling inom offentliga förvaltningar.
   

  

**Vi växer och söker fler kollegor som vill jobba** 
**med uppdrag inom offentlig sektor**
 Förmågan att kunna förändras och utvecklas utan att förlora momentum är i dag den viktigaste faktorn för en framgångsrik organisation. Förändringarna inom offentlig sektor drivs av medborgares förväntningar, politik och demografiska utmaningar (färre behöver göra mer för fler).
   

  

 Vi söker nu dig som vill vara med och göra skillnad i olika projekt och initiativ som Centigo driver inom offentlig sektor, som projekt- och eller förändringsledare i förändrings-, implementerings och digitaliseringsprojekt. Du har kunskap inom Microsoft plattformens olika delar (Azure, Powerplatform, Dynamics) samt övergripande förståelse av införande; support och förvaltning av projekt inom MS plattform.
   

  

**Framgångsrika konsulter på Centigo har oftast tre framträdande styrkor:**
**Entreprenörsanda** 
 – De motiveras av komplexa utmaningar och drivs av en stark vilja att lösa dem. Med ett högt engagemang och ansvarstagande, värdesätter de möjligheten att dra nytta av och bidra till det nätverk som Centigo erbjuder.
   

  

**Ambitionsdriven** 
 – De drivs av sina egna höga ambitioner och tar ansvar för sin affär såväl som sin professionella och personliga utveckling.
   

  

**Professionell** 
 – Att arbeta med en hög grad av professionalism är nyckeln till ett framgångsrikt konsultarbete. Våra konsulter är alltid måna om att leverera produkter av god kvalitet till våra kunder
   

  

**Din profil**
* Du har 3-7 års erfarenhet av att jobba som managementkonsult (gärna inom offentlig sektor med övergripande kännedom om och stort intresse för sektorn) eller har jobbat i en linjeroll med fokus på digitaliseringsprojekt, förändringsledning och affärsutveckling.
* Kunskap och kunna hantera att vara spindeln i nätet mellan kund och leverantör
* Vara tekniskt bevandrad och förstå komplexiteten med nomenklaturen inom Microsoft och översätta den till språket inom offentlig sektor i dialogen med leverantören.
* Du har arbetat i rollen som projektledare, affärsutvecklare, förändringsledare i implementations- och digitaliseringsprojekt.
* Du är driven och tar stort eget ansvar, både för din kund och din egen utveckling.
* Du har en universitetsexamen.
* Du behärskar både svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.
* Du hanterar obehindrat applikationerna inom Microsoft 365.

title: Cloud Consultant Azure
description:
**Gå** 
**med i vårt Cloud-team – Flera möjligheter tillgängliga!** 




  





 Är du passionerad kring molntransformation och redo att driva innovation för Orange Business kunder? Vi går nu in i en spännande tillväxtfas med stora ambitioner för vårt Public Cloud Delivery-team. Det här är din chans att bli en del av oss, bidra till att forma vår framtid och vara med på vår resa – vi söker talangfulla medarbetare på alla nivåer!
 



  





  





**Din roll kan innebära att du:** 




  





 ✅ Designar och implementerar skalbara molnlösningar på ledande plattformar
 



 ✅ Bidrar i molnmigrationsprojekt och transformationsinitiativ
 



 ✅ Bygger ramverk för governance och landningszoner
 



 ✅ Deltar i pre-sales och kundworkshops
 



 ✅ Översätter verksamhetskrav till tekniska lösningar
 



  





  





**Vi** 
**söker dig som har:** 




  




* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av arkitektur och implementation i Azure
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med moderna verktyg och ramverk för mjukvaruleverans (CI/CD, DevOps, GitOps, Git, agila metoder)
* Erfarenhet av Infrastructure as Code (Terraform, Bicep m.fl.)
* Kännedom om Cloud Adoption Framework (CAF) och Well architected framework (WAF)
* Erfarenhet av molnsäkerhet och nätverk
* Flytande kommunikationsförmåga på både svenska och engelska (tal och skrift)



  





**Meriterande** 
 :
 



  




* Kunskap inom Docker, Kubernetes (AKS)
* Erfarenhet av kostnadsoptimering
* Erfarenhet av Azure Integration Services & serverless-teknologier (Logic App, Function, App Services, Service Bus)



  





  





**Vår teamkultur** 




  





 Om du tycker om att arbeta med ny teknik och hålla din kunskap uppdaterad kommer du passa bra hos oss. Vi arbetar i agila team med en no-blame-kultur där vi uppmuntrar innovation och ger våra medarbetare autonomi att fatta beslut. För oss är det viktigt att ständigt förbättras, arbeta proaktivt och automatisera snarare än att repetera uppgifter.
 



  





 Är du nyfiken på att utvecklas? Vi ser till att våra team alltid ligger steget före genom att ge tid för certifieringar, delta i eller titta på webbinarier, labba självständigt eller helt enkelt diskutera idéer med kollegor.
 



  





  





**Varför ska du välja oss?** 




  




* Flexibelt arbetssätt – hybridlösning med modernt och samarbetsinriktat kontor i Stockholm
* Kontinuerliga lärandemöjligheter och certifieringar
* Vi är en människoorienterad organisation och stolta över vår Great Place to Work-certifiering
* En kultur utan skuldbeläggning – du får frihet att innovera
* Möjlighet att arbeta med den senaste molnteknologin
* Ett community av experter – som Digital Natives sätter vi innovation i centrum för vår kompetens
* Läs mer om våra förmåner
 
 här.



  





  





**Om Orange Business:** 




  





 Orange Business är ett ledande nätverks- och digitalintegratörsföretag med kontor i 65 länder världen över och en del av Orange-koncernen.
 



  





 Digital Services, en affärsenhet inom Orange Business, är en nybildad division inom Orange Business. I Europa består affärsområdet av cirka 1500 medarbetare fördelade över 10 länder. Vi är digitala natives med innovation i centrum för vår verksamhet, vilket gör oss till en pålitlig partner nära våra kunder. Vårt gemensamma uppdrag är att hjälpa dem att förnya, driva och leda sin digitala transformation och sina affärsstrategier inom viktiga digitala områden, inklusive Cloud, Customer Experience, Digital Workspace samt Data & AI. Som en agil och snabbfotad digital affärspartner erbjuder affärsenheten pålitliga end-to-end-lösningar och produkter som hjälper företag i en rad olika branscher, både inom privat och offentlig sektor, att transformera sin verksamhet, förbättra kundupplevelsen och driva tillväxt.
 



  





 Med vår digitala expertis är vi en strategisk partner till Orange Business mål att vara en ledande nätverks- och digitalintegratör, med vårt team som en viktig tillväxtmotor.
 



  





  





**Rekryteringsprocessen:** 




  





 Vi går igenom ansökningar löpande och strävar efter att hålla intervjuer och samtal allt eftersom vi får in dem.
 



  





 Är du intresserad men känner att du inte uppfyller alla kriterier till 100 %? Vi uppmuntrar dig att söka ändå! Vi tror på styrkan i mångsidiga kompetenser, perspektiv och individers unika kvaliteter. Vi vill att alla ska känna sig fria att vara sig själva – dina unika förmågor kan passa perfekt för vårt team! Din perfekta match kanske är nästa tjänst vi annonserar, så varför inte ligga steget före och söka redan nu?
 



  





 Är du intresserad av att läsa mer om Orange Business? Besök vår
 
 hemsida
 
 eller följ oss på
 
 LinkedIn.

title: Manager, Business Development
description:
Banyan Software provides the best permanent home for successful enterprise software companies, their employees, and customers. We are on a mission to acquire, build and grow great enterprise software businesses all over the world that have dominant positions in niche vertical markets. In recent years, Banyan was named the #1 fastest-growing private software company in the US on the Inc. 5000 and amongst the top 10 fastest-growing companies by the Deloitte Technology Fast 500. Founded in 2016 with a permanent capital base setup to preserve the legacy of founders, Banyan focuses on a buy and hold for life strategy for growing software companies that serve specialized vertical markets.
 



**Job Profile:** 




 This is an opportunity to be a key contributor in a rapidly growing global software consolidator. You will play a key role in the company’s sourcing efforts by identifying new qualified vertical market software companies, improving our coverage in our vertical markets, connecting with software owners who are considering the sale of their business, and driving engagement with those companies over time. Reporting to the VP, Corporate Development or their designate, you will leverage your existing prospecting and sales skills in a new and challenging environment. Your origination efforts will directly result in Banyan acquiring businesses each year. If you love the sales process, are genuinely curious about business and M&A, and enjoy learning about new industries, join us!
 



**Responsibilities:** 



* Identify, research, and evaluate attractive companies based on Banyan’s investment criteria.
* Outbound prospects and contact them through a mix of channels including email, phone, & conferences
* Establish relationships and trust with software business owners in your core verticals and drive daily engagement and nurturing programs.
* Proactively collaborate across the entire Banyan team to drive business outcomes and contribute innovative ideas that support our vision of creating a world class sourcing team.
* Use Banyan’s software tools and resources to continually increase your effectiveness and efficiency.
* Track activity and maintain clear records in Salesforce.com and Outreach and report regularly on KPIs.



**Qualifications for success:** 



* 3 to 5 years prior experience in software or related sales or Corporate Development
* Genuinely curious about SaaS software and business with lifelong learning in your DNA
* Thrives in a metrics-driven environment and leverages data to make informed decisions.
* Meets and drives to exceed agreed upon KPIs and other critical metrics.
* Exceptional writing skills and an ability to drive harmonious two-way conversations.
* Loves the sales process and improves upon Banyan’s existing data-driven approach.
* A growth-mindset matched with an entrepreneurial spirit and a drive to succeed.
* Strives to continually improve skills and is coachable and open to feedback.
* A degree in Finance and/or experience related to software sales and M&A are all assets.



 Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Equal Employment Opportunity at Banyan: Banyan affirms that inequality is detrimental to our Global Teams, associates, our Operating Companies, and the communities we serve. As a collective, our goal is to impact lasting change through our actions. Together, we unite for equality and equity. Banyan is committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of any protected characteristic, including race, color, genetic information, creed, national origin, religion, sex, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, lawful alien status, ancestry, age, marital status, or protected veteran status and will not discriminate against anyone on the basis of a disability. We support an inclusive workplace where associates excel based on personal merit, qualifications, experience, ability, and job performance.
 



  
 



***Beware of Recruitment Scams***




 We have been made aware of individuals fraudulently posing as members of our Talent Acquisition team and extending fake job offers. These scams may involve requests for personal information or payment for equipment. 
 



**Protect yourself by following these steps:** 



* Verify that all communications from our recruiting team come from an
 **@banyansoftware.com** 
 email address.
* Remember, employers will
 **never** 
 request payment or banking information during the hiring process.
* If you receive a suspicious message,
 **do not respond** 
 — instead, forward it to careers@banyansoftware.com and/or report it to the platform where you received it.



 Your safety and security are important to us. Thank you for staying vigilant.

title: Engineering Manager
description:
*We’re looking for passionate, empathetic leaders who have experience both in hands-on coding and in leading teams. If you want to bring out the best in people while driving technical excellence, you’ll thrive in this role. We believe that leadership is about empowering others to grow, collaborating with your team, and leading by example.*
*At Nordnet, we encourage simplicity, inclusivity, and a just-do-it attitude, where every voice is heard, and all team members are empowered to contribute. If you’re driven to make an impact, build strong, diverse teams, and lead with technical expertise, we want to hear from you.*
**As An Engineering Manager, You Will**
* Lead and build collaborative and empowered teams, drawing on your hands-on technical expertise.
* Foster a supportive environment for growth and development, enabling your engineers to excel in both technical skills and leadership.
* Champion Nordnet's tech strategy, contributing to technical decision-making and ensuring we maintain technical excellence in all aspects of our team.
* Lead by example with your coding expertise, guiding your team through technical challenges and hands-on problem-solving.
* Contribute to the evolution of the engineering organization, fostering innovation and continuous learning.
* Collaborate closely with other Engineering Managers to share knowledge, solve challenges, and learn from each other.


**You And Your Skills**
* You have hands-on experience in software development and a strong technical background. You are comfortable reading code and when needed diving into technical discussions.
* You have experience leading and developing product development teams, empowering your engineers to grow in their roles.
* You are curious, open-minded, and always eager to learn, seeing challenges as opportunities to grow and improve.
* You lead with empathy, transparency, and trust, creating an environment where your team feels supported and motivated.
* You are a change leader, brave in pushing through friction and driving technical innovation.
* You hold a degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related technical field.


**Culture At Nordnet Engineering**
* A just-do-it attitude, where everyone feels enabled and valued, regardless of their position or role.
* We live and breathe technology taking pride in our work.
* We take a scientific approach by experimenting and learning.
* We are curious and respectful, listen and ask questions with the intent to understand, while embracing different perspectives.
* We assume positive intent in others and foster a culture where speaking up and challenging ideas is welcomed.
* A commitment to work-life balance, ensuring flexibility and support for our employees’ well-being.


**This is us**
 At Nordnet, technology is at the core of everything we do, driving innovation and maintaining our competitive edge. As an Engineering Manager, you'll be at the forefront of leveraging cutting-edge technology like Google Cloud Platform, React/React Native, and Java to shape our web and mobile experiences. We’ve made over 30 000 production releases this year, releasing our web every other hour and our app every two days.
   

  

 We offer you the opportunity to work in a Nordic environment with a strong focus on delivery, product development and technology. Our ambitions are high and you will embark on a fast and challenging journey together with a skillful team of sharp and committed colleagues.
   

  

 Culture is built and cared for, each day by everyone. We’re proud of ours. Having a flat organization where anyone can talk to anyone creates a warm and friendly atmosphere worth protecting. We believe in a culture where every effort counts and where everyone is being recognized. A culture embracing our core values – passion, simplicity and transparency on all levels, no matter who you are or what you do.
   

  

 In 1996, Nordnet redefined the financial world as the first digital bank in Europe. Now we are about to do it again with the aim of creating the next generation of bank, in the cloud. We know that this requires great people, great teams, and great technology.
   

  

 Do you want to join us and build the new Nordnet?
   

  

**Application**
 Apply today! – Please note that we only accept applications through our recruitment system. We do not consider email applications.
   

  

 If you have any questions, feel free to reach out to our Talent Acquisition Partner, Lovisa Malmberg, lovisa.malmberg@nordnet.se.
   

  

 At Nordnet, we value diversity and inclusion, and we are committed to creating an environment where everyone can succeed.
   

  

 As part of our recruitment process, we conduct mandatory credit and background checks, as well as drug testing.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application!

title: End User Computing Engineer
description:
**Craft:**
**Job Description:**
**End User Computing Engineer**
**Job Purpose**
 The End User Computing Engineer will provide operational support for our Mac and Windows endpoint management environment, policies, and applications across various business units. Their primary responsibility is to ensure that our endpoints are up-to-date, functioning optimally, and compliant with security standards. Additionally, the engineer will collaborate closely with support specialists to offer technical guidance and training.
   

  

 We seek a candidate who designs and implements an epic end-user experience through our services. Success in this role requires a high level of motivation to acquire new technical skills, a commitment to quality, and effective collaboration with team members and customers. Strong knowledge of Windows and macOS endpoint management best practices, including zero-touch provisioning, cloud identity management, process automation, and conditional access methods, is essential. Ideal candidates should also be proficient in managing Android and iOS/iPadOS devices.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Centralize the management of thousands of corporate endpoints, including PCs, Macs, iPhones, iPads, and Apple TVs.
* Implement, operate, and maintain software and configuration deployments.
* Lead projects to implement or enhance client endpoints and related systems.
* Identify patterns and areas for improvement in assigned areas by applying scripting, automation, or application packaging and deployment methodologies.
* Provide training on client endpoint solutions to teammates and other engineering and support teams.
* Continuously create, review, and manage internal documentation to ensure accuracy for support teams and product handoffs.
* Provide insightful projections and recommendations for client performance, security, and stability.
* Manage Windows endpoints using modern management tools such as Entra ID, Microsoft Configuration Manager (MCM, MEM, MEMCM, SCCM), Intune, Miradore, and/or BigFix.
* Manage Apple endpoints using modern management tools such as Jamf Pro, Apple Business Manager, and Intune.
* Monitor our on-prem infrastructure and SaaS health to prevent risks to our services.
* Develop effective documentation, tooling, and alerts to identify and address reliability risks.
* Support our endpoint management infrastructure during business hours and in an on-call rotation.


**Requirements:**
* Prior experience with Windows and macOS desktop operating systems and related software.
* Prior experience in centrally managing a Mac and PC enterprise environment.
* Prior experience with Windows and macOS imaging/provisioning, patching, and deployment.
* Prior experience with Windows and macOS application packaging and deployment.
* Prior experience with Active Directory and GPO administration.
* A solid understanding of computer security systems, applications, procedures, and techniques.
* Understanding of Mobile Device Management/Unified Endpoint Management & Declarative Device Management frameworks.
* Ability to work well in a fast-paced, collaborative team environment.


**Pluses**
* Working knowledge of Entra ID
* Prior experience with Intune
* Prior experience with Jamf Pro
* Prior experience with scripting for Windows (PowerShell, VB, etc.)
* Prior experience with scripting for macOS (Bash, Zsh, etc.)
* Working experience with fulfillment and change management workflows
* Experience with enterprise SSO (Okta and/or Entra ID Auth)
* Experience with Apple Business/School Manager workflows (SSO-federated Managed Apple Accounts, Automated Device Enrollment, Managed App Distribution, etc.)
* Apple Certified Support Professional (ACSP)
* Jamf 300 certification or above (formerly known as CCA)
* MD-102: Endpoint Administrator certification
* Bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science or a related field, or equivalent experience
* Experience with VDI technologies
* Experience with PowerBI
* Basic knowledge of database languages (MSSQL and MySQL)
* Experience with 802.1x-based network authentication
* Experience with managing a global print solution
* Understanding of the ITIL framework
* Passion for video games


 We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply.
   

  

**Our World**
 Activision Blizzard, Inc., is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush™ and Bubble Witch™. Our combined entertainment network delights hundreds of millions of monthly active users in 196 countries, making us the largest gaming network on the planet!
   

  

 Our ability to build immersive and innovative worlds is only enhanced by diverse teams working in an inclusive environment. We aspire to have a culture where everyone can thrive in order to connect and engage the world through epic entertainment. We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for ‘Every World’ - we’ve got our employees covered!
   

  

*The videogame industry and therefore our business is fast-paced and will continue to evolve. As such, the duties and responsibilities of this role may be changed as directed by the Company at any time to promote and support our business and relationships with industry partners.*
 We are committed to working with and providing reasonable assistance to individuals with physical and mental disabilities. If you are a disabled individual requiring an accommodation to apply for an open position, please email your request to accommodationrequests@activisionblizzard.com. General employment questions cannot be accepted or processed here. Thank you for your interest.
   

  

 We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status, among other characteristics.
   

  

**About King**
 With a mission of
 *Making the World Playful* 
 , King is a leading interactive entertainment company with more than 20 years of history of delivering some of the world’s most iconic games in the mobile gaming industry, including the world-famous Candy Crush franchise, as well as other mobile game hits such as
 *Farm Heroes Sag* 
 a. King games are played by more than 200 million monthly active users. King, part of Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT), has Kingsters in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona, Berlin, Dublin, San Francisco, New York, Los Angeles and Malta. More information can be found at King.com or by following us on LinkedIn, @lifeatking on Instagram, or @king\_games on X.

title: Internship Machine Learning / Computer Vision
description:
Preventai is a fast-growing Swedish AI company transforming how surveillance infrastructure is used in retail. Our platform connects to existing camera systems and applies advanced Video Language Models (VLMs) to detect incidents and generate real-time alerts. We work with some of Sweden’s largest grocery chains and are expanding our team to support increasingly complex networked environments.
 



  





**About the Role** 




 As an intern on Preventai’s Machine Learning & Computer Vision team, you will support the development of real-time video analytics systems used in retail environments across Sweden. The role is designed to give you practical experience with modern AI pipelines—from model development to deployment—while working on production-grade systems.
 



  





 You will assist in building and optimizing computer vision models, improving video streaming pipelines, and helping deploy AI services across cloud and on-prem environments. The work is hands-on and technical, and you will be exposed to the same tools and workflows used by our core engineering team.
 



  





**During the internship, you will gain experience in:** 




  





**Computer Vision & AI Models** 



* Understanding tracking, action recognition, and VLM-based systems.
* Training, testing, and evaluating models on real video data.
* Applying model optimization techniques for low-latency inference.



  





**Video Pipeline Engineering** 



* Working with RTSP streams, multi-camera input, and FFmpeg.
* Understanding how real-time video decoding and buffering works.



  





**Infrastructure & Deployment** 



* Deploying inference services using Docker, FastAPI/Flask, and REST APIs.
* Working with GPU-accelerated environments, CUDA basics, and ONNX/TensorRT workflows.
* Supporting deployments on Google Cloud (Cloud Run, GPU instances, Firestore, Storage).



  





**Systems-Level Problem Solving** 



* Debugging performance bottlenecks across models, networking, and system layers.
* Working with multi-threaded and multi-process architectures for high-throughput streaming.



  





**This role is suited for interns who:** 



* Are comfortable with Python.
* Have some coursework or interest in ML, computer vision, or systems engineering.
* Enjoy practical problem-solving and working with real data.
* Want hands-on exposure to production AI systems rather than theoretical projects.



  





**Nice to Have** 
 (Not required, but beneficial to learn or explore during the internship)
 


* Basic experience with ONNX Runtime, TensorRT, or Triton Inference Server.
* Familiarity with real-time video protocols (RTSP, HLS, WebRTC).
* Exposure to CI/CD workflows or DevOps tools.



  





**What You Get** 



* Direct mentorship from experienced ML and CV engineers.
* Real responsibility on a platform actively used by major retailers.
* Insight into how AI systems are deployed and scaled in practice.
* A remote-first setup with potential fieldwork at customer locations.
* Paid internship.



  





**How to Apply** 




 Please apply through LinkedIn, and please contact us at Preventai on LinkedIn in case you have any questions.

title: ML Engineer
description:
🚀 Are you our new
 **ML Engineer** 
 ?
   

  

 Subscription Data Enablement is a team in Schibsted Media, part of the Subscription - Growth business unit. We’re on a mission to build modern, reliable and scalable data and AI capabilities that enable commercial growth through personalization, automation, and insight.
   

  

 Our team consists of Analysts, Data Scientists, and Engineers who work across brands to develop AI/ML-powered solutions and data products that drive subscriber engagement and retention. As an ML Engineer, you’ll play a key role in bringing our AI models into production, bridging the gap between data science and engineering, and contributing to our growing ML infrastructure.
   

  

 👩‍💻 Your responsibilities:
   

  

* Design, develop, and maintain scalable ML systems and infrastructure — from model training and deployment to monitoring and automation.
* Collaborate with data scientists and engineers to productionize models and integrate them into digital products and commercial workflows.
* Build and evolve robust data pipelines, APIs, and containerized environments that support reliable model serving.
* Support and improve our MLOps stack for testing, monitoring, reproducibility, and version control.
* Contribute to shared engineering tasks, tooling, and platform development when priorities align.
* Stay updated on ML engineering trends and help bring new practices and technologies into our stack.


 🤝 Who are we looking for?
   

  

 You enjoy building elegant, scalable systems and solving complex technical challenges with real business impact. You’re a hands-on engineer with a passion for operationalizing AI and supporting the teams who build models. You care about data quality, system performance, and getting things into production — and keeping them there.
   

  

**The role is a great fit if you:**
* Are fluent in Python, and experienced with ML/AI libraries like Scikit-learn, XGBoost, TensorFlow, or PyTorch.
* Know your way around SQL and data warehouses (e.g. Snowflake).
* Have experience with cloud platforms (e.g. AWS), Docker, and preferably orchestration tools like Airflow or Dagster.
* Understand MLOps principles and have worked with tools for model versioning, monitoring, and deployment.
* Are comfortable designing and implementing end-to-end ML pipelines — from data ingestion and feature engineering to deployment and monitoring.
* Have strong collaboration skills and enjoy working closely with data scientists, engineers, and product stakeholders.
* Bonus: Have 2+ years of experience in ML engineering, MLOps, or related data/AI engineering roles.
* Bonus: Experience with real-time model inference, streaming data pipelines, or personalisation use cases.


 🌱 What’s in it for you?
   

  

* A hybrid, informal, and collaborative work environment across Norway and Sweden.
* The chance to work on impactful ML solutions used by millions of users across leading Nordic media brands.
* A place in one of the largest data communities in the Nordics, with great opportunities for personal and professional development.
* Strong cross-functional collaboration with commercial, product, and editorial teams.
* Competitive salary and benefits, and exciting career opportunities within Schibsted Group.


 🏢 Work location:
   

  

 Oslo or Stockholm (Hybrid)
   

  

 📰 About Schibsted Media & Subscription
   

  

 Schibsted Media is home to some of the Nordics’ strongest news brands – including
 **VG, Aftonbladet, Aftenposten, E24, Svenska Dagbladet** 
 , and
 **Omni** 
 – with over
 **700 million monthly visits** 
 . The newly established
 **Subscription** 
 business unit owns the subscription experience end-to-end — from product and growth to personalization, data, and infrastructure.
   

  

 We operate across
 **Norway, Sweden, and Finland** 
 , working closely with Product, Tech, and Editorial teams to build the future of digital subscriptions and independent journalism.

title: Senior Data Engineer - Assortment Analytics
description:
**Job Description**

 As a Senior Data Engineer, you will lead complex data projects, oversee the design and roadmapping of data infrastructure within product teams, and mentor junior engineers. Leveraging your deep technical expertise and proven experience in designing and implementing robust data solutions, you will contribute to the enhancement of processes and best practices both within the team and across the organization. This role sits within the Assortment Analytics team, where you will help guide the product team in creating stable, scalable, and efficient data systems that effectively meet business needs.
   

  





**WHAT YOU’LL DO**



* Develop and optimize complex data pipelines, ensuring smooth data flow across multiple domains
* Utilize complex SQL querying techniques to extract, manipulate, and analyze data for various business needs
* Confidently use programming languages such as Java or Python to write classes, functions, and apply object-oriented programming principles, along with basic unit testing.
* Guide junior Data Engineers on tasks and best practices, effectively delegating to promote team growth.
* Understand business issues, create data-driven solutions, and present them to stakeholders, ensuring alignment with goals.
* Identify optimization opportunities in data systems, plan implementations, and develop risk-mitigation strategies.
* Work with stakeholders and teams to drive data initiatives, providing leadership and contributing to the organization’s data strategy.



**WHO YOU ARE**




 We are looking for people with:
   

  




* Applicable working experience or a degree in any technical field such as BSc, BE, or a related field.
* Minimum 5 years of experience in data engineering, with strong experience in SQL, Python, or similar languages.
* Proficiency in data modelling, warehousing, pipeline development, and documentation.
* Experience with production methodologies, software development principles, and Agile practices.
* Understanding of business needs related to the product scope.
* Strong teamwork, communication skills, and stakeholder management.
* Deep understanding of cloud technologies and cloud development, as well as the ability to select appropriate, cost-effective tools for different tasks.


**Additional Information**

 This is a full-time position based in Stockholm. At H&M, we offer endless opportunities to grow - whether you're deepening your technical expertise or expanding your business acumen. We believe in people, teamwork, and entrepreneurial spirit. Here, you can be yourself and make a real impact. We welcome your application regardless of gender, age, gender expression, sexual orientation, disabilities, religious beliefs, origin, or background. Apply now with your CV - we look forward to hearing from you!
   

  





**WHO WE ARE**
  

 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

  

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future. Read more about us here
   

  





**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
  

 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

  

  

 All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  





**JOIN US**
  

 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  





**Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.**

title: Konsult inom Informations-/datadriven vård
description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 Vi söker konsulter med specialisering inom informations-/datadrivet beslutsfattande till vårt snabbt växande e-Hälsoteam. Du månar om vården och ser möjligheterna med digitalisering och särskilt informations-/ datadrivet beslutsfattande. Du kommer att arbeta inom någon eller flera aspekter som: ledning och styrning, verksamhetsutveckling, lösningsdesign och integration, datagovernance och juridik. Dina erfarenheter och drivkrafter: Du har tidigare arbetat med business intelligence och datadriven utveckling inom region och/eller kommun.
   

  

 Erfarenhet av AI-lösningar är meriterande.
   

  

 Du uppskattar att lära nytt, lösa problem och att dela dig med dig av den kunskap du har. Du är flexibel och ansvarstagande. Med flera års erfarenhet inom business intelligence och informationsdrivna arbetssätt inom region och kommun så har du den grund som behövs för att ta dig an arbetet i de uppdrag vi utför.
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 Du kommer vara en del av ett multidisciplinärt specialistteam inom hälsa, vård och omsorg på ca. 40 medarbetare. Den övergripande uppgiften är att säkerställa att våra kunder kan realisera förväntade nyttor via strategi-, design- och förändringsarbete. Vi arbetar såväl enskilt som tillsammans med kollegor i våra projekt. Våra uppdrag genomförs med stöd av etablerade metoder och modeller som baseras på branschstandarder. Som konsult inom det nationella e-hälsoteamet, kommer du att ansvara för att CGIs leverans skapar mervärde för kunden, bibehålla goda kundrelationer samt bidra till ett gott samarbetsklimat internt och till vår gemensamma framgång. I den här rollen kommer du specifikt att bidra med förutsättningar för att informationsdrivet arbetssätt genomsyrar kundorganisationerna, och möjliggöra AI-tillämpningar.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

 Grundkrav Vi accepterar bara ansökningar på svenska. We only accept applications in Swedish. Erfarenhet av svensk sjukvård är ett absolut krav. A mandatory requirement is work experience from the Swedish healthcare system. God förståelse av nationell/regional vårdstruktur och etablerade standarder som HL7 och FHIR. Förstålse och intresse för att utveckla vården mha AI. Resor ingår i tjänsten / Travel is part of the job. Vi söker personer som kan axla följande uppgifter/områden
   

  

* Implementera informations-/datadrivet arbetssätt
* Leda utveckling
* Agera Kravställare
* Implementera och integrera BI-system
* Leda och utföra test och validering
* Data governance, exempelvis datakvalitet, masterdata
* Arbete som arkitekt inom integration och lösning


 Placeringsort:
   

  

 Göteborg, Stockholm eller Malmö
   

  

 Arbetsmiljö och sammanhang:
   

  

 Vi på CGI tror att vi når längre om vi trivs ihop och jobbar tillsammans. Varje dag stöttar vi varandra, våra kunder och bygger framtiden tillsammans. I det nationella e-hälsoteamet drivs vi av visionen att hjälpa offentlig och privat hälsa, vård och omsorg för att skapa bättre utfall för både individen och organisationen. Därutöver vill vi bidra till en positiv samhällsutveckling genom att vara en komplett partner så att Sverige på bästa sätt tillvaratar digitaliseringens möjligheter.
   

  

 Digitaliseringen inom vård, hälsa och omsorg ger enorma möjligheter men tekniken måste anpassas till de sammanhang där den ska göra nytta. Tillsammans med våra partners stöttar vi våra kunder med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och tjänster inom bland annat avancerad medicinsk bilddiagnostik, smarta sjukhus, datadriven sjukvård och AI.
   

  

 Övrigt om rollen
   

  

 Resor ingår i rollen, även om väldigt stor del av verksamheten numera sker digitalt. Bakgrundskontroller och registerkontroll kan komma att genomföras om uppdraget kräver det.
   

  

 Vad kan vi på CGI erbjuda dig?
   

  

 CGIs kombination av global och lokal närvaro, med kontor på 30 orter i Sverige, ger nöjda kunder men innebär även att du som anställd alltid har ett kontor nära dig. Detta i kombination med flexibla arbetstider ger dig möjlighet till balans mellan privatliv och arbete, oavsett var i livet just du befinner dig.
   

  

 På CGI finns även stora möjligheter till interna karriärvägar där du kan välja att bli specialist inom ditt område, bredda dig inom nya områden eller ta en ledande befattning. Via våra interna nätverk, projekt och åtaganden i globala och nationella industrier, erbjuder vi dig kompetensutveckling och engagerade ledare som stöttar just dig i din utveckling.
   

  

 Mer information om några av våra förmåner:
   

  

* Föräldralön: Vi betalar upp till cirka 90% av din lön under den första tiden hemma.
* Aktieprogram och delägarskap: Som delägare har du möjlighet att påverka och i vårt aktieprogram matchar CGI ditt bidrag, krona för krona upp till 3% av din månadslön.
* Friskvårdsbidrag: Vi erbjuder ett årligt friskvårdsbidrag på 4 000 kr.
* Trygg anställning: Våra medlemmar anställs med kollektivavtal och försäkringar.
* Pensionslösningar: Vi erbjuder attraktiva och förmånliga pensionslösningar.
* Personalbil: Personalbilen används som en privatbil men leasas av CGI.


 Vill du veta mer?
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig! Om du undrar över något, skicka gärna dina funderingar till Fredrik Augustsson. Fredrik.Augustsson@cgi.com
   

  

 Läs mer om CGI på vår hemsida: www.cgi.se
   

  

**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.**
 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
   

  

 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
   

  

 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
   

  

 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.

title: Senior/Lead Data Engineer (Swedish speaking)
description:
**Om rollen** 




  





 Vi söker nu en Senior/Lead Data Engineer för att stärka vårt team, som är intresserad av att arbeta med toppmoderna datateknologier och ramverk, möjliggöra välgrundade beslut och ha stor påverkan på ditt dagliga arbete. Eftersom våra kunder växer internationellt kommer även mängden data att öka ytterligare, och du kommer att vara en integrerad del av ett företag som strävar efter att göra våra kunder mer datadrivna.
 



  
 



  
 



**Vad du kommer att göra** 




  




* Utveckla och optimera datakanaler, datainsamling, ETL-processer och datalager.
* Arbeta nära produktägare, analytiker, dataspecialister och intressenter i hela verksamheten för att bygga lösningar och datamängder som möjliggör nya insikter och hjälper dem att upptäcka nya möjligheter.
* Skalera nya system och plattformar när vi växer för att möjliggöra data som en produkt.
* Ta ägandeskap och ansvar för dina dagliga leveranser.
* Vara en integrerad del av att möjliggöra insikter för våra kunder och användare.
* Använda toppmoderna ramverk, teknologier och plattformar för databehandling för att hjälpa teamet att nå framgång.
* Experimentera med dataservicelösningar via stora molnleverantörer.
* Arbeta med olika marknadsledande kunder.



  
 



  
 



**Du bör ha** 




  




* Flytande i svenska som en modersmålstalare
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av datatekniktjänster, datahantering, programmering och avancerade analysmiljöer, inklusive byggande av dataplattformar både på lokala system och i molnet.
* God erfarenhet av ETL-verktyg som DBT och Abinitio
* God kunskap och erfarenhet av Databricks och Lakehouse
* God kunskap i Python, bash och SQL, samt erfarenhet av olika datahanteringsteknologier, såsom No-SQL och distribuerade system. Kunskap i Python är ett plus.
* Erfarenhet av att designa och arkitektera molnbaserade datalösningar (Azure, AWS eller GCP)
* Starka färdigheter i mjukvaruarkitektur, med intresse av att använda mönster för att skriva kod som är robust, skalbar och underhållbar.
* Svensk infödd som är medborgare i Sverige



  
 



**Bra att ha Microsoft-specifika molntjänster** 




  




* Designa och utveckla datapipelines inom Azure Data Factory
* Koda avancerade databehandlingslösningar inom Azure Databricks
* Konceptualisera och implementera lösningar inom Azure Synapse, Azure SQL och Azure Data Lake
* Utveckling/kodhantering med Azure DevOps
* Arbeta nära affärsanalytiker och dataanalytiker för att förstå krav på slutprodukten och föreslå optimala datamodeller för back-end/front-end för bästa prestanda
* Samarbeta med plattforms-team, dataingenjörer i kärnsystem samt dataforskare för avancerade analysfall.



  





**Plats** 




  





 Kandidaten förväntas vara bosatt i Sverige.
 



  





  





**Rolltyp:** 




  





 Rollen kan vara permanent eller på kontrakt.
 



  





 Vi erbjuder dig en bra möjlighet för din professionella utveckling i en utmanande roll. Hos oss får du en god chans att direkt påverka din karriärutveckling. Vi tror att tillit främjar frihet och kreativitet. Vår kultur är byggd på transparens och aktivt delande. Vi ger dig möjlighet att arbeta med olika projekt och teknologier för att utveckla din karriär.
 



  





 Vi erbjuder utrymme och resurser för att lära dig och bli certifierad inom önskade teknologier som ger värde till din roll. Du kommer få en bra lön, pension, försäkringsplaner, gymmedlemskap och möjlighet att investera din del av pensionen i fonder med hjälp av vårt partnerföretag.
 



  





**Hur man ansöker** 




  






 Ansök här på LinkedIn eller dela gärna dina uppgifter tillsammans med ditt uppdaterade CV till info@databees.ai
 




 Vi ser fram emot att prata med dig om du är intresserad av denna position!

title: Field Sales
description:
**Job Description**
**Reshape How We Win in the Independent Software Vendors (ISV) Ecosystem**
 At Nexi, we're revolutionizing how payment solutions integrate into the software that powers businesses across Europe. As part of our
 **ISV Field Sales** 
 team, you'll spearhead our next phase of growth in the Integrated Software Vendor space, bringing our innovative solutions to directly to merchants.
   

  

 This is about getting close to small businesses, helping them understand how our innovative partnerships can accelerate their growth and supporting them through the full sales cycle. It’s the perfect role for a high energy, success-driven software salesperson who thrives on face-to-face contact.
   

  

**The Challenge**
 The ISV landscape is evolving rapidly. We have partnerships across Europe with innovative providers, integrating payments into their market-leading commercial products. Now we need to take those product solutions to small and medium sized businesses across Europe, build compelling business cases to solve their problems, and supporting them through the whole sales and onboarding cycle.
   

  

 You'll be identifying and acquiring new customers while working in a busy, international environment with plenty of room for growth
   

  

**Your Mission**
**Hunt and Win ISV customers**
* Identify and engage high-potential customers in the target sectors
* Build compelling sales cases that demonstrate the value of our solutions
* Manage sales process from initial contact through successful onboarding and go live


**Drive Commercial & Technical Partnership Success**
* Develop deep understanding of ISV business models, technical requirements, and integration capabilities
* Collaborate with technical and onboarding teams to ensure seamless onboarding experiences


**Support Partnership Approach**
* Provide market intelligence that shapes our ISV strategy and product development


**Own Revenue Growth**
* Own your revenue targets and growth objectives


**What We're Looking For**
**Partnership Hunter Mindset**
* Revenue Driver: You're motivated by targets and understand how partnerships translate to business growth
* Relationship Builder: You earn trust quickly and maintain mutually beneficial relationships with a real focus on customer success
* Market Challenger: You're comfortable competing and winning in a complex technical market


**Technical & Commercial Expertise**
* Software Sales Experience: Proven track record in B2B software or SaaS sales
* Technical Fluency: Comfortable discussing technical integration requirements with customers, in clear and compelling terms, and collaborating with stakeholders across internal technical functions


**Sales Excellence**
* Track record of achieving revenue targets


**Life at Nexi**
 Discover more about us and what it's like to be part of Nexi by visiting this page: https://www.nexigroup.com/en/people/life-at-nexi/overview/?utm\_source=career-platform&utm\_medium=job-openings&utm\_content=standard .
   

  

 Learn about our values, meet our communities, and see how we are shaping the future of digital payments together.
   

  

**Apply now!**
 If this opportunity resonates with you, we'd love to hear from you!
   

  

 Please apply at your earliest convenience. We'll be reviewing applications continuously and closing the position once we've found the right fit. We are committed to creating a diverse culture where talents from all walks of life can feel like they truly belong.
   

  

 By exploring this job opening, you're one step closer to joining us. We're excited to learn more about you!
   

  

**About The Team**
 We are the result of merging Nexi, Nets, and Sia, with a presence in over 25 countries. With over 80 years of experience, we offer plenty of opportunities for personal and professional growth
   

  

 At Nexi, we learn, adapt, and think like entrepreneurs. Discover more about our culture by visiting this page: https://www.nexigroup.com/en/people/life-at-nexi/overview/?utm\_source=career-platform&utm\_medium=job-openings&utm\_content=about-the-team

title: Customer Success Manager
description:
At Stratsys, we offer a SaaS platform that streamlines compliance in business-critical areas such as Sustainability, GRC, and Quality work. Unlike other compliance tools, we go a step further by moving organizations from reporting to action and effectively distributing responsibility internally.
   

  

 We’re looking for a Customer Success Manager to join our team in either Gothenburg or Stockholm. In this role, you’ll work with private-sector clients, focusing on those with products in GRC and ESG. You’ll manage a wide range of customer relationships and help clients navigate regulatory frameworks while driving value through our platform.
   

  

 As a Customer Success Manager, you’ll focus on both our customers and our platform. You’ll be the main contact for both small and large clients and take overall responsibility for their success. This role is all about combining platform knowledge with relationship building, so we’re looking for someone who enjoys working directly with our platform, staying close to customers, and driving growth. A data-driven approach will help you find ways to improve and create strategic solutions that bring real value to our clients.
   

  

 WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU? 💡
   

  

* An engaging work environment with people with a shared mindset to deliver a world-class product in important and impactful areas.
* Opportunities to learn about GRC, ESG, and the financial sector, even if you don’t have prior experience.
* Challenging, varied, and engaging work tasks with room and encouragement to be independent and innovative.
* Join a high-energy, close-knit team where every success is celebrated together. Please look at our Instagram to get an insight into our culture.
* Work from a fantastic and central office in A House the Ark in Stockholm or at Kungsportplatsen in Gothenburg.
* Join a company with great benefits – read more about our benefits here!


**About The Role 📌**
 As a Customer Success Manager at Stratsys, you will play a key role in our growth journey. You will guide customers from adoption to expansion, ensuring their success while driving new business opportunities. Working closely with Project Managers and Sales Specialists, you’ll ensure clients fully utilize the platform, strengthening loyalty and opening doors for further sales.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities:
   

  

* Build long-term customer relationships based on trust and engagement, working with both senior decision-makers and operational teams.
* Ensure that customers achieve their goals and get full value from our platform by identifying needs and turning them into business opportunities.
* Be a trusted advisor who develops product knowledge, advises customers, and increases awareness and interest in our products.
* Sales responsibility: Collaborate with Sales Specialists to proactively manage sales activities, meet revenue targets, and identify new opportunities within existing accounts.
* Manage your own budget with clear sales and growth targets, including negotiations, renewals and agreements to secure long-term partnerships.
* Work with Sales Specialists to analyze product usage, identify growth opportunities, and optimize product utilization.
* Drive customer dialogues such as check-ins, strategy meetings and product demos, as well as support with platform adjustments and improvements.


 YOUR BACKGROUND ✔️
   

  

* Bachelor’s or master’s degree in a relevant field, such as business administration or systems science.
* 1-3 years of relevant work experience, preferably as a Customer Success Manager or similar role.
* Strong interest in systems and digitization with experience in handling and learning new systems.
* Fluent in Swedish with excellent English skills.


 Bonus Qualifications:
   

  

* Understanding of regulatory requirements for industries like banking and finance.
* Experience working with negotiations and customer agreements.
* Experience with GRC or ESG related processes.
* Tech-savvy and eager to learn more about technical solutions.


**About You 👀**
 To thrive in the role, we see that you are a relationship-builder with a genuine interest in customer-oriented work and smart digital solutions. You are self-motivated, proactive, and have a positive attitude. You are curious and eager to learn, embracing new developments in the ever-evolving tech landscape. You value a positive team environment and the opportunity to be part of a growth journey. You are simply ready for your next adventure with Stratsys!
   

  

**About Us 🚀**
 Does this look like a role for you? Do not hesitate—show your interest today since we are working ongoing with the selection of candidates.
   

  

 Is this particular role not quite right for you? Show your interest for future openings by connecting with us. We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

 Want to read more about us and your future colleagues or take part in our everyday life? Visit jobs.stratsys.com or follow us on LinkedIn or Instagram.

title: Data Analytics Engineer
description:
Are you ready to be a key contributor within the Data & Analytics Engineering department at NOBA Bank Group? Your focus will be on advancing analytics capabilities, optimizing data workflows, driving innovation in the cloud, and unlocking the full potential of the organization’s most valuable asset – data.
   

  

**About The Role**
 The Data & Analytics Engineering department comprises specialized teams focused on Data Infrastructure Engineering, Analytics Engineering, and Data Management.
   

  

 As a Data Analytics Engineer, you'll play a central role in building and optimizing the organization's supporting analytics layer, collaborating across the bank. This role offers broad opportunities to grow and make a tangible impact!
   

  

 We offer a hybrid working model with two common in-office days. While we value flexibility, we also prioritize collaboration, team-building, and enjoying fikas and after-work gatherings together!
   

  

**Main Tasks**
* Design and implement efficient data models, focusing on analytics workflows and end-user usability.
* Build robust and scalable data pipelines to support business intelligence and analytics needs.
* Collaborate closely with internal stakeholders, such as Risk, Finance, and IT, to ensure data solutions align with business needs.
* Ensure data quality, security, and compliance throughout the analytics lifecycle.
* Drive technical improvements, introducing modern tools and processes to enhance analytics capabilities.
* Partner with other engineers to align transformation processes for analytics purposes.


**We Are Looking For Someone Who**
 Enjoys working with data & analytics engineering, modern data practices, and creating insights that drive decisions. We believe you are a detail-oriented and proactive person who thrives in a collaborative environment and enjoy learning new technologies. You approach challenges with a “can-do” attitude and excel in analytical thinking and problem-solving. For this role you’ll need:
   

  

* Work experience in a similar role within data engineering or analytics engineering
* An academic degree related to analytics engineering, data engineering, or similar fields.
* Proficiency in ETL processes, designing analytics-ready datasets, and ensuring clean and usable data for stakeholders.
* Proficiency in Databricks, dbt (SQL), python and related reporting tools and languages.
* Experience with Power BI or similar BI tools.
* Strong English skills, with proficiency in Swedish and/or Norwegian.


**It’s a Plus If You Have**
* Experience with Microsoft’s data stack (Azure, SQL, and other cloud services).
* A background in data roles within the financial sector.
* Knowledge of Agile and Scrum methodologies.


**Our Offer To You**
* Freedom with Responsibility: Flexible working arrangements to suit your work style.
* Career Development: Opportunities to grow and develop in your role.
* Feedback Culture: A supportive environment that encourages open communication.
* Coaching Leadership: Managers who guide and support your career journey.
* A Caring Company Culture: We genuinely care about each other!


 In addition to this, it is important to us that you recognize yourself in our values:
 **we are wholehearted, we collaborate and we take the lead.**
**Have you heard of NOBAVERSE?**
 In our NOBAVERSE, we value openness, trust, and diversity. Here, you can influence your own development and have fun along the way to achieving our goals – all in a workplace that’s a little extra
 *bubbly* 
 ! ✨
   

  

 Read more about our employee value proposition on our careers page.
   

  

**Read more about how our recruitment process works in the FAQ.**
 We care for your privacy and, with reference to the GDPR, would like to ask you not to include any sensitive personal data in your application, for examples information about ethnic origin, political opinions, religious beliefs or information about your health.
   

  

**Read more about how we handle your personal data here.**
 If you have any questions or concerns about the position, please contact the responsible recruiter.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application! 🙏✨

title: Account Manager
description:
**Join Our Scaleup Journey & Fuel Your Curiosity!**
 At Lime Go, a thriving scaleup under Lime Technologies Sweden AB (publ), you’ll be part of a fast-moving, entrepreneurial team with the backing of a successful, publicly listed company. It's the best of both worlds – the agility of a startup and the stability of an industry leader with a proven track record of success.
   

  

**Who We’re Looking For**
* A curiosity-driven, growth-oriented mindset ready to scale with us
* Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills
* Sharp problem-solving abilities


**Your Role in Our Team**
* Own the entire sales process, from prospecting to closing and handover
* Target ideal customers across industries and regions
* Get creative with omnichannel outreach and inbound leads to build your pipeline
* Tailor our Data-driven Sales CRM to fit each customer’s needs – demo both online and in-person
* Negotiate to win larger deals faster, smashing your sales goals in the process


**The Product**
 Lime Go is a Data-Enriched Sales CRM built for SMBs in the Nordics. You’ll be selling to sales teams who understand the value of what we offer. With over 1,000 customers in Sweden, Norway, and Denmark, our aim is to become the top choice for ambitious companies across Europe.
   

  

 We’ve just completed a full product revamp, making Lime Go a fresh, modern, and powerful tool for your customers.
   

  

**The Lime Go Team**
 We’re a close-knit, ambitious team of 24 with bold growth goals for the coming years. We’re looking for a cornerstone player like you to help make it happen.
   

  

**Requirements**
**Skills & Requirements** 
**Requirements**
* B2B sales experience, preferably 1+ years of selling complex products/services (bonus if SaaS!)
* Bachelor’s degree
* Driver's license
* Willing to work from our office in Stockholm
* Fluent in Swedish and English
* A proven track record of sales excellence


 You’ll report to Jonas (Sales Manager) and have weekly 1-on-1s, plus collaborate with our 11-member Revenue Operations team (Sales, CS, Product - all in Stockholm!).
   

  

**Perks & Benefits**
* Competitive base salary with performance-based commissions (with kicker levels!)
* 6 weeks of vacation, company conferences and parties, wellness allowance, pension, and more
* A fun, collaborative environment with regular team activities and laughs


**The Application Process**
* Screening call with the team
* Interview
* Case assignment to pitch our product
* In-depth interview(s) with team members
* Reference check
* Agreement walkthrough
* Final interview with Lime Group’s CEO and/or Business Unit Director.


 Don’t wait – apply now and start your journey with us. Europe is ready for Lime Go. Are you?
   

  

 Let’s Go! 🚀

title: Software Engineer
description:
Sinch is a global customer engagement platform that provides communication services for businesses across messaging, voice, and email. Sinch's services are used by more than 150,000 businesses, including many of the world's largest tech companies.
 



**ABOUT SINCH** 




 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses - including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others - rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
 



 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
 



 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
 



**DESCRIPTION** 




 We are looking for a versatile Software Engineer to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will work closely with engineers, product managers, and stakeholders to design, develop, maintain, and support high-quality, scalable software solutions to meet customer needs.
 



 You will be an integral part of a collaborative team that embraces agile methodologies and values clean coding practices. Creativity and innovation are key, and we believe that every team member's input is vital for delivering exceptional communication solutions.
 



 This hybrid role based in Stockholm and reports to the Senior Engineering Manager.
 



**As our Software Engineer, you will:** 



* Design, develop, test, and maintain software applications and systems.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features.
* Troubleshoot and debug applications to optimize performance and enhance user experience.
* Contribute to all phases of the development lifecycle, from concept to implementation.
* Ensure performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications.
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
* Proven experience as a Software Engineer.
* Good understanding of software development methodologies (Agile, Scrum, etc.).
* Strong proficiency in Java programming languages.
* Experience of REST APIs.
* Knowledge of Kubernetes, cloud technologies, CI/CD, automation, and pipelines.
* Experience in Apache Kafka.
* Familiarity with version control systems, such as Git.



**REQUIREMENTS** 




 You are a problem-solver with keen attention to detail, strong communication skills, and a proven ability to collaborate effectively in team environments. We believe you are strong in Java but also willing to accept not to program in Java if that is the current need. You learn new domains quickly and are willing to take on and complete assignments in new areas as needed. You are creative and think outside the box but also understand when there is a need to stay within the box when reality so demands.
 


* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
* Proven experience as a Software Engineer.
* Good understanding of software development methodologies (Agile, Scrum, etc.).
* Strong proficiency in Java programming languages.
* Experience of REST APIs.
* Knowledge of Kubernetes, cloud technologies, CI/CD, automation, and pipelines.
* Experience in Apache Kafka.
* Familiarity with version control systems, such as Git.



 Our corporate language is English, please submit your application in
 **English.** 




 At Sinch, we value learning, embrace change, and offer opportunities for personal and professional growth. Unfortunately, we are not supporting relocation at this time.
 



 Applicants must:
 


* Hold Swedish or EU/EEA citizenship.
* Have a valid Swedish work permit.



**OUR HIRING PROCESS** 




 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
 



 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!
   




**Desired Skills and Experience**
 Java
   

 Software Engineer
   

 Software Development
   

 REST APIs
   

 Kubernetes
   

 Cloud Platforms
   

 CI/CD
   

 Apache Kafka
   

 Git
   

 Agile
